title: Database Programmer and Developer at University of Oxford (UK)
description:
NUFFIELD DEPARTMENT OF ORTHOPAEDICS, RHEUMATOLOGY AND MUSCULOSKELETAL SCIENCES


Database Programmer and Developer (119821)


Grade 7: Salary in the range of £30,434 to £31,342 per annum


We are seeking a Database Programmer and Developer within the Nuffield Department of Orthopaedics, Rheumatology and Musculoskeletal Sciences (NDORMS) located at the Botnar Research Centre, Oxford.


You will be responsible for maintaining, expanding and developing complex software used to support several research projects run by the Epidemiology Unit as well as assessing and improving the quality of the software through appropriate testing during the development process. Duties will also include writing readable code with good documentation and developing and maintaining the Epidemiology Unit website. You will also advise other members of the group on IT methodologies and procedures.


You will have a degree in computer science or equivalent technical qualification and will be proficient in developing and maintaining web applications for data capture written in PHP using HTML5/CSS/Javascript. You will also have expertise in developing and maintaining console and web applications as well as skills in testing both console and web applications. Sound knowledge of the relational database model, SQL, data management and MySQL is essential. Knowledge of working in a mixed computing environment involving Windows and Linux servers and experience of working with confidential data and related software (e.g. TrueCrypt) would be desirable.


This is a full-time fixed term appointment for one year.


The closing date for this position is 12 noon on Friday 2 October 2015. You will be required to upload a supporting statement and CV as part of your online application.


To apply for this role and for further details, including the job description and selection criteria, please click on the link below: 


https://www.recruit.ox.ac.uk/pls/hrisliverecruit/erq_jobspec_version_4.jobspec?p_id=119821

title: FIRMWARE ENGINEER at Intel Corporation (Gdask, Polska)
description:
The Cloud Platform Group (CPG) is seeking for a Firmware Engineer. In this position you will work on low-level programming, system architecture, operating systems, device architecture and hardware design, as well as source code development, review and maintenance (C/C++), unit and system level test and verification.
You will be working on next generations products and will have an opportunity to gain experience on best in the world server technologies that will be released to the market in few years. You will be a member of a cross-functional, cross-geo team that is very process-oriented and that delivers a world class server platforms based on Intel silicon.

Your responsibilities may include but not be limited to:
- Understand feature requirements, architecture and design.
- Firmware development (mainly in C language)
- Unit Tests development
- Firmware debugging
- Firmware integration with other server HW and SW platform components, like CPU, PCH, BIOS, OS etc.

title: Data Services Engineer at Discovery Digital Networks (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Discovery Digital Networks, the premier publisher of digital-native programming for the Internet age, is looking for a Data Services Engineer with an affinity for working with data to support, evolve and expand our web and data infrastructure.


The candidate must be willing and able to function on a small team working with designers, front-end engineers and data scientists. This position will require knowledge of Python and PHP, and some familiarity with Javascript and MySQL. Experience with Amazon Web Services, Linux server administration and packages/frameworks like Flask, SQLAlchemy, React and Lumen is a plus. Successful candidates will typically have at least 3 years of experience. Ping pong skills also a plus!


We offer a competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, and a 401k matching plan, in addition to other perks.  Join our collaborative, fun, and creative work environment!


 This position is located in San Francisco, CA.


Some representative daily tasks include:



  • Maintaining and enhancing the ETL that feeds our data warehouse;

  • Building and supporting new and existing data tools and products;

  • Maintaining and developing both customer facing and internal web services;

  • Helping to improve the performance and reliability of the entire Discovery Digital Networks technology stack.


 Some possibilities for initial projects:



  • Updating data warehouse to include detailed geographic and demographic data;

  • Using machine learning algorithms to create tools to help producers create better content;

  • Creating dashboards to surface warehouse data to users.

title: Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics at New Relic (Phoenix, AZ)
description:
New Relic 
Full Stack Software Engineer, Synthetics 
Phoenix, AZ



New Relic is software analytics. Fueled by real-time data from production software, we provide clear, actionable intelligence about high-velocity web and mobile applications and their end-users. Our first, and very successful, SaaS tool for such analytics monitors real-time traffic from real users. The Next New Thing for New Relic is monitoring real-time traffic from synthetic users.



As one of the engineers building this product, you'll be designing the architecture, writing the code, and, of course, monitoring it all by automating browsers with New Relic Synthetics.



Some of the things we work on:




  • How to make the process of scripting a browser more fun and less pain

  • How to present large amounts of browser metrics to customers in a simple but meaningful way

  • How to orchestrate hundreds of browsers running synthetic transactions across the globe and ensure that all transactions are both reliable and properly sandboxed

  • How to ensure that we’re capturing all possible transaction metrics even if they appear not meaningful at first



Skills & Experience that are relevant to us:




  • Experience with browser automation technologies such as Selenium/Webdriver/Chomedriver, PhantomJS, Zombie.js, etc…

  • Open source contributions

  • Experience in a backend language like Java, Ruby, Python or Node.js (but, to be honest, we mainly use Java)

  • Experience building front-end Javascript applications (we use Angular)

  • Experience building products on Amazon Web Services and understanding of operational/uptime tradeoffs

  • A web app or API that you have played a key role in shipping

  • Success working in small and fast paced teams



How to apply: 



Please click the link below and attach your resume. In your cover letter send us examples to apps you've built and code you've posted to Github.



A little about us:



New Relic is a software analytics company that, on behalf of our customers, makes sense of billions of metrics about millions of applications, all in real time. Our comprehensive SaaS-based solution for web and mobile applications consolidates the performance monitoring data into a single, powerful interface. Our customers use New Relic every day to optimize millions of applications.



New Relic is a San Francisco Best Places to Work award winner, an Oregon “Top Workplace” award winner, named a leader in the Gartner’s 2013 & 2014 “Magic Quadrant” for APM companies, a Top 100 OnDemand Company, Best of SaaS (THINKStrategies), Top 100 Coolest Cloud Computing (CRN); 10 Cloud Management Companies to Watch (NetworkWorld) – the list of accolades goes on. More important than all of that: we provide challenging work, opportunities to learn, high quality teammates, a standard-setting product, and a company on the move.



We provide competitive compensation, equity and big-company benefits (medical, dental, etc.) - all while maintaining the energy, agility, and fun of a startup.


New Relic is most decidedly an equal opportunity employer. We eagerly seek applicants of diverse background and hire without regard to race, color, gender, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship, individuals with disabilities, age, sexual orientation, protected veterans, or any other characteristic protected by law. Note: Our stewardship of the data of many thousands of customers means that a criminal background check is required to join New Relic.  We will, nonetheless, consider qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records in accord with applicable law, including the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance.



Apply Here



PI91711714

title: Senior Designer - UI/UX experience at Loggly (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Loggly is seeking a Sr. Designer to join our Software Engineering team. Loggly is the world’s most popular cloud-based enterprise-class log management solution.  We’ve recently received $15M in new funding to accelerate our rapid growth and we’re staffing up.


Our customers send us an explosive volume of log data 7x24x365.  Our challenge?  Make it easy for our users to instantly understand what their logs are telling them. This is real-time big data that is mission critical for our customers.  Do you have the code-writing capabilities to take on this task? And to succeed in a big way? 


About the Team


The product team at Loggly believes that the quality of our software and its simplicity reflects directly on us as professionals.  And because our customers are all engineers themselves, they notice.  We’re relentless about crafting a product that is innovative, delivers a user experience that people remember and is ever faster and more robust.


As a key and senior member on our team, you will collaborate with other executives, engineers, product management, and operations. We’re a small team so every individual matters. 


Our culture is fun, fast-paced, performance-oriented, open, collegial, and we are constantly pushing the technology envelope to the edge!  All of our positions are based in the financial district of San Francisco, CA right on top of a BART and Muni stop.


 We are looking for:


We're looking for a UI / UX Designer who can help drive the interface from both a technical perspective across all of our design assets as well as CSS code. You must be a critical, inventive thinker with a clear sense of user-centered design process, an excitement for understanding and using data, and an ability to communicate your ideas effectively.


You'll lead the evolution of our product with conceptual design, but have enough respect for your craft to be able to implement pixel-perfect design. You'll champion the voice of the user by conducting ongoing research of how people are using the Loggly product - using this feedback to inform your design. You are a part of the engineering team, and should be technical enough to grow to understand the core use cases around our audience of DevOps and SysAdmins.  


 What you'll do:



  • Translate complex visions and product functionality into simple, streamlined, and elegant designs that emphasize minimal effort for our thousands of customers.

  • Create and communicate design principles and guidelines for our team to follow.

  • Deliver detailed prototypes, mockups, wireframes, and design assets. 

  • Design tools and workflows for internal teams.

  • Run design reviews with cross-functional teams and conduct usability testing with external customers.

  • Work from high-level requirements and ask the right questions to gather all relevant information to guide design direction.

  • Quickly iterate on multiple design explorations to arrive at a simple, but robust solution, accounting for complex requirements.

  • Design for current experiences while also envisioning and creating new experiences for future features.

  • Collaborate on and present work to a range of stakeholders – executives, engineers, product managers and business leaders.

  • Stay current on emerging design trends, music innovations, and broader technologies and identify opportunities to incorporate best current thinking into product designs.


 What’s Next


If you're interested in joining the team; please send us your resume. Let us know how you fit the bill for each of our requirements. Loggly is a place that values individuality, variety, and diversity. We have lots of hikers, bikers, gamers, musicians and other interesting folks so use your judgment and write to us in your own voice about your talents.  If you have a presence on the web that we can easily access where you contribute to an open source project, write a blog, or practice another craft besides designing powerful software, we’d love to hear about it.


We’ll start with an initial phone interview and based on that, we’ll invite you in to meet the team – starting with the CTO and CEO; as we said, we’re a small team and every member is important!  We hope you’ll do some research on Loggly and try out our product before you arrive.




  • Loggly is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

  • **Immigration sponsorship will be considered**

  • **NO relocation available**

  • **Must work onsite full-time in San Francisco, CA**

title: SQL Developer-Dive in, Develop and Disect Databases! at Radio Systems Corporation (PetSafe) (Knoxville, TN)
description:
Often times, we get so caught up in the day to day execution of our jobs that we forget that we should be learning and growing instead of simply doing the same tasks over and over.  THIS is your opportunity to grow. To stretch those muscles and learn new skills.  Our ERP team, is filled with dynamic people with such a varation of skill sets that you will essentially be learning something new every day.  Our question to you is: What can YOU bring to the table? What can YOU teach us?! We are eager to find out and to learn from you!  If the below job description looks like you and what you are passionate about, we want to hear from you! 


SUMMARY OF POSITION: Responsible for the technical development, maintenance of custom packages, interfaces, extensions for Oracle e-Business Suite and Cognos BI reports and cubes.


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Analyze user requirements and, based on findings, build SQL queries, procedures, packages, reports and cubes for Oracle ERP and Cognos BI applications;

  • Monitor performance of existing database objects and tune objects with worsening performance;

  • Diagnose and resolve database access and performance issues

  • Monitor and resolve issues for SQL based interfaces with external trading partners;

  • Provides expertise in software development lifecycle management (analysis, design, development, testing training, etc.) of new ERP&BI development, including reports, interfaces, business forms, data migration, user exits, and workflow;

  • Assists with understanding configuration dependencies and interrelationships between data warehouse/business intelligence tools and designs, and troubleshoots in the area with this knowledge

  • Facilitate DBA with activities in non-production instances

title: Software Engineer (Java) at EMBL-EBI (Hinxton, UK)
description:
We are seeking to recruit an experienced Software Engineer to work on the OpenMinTeD H2020 project, to create an e-infrastructure that fosters and facilitates the use of text and data mining technologies in scientific publications. You will join the Cheminformatics and Metabolism team at the European Bioinformatics Institute (EMBL-EBI) located at the Wellcome Genome Campus near Cambridge in the UK.

You will work with the OpenMinTeD consortium on the BioMedical use case for this consortium. You will also develop the curation tool for the ChEBI database at EBI and integrate the solutions produced by the OpenMinTeD consortium. Towards this end, you need to have excellent software engineering capabilities and be able to understand and implement software according to user requirements.

The EBI is part of the European Molecular Biology Laboratory (EMBL) and it is a world-leading bioinformatics centre providing biological data to the scientific community with expertise in data storage, analysis and representation. EMBL-EBI provides freely available data from life science experiments, performs basic research in computational biology and offers an extensive user training programme, supporting researchers in academic and industry.

title: Systems Engineer at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
description:
Want to work on the cutting edge of cloud computing services at massive scale?



Amazon Web Services (AWS) is looking for Systems Engineers for the AWS Database Services team in Dublin, Ireland. This team is working in the heart of AWS managing rapid growth services such as Redshift Amazon is building some of the largest distributed systems in the world and we need smart people to help plan and put together the pieces.



The Systems Engineers within our team are instrumental in creating, automating, deploying, operating and scaling a massive always-on distributed system. We are seeking passionate engineers with strong Linux systems engineering skills who pro-actively automate away problems and constantly look to improve quality of service.



The ideal candidate will have thrived in operating complex systems, diagnosing and resolving the hardest corner case problems. You are fast on your feet and excited by the challenge of working in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift quickly. In addition to your linux systems skills you will be very comfortable with networking & database technologies. You must be able to triage situations quickly and work equally well with internal engineers and external customers to bring about swift problem resolution in ways that persist and are reusable for multiple services.



You will be expected to deliver on these kinds of things in the first six to twelve months on the job:



Automate away recurring problems:

· Develop or further existing application and system management tools and processes that reduce manual efforts

· Design and participate in the development and delivery of operability-related features such as system health monitoring, diagnostics, repair, and other self-healing automation.

· Monitor the health of the fleet, automating system health, maintenance tasks, and reporting systems as needed.



Manage capacity in the face of massive growth:

· Maintain fleet inventory management, including producing, maintaining, and evolving capacity plans for various components.

· Adapt and improve operations management systems and processes to accommodate rapid and increasing growth in systems and traffic.

· Define and/or refine hardware requirements and selected designs.

· Participate in the design and execution of production acceptance tests and new hardware evaluations.

· BS Computer Science or other technical degree and/or related experience

· 5+ years of solid *NIX system administration experience

· Scripting skills in one or more of Perl, Python, Ruby, Bash or Java.



· Experience running and maintaining a 24x7 Internet-oriented production environment, preferably across multiple data centers, involving (preferably) at least hundreds of machines.

· Automation or monitoring framework experience, deployment or development

· Demonstrable expertise around specifying, designing, and/or implementing system health, performance monitoring tools, and software management tools for 24x7 environments.

· Experience with very large distributed systems such as large scale distributed database systems, storage farms, and/or horizontally scaled request processing fleets

· Experience with hardware load balancer administration, network optimization, or other related and demonstrable TCP-level experience

· A solid grasp of networking fundamentals, preferably including hands-on experience with load balancers, switches, routers, etc.



*LI-JF1

title: Systems Engineer - AWS DNS at Amazon (Dublin, Ireland)
description:
This position is based in our Development Centre in Dublin, Ireland.

Are you ready to create systems to power one of the largest e-commerce companies in the world? Amazon.com has over 70 million customers, and developers all over the world rely on our storage, compute, and virtualised services via Amazon Web Services. We support systems at massive, and ever-growing, scale. We rapidly integrate new technologies to expand our customer offerings. Our success depends on our world-class network infrastructure and our goal is to become “The Infrastructure Platform” for the world.



The AWS Infrastructure DNS team is seeking enthusiastic and talented Systems Engineers to design, build and operate the large-scale control plane software used to drive the Amazon DNS fleet. We run systems that are critical to the platforms that Amazon's global retail, AWS and Kindle businesses run upon -- the DNS services in Amazon's datacenters and integration of Amazon's systems with the likes of Amazon Route 53 to manage public DNS.



Our key challenges include reliable delivery of updates, which continually raise the bar on latency, update propagation times, and security of the DNS infrastructure. As a lead member of our growing team, you will design and develop highly visible products, be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and interact with many other engineering teams across Amazon.

Basic Qualifications

· Computer Science degree, or equivalent experience.

· Proficient in any of Python, Java, Perl, C/C++.

· Comfortable working with Linux, or other Unix operating systems.

· Obsession with delivering highly available and performant systems that surpass customer expectations.

· Have a passion for automation.



Preferred Qualifications

· Experience with REST, resilient and scalable web services and cloud environments a plus.

· Experience with agile development methodologies and DevOps environments a plus.

· Excellent knowledge of server hardware and software troubleshooting.

· Strong desire to build; sense of ownership, urgency, and drive.

title: Lead Designer at comScore (Amsterdam Zuid-Oost, Netherlands)
description:
We’re looking for an open-minded UI / UX designer, capable of taking end-user insights and business objectives and creating UIs that solve problems, drive engagement and help the end-user to effectively use our products.


You’ll be working on creating designs, UI prototypes and user interaction models for new features and improving UI / UX on our Digital Analytix product. Close collaboration with the front-end (UI) engineering team, Product Management, the central UX team and QA engineers will also be an essential part of your work.


There are a number of upcoming projects that you would also be working on, which will give you a great opportunity to try out new design and UX strategies and technologies that will help you stay at the top of your game.

title: Software Engineer (.net/Ruby) at Careerbuilder (Norcross, GA) (allows remote)
description:
Software Engineer (.net/Ruby)


The strength of our solutions and brand combined with your expertise empower us to literally change peoples’ lives!


Who We Are:
This is an exciting time at CareerBuilder as we continue the rapid growth of our global HR Software as a Service operation. Fueled by technology that is years ahead of the competition, we’re doing something the industry has never seen before: unifying the recruiter experience in one pre-hire platform that is always on, is data-driven and is easy to use. You’ll see us expand into more markets with innovative products and services that are changing the way companies recruit new talent around the world. As a Software Engineer at CareerBuilder, you’ll have the opportunity to do something extraordinary. Our employees are what drive our success and are at the very core of our identity.


Who You Are:
Software Engineers at CareerBuilder solve interesting business problems that span the range of deriving intelligence from big data, engaging job seekers on mobile devices, to building applications in the cloud.


Helping developers integrate their code with others through release management, automated testing and deployment one minute, and then showing no mercy in a vigorous game of table tennis the next –the life of a CareerBuilder Software Engineer is never dull! Bring your ideas, your skills, your object-oriented background and your quick-draw and come join our team. Pursue next-generation technologies and tools to help support the platform that is matching job opportunities with employment seekers around the globe. You’ll be given plenty of independence and autonomy with which to work, and you’ll be able to spend 10% of your time just learning new tools and languages. If you have a passion for solving complex problems, thrive in a fast-paced environment, CareerBuilder has a place for you. If you have the passion for developing cutting-edge solutions to business problems and you meet our qualifications, we want to talk with you!


As a Software Engineer, you will come up with new and innovative platform development ideas for ALM. Best of all, we participate in the open source community, which allows for plenty of flexibility and room for innovation as you experiment and tinker alongside some of the best Software Engineers in the business.


Here are some of the toys you’ll get to play with:
* REST
* Visual Studio
* Distributed Computing
* TFS and Github
* .NET 4.5
* Saucelabs
* Automated Testing
* SOA
* MVC
* Linux
* Chef
* RubyRails


Software Engineer (.net/Ruby) Job Requirements:
As a Software Engineer, you must be an excellent and self-driven problem solver, with at least 2 years of experience under your belt. You should also be a team player with a good sense of humor, good work ethic, who likes to work and brainstorm with others. You will need to be able to interact with developers as customers. And of course, you’ll also need to be able to comfortably switch between various programming languages, projects, platforms and tools.


Additional requirements for the position include:
* Bachelor’s degree, computer science or related major preferred
* Experience with high level programming languages such as C#, Java and VB.net
* Familiarity with SQL
* Possessing excellent verbal and written communication skills and the ability to convey complex ideas clearly, concisely and diplomatically
* Solid understanding of object-oriented design and development (OOA/OOD)


Model candidates will also have:
* Distributed Computing
* Knowledge of testing and testing principles
* Exposure to Scrum and Agile processes
* Knowledge of ALM
* Experience writing code using the .net framework
* Experience writing chef Cookbooks
* Experience with RubyRuby on Rails
* An excellent shot with a Nerf gun


One great way that we encourage innovation and the development of new ideas is through events such as our annual HackDay contest. This provides you with the opportunity to explore your own business improvement ideas and to present them to CareerBuilder executive leadership. (Oh, and just to make it interesting, there is a $10,000 prize if you come up with a winning idea that provides actual business value!)


Benefits: We’re All About You!
We encourage our employees to make the most of the generous benefits we offer. Take advantage of great perks such as paid time-off for volunteering, diverse education opportunities, flexible hours, and wellness reimbursement, just to name a few. CareerBuilder.com is committed to helping employees strike a balance.


Here are just some of the amazing benefits we offer:
* Training that positions you to hit the ground running with ongoing learning and development courses; we never stop investing in our people.
* Summer Hours! Enjoy 1/2 day paid Fridays during Summer Hours
* Casual Dress Code-don’t worry about buying new suits and dry cleaning bills!
* Comprehensive Medical, Dental & Vision Programs
* Education Reimbursement Program allowing up to $5k per year towards completion of a Bachelor’s and non-MBA graduate degree, and up to $10K per year towards completion of an MBA! No strings attached!
* $400 Annual Reimbursement for Wellness Activities, including your gym membership!
* 401(k) Program with Strong Employer Match and 2 year vesting schedule!
* Five Star Company Paid Trips-if you hit your numbers, pack your bags and get ready to experience luxury!


CareerBuilder, LLC is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer. Applicants are considered for all positions without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, ancestry, marital or veteran status.

title: Software Engineer at Maritima Dominicana (Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic)
description:
Maritima Dominicana is expanding quickly. We aim to provide a seamless experience for our clients and hope to serve as a bridge between the Dominican Republic and the world. We are looking for people who can work the full stack, though they prefer to focus on the user interface and experience of the app. You want people to sit in front of the app you build and understand what it is meant to do. 


All levels of experience are welcome. The degree to which you might do more or less of something would depend on this.


With that said, this is what your job will most likely look like.


Immediate needs:



  • Refactor and repackage our systems that are currently using Non-SQL databases that are inaccessible with C# and .NET.

  • At our current pace we will be done Q1 2016. We are looking to finish sooner.


What you will be assigned at first:



  • Fix something from our list of faulty UIs. Good JS chops are prized.

  • Jump onto one of our 24 applications and implement pending changes.


On-going responsibilities and longer-term projects:



  • Prepare for our 8:30 stand-ups. We do Scrumban.

  • Maintain a personal Kanban board for work assigned.

  • Ensure that the project Kanban board stays updated.

  • Packaging of our internal libraries into reusable components.

  • Lead Friday learning sessions. We know you will be learning on the job. Are you ready to teach?

  • Accommodate ongoing client-requests for integrations. We try to make the experience as seamless for our clients.

  • Forming part of our Support Center rotation. Everyone who can program helps out at the support desk. This is our way of keeping our department in sync with our business.

  • Suggest ideas and improve our systems as you see fit. If an idea is easy to build, please improve the system as soon as possible. We have a lot of warts!


You can reply to the ad or email gtk@mardom.com.

title: Software Engineer at Noom (New York, NY)
description:
You


Noom is looking for an awesome Software Engineer who's a true team player and passionate about engineering, with tons of programming experience (doesn't matter if it was at Apple or in your mom’s basement) and excellent communication skills. A CS background or degree usually helps a lot, but is not a strict requirement if you really know your stuff.


Our Tech


At our core, we are a team of great engineers from world-class companies, so we take our tech very seriously. We work to improve our tools and approaches every day -- whether pushing the envelope with automated unit-tests or writing a super-optimized data analysis framework. We don't over-engineer and also don't under-engineer -- just the right tool for the job.


We take great pride in our code because we all want to innovate quickly. We build everything from Android software to C++ image recognition, from web UI to pedometer data analysis. Our apps operate off-line, and we have built lots of client-side infrastructure to lazily load and sync data with the server. This allows us to keep the server side relatively simple while still serving millions of users: Spring/Flask, Spring MVC, mySQL/Mongo.


We run Hadoop-based machine learning to find out what makes people stick to habits, create online clustering algorithms to match people to their ideal support group, serve millions of users with many terabytes of data, and tackle many difficult challenges every day. Because we are small dev team (17 strong), working at Noom gives you the unique opportunity to both use what we have created and build many more foundational technologies.  


Our Culture


We have worked hard to build an awesome company culture, stealing a bit from Google (many of us are ex-Googlers) and improving on it to become one of Crain’s “Best Places to Work in NYC 2013”  


Our tech team works with a ton of interesting Noomers and advisers, including our in-house psychologist as well as fitness experts, physicians and researchers.  We test our prototypes on sample users, averaging 2 user-tests a day, so you’ll be able to see how real people react to your work and iterate.  So unlike most tech companies, you’ll interact with a diverse network of people.  After all, we are team of problem solvers, always interested in learning and growing.


If you’re worried about being pigeonholed, fear not.  You’ll get to choose a mission (usually for 4 - 6 months) and work on the projects you’re interested in. We also have frequent company-wide hackathons. Everyone on the team is a generalist -- we explore new frameworks, and learn them quickly. We like to learn.


We are now ready to double the size of our engineering team with some incredible engineers (read on below!).


Our Company


Noom, Inc. is a mobile solutions company focused on preventative health.


Noom's research-backed products help people achieve real, positive outcomes. Noom was awarded a grant from the National Institutes of Health (NIH) and was also recently selected as one of seven healthcare startups chosen to participate in the 2014 New York Digital Health Accelerator (NYDHA).


Noom's apps boast more than 32 million installs worldwide and its flagship app Noom Coach for Android has been the #1 top grossing Health and Fitness App since 2012 in the Google Play Store. Noom has offices in New York City, Berlin, Seoul and Tokyo.


But we need your help -- read on if you think you’ve got the stuff.


Our Products


At Noom we tackle some of the world’s biggest problems -- obesity, diabetes and heart disease.  We believe the best way to do this is by focusing on nutrition (TechCrunch) and fitness (GigaOm).  More than just counting calories, our mobile software applications offer intelligent, scientifically-backed, customized nutrition- and exercise-coaching designed to impact habits and behavior.  


Our flagship app, Noom Weight Loss Coach, has been the #1 top grossing health & fitness application since 2012.  It achieves the best outcomes in the industry with over 10 pounds lost per paid member.  How, you ask?  Great question!  It has:


* A coaching engine that generates personalized daily tasks & realtime motivational feedback;


* The world’s most accurate food database, crowd-sourced by users & instantly searchable;


* Virtual support groups created using automated clustering technology and tracked using scalable management tools.


* A focus on simplicity and friendliness, to make all of the above easy to use


* Many more features focused around guidance & motivation for our users


Our Benefits


If you want to learn how a startup really works on the inside, then Noom is the place for you. We have an incredible amount of transparency, with weekly all-company TGIFs where the wine and the information both flow freely (much to our legal counsel’s dismay).  Because you’ll have equity in the company and have to make many decisions in your work, it’s important for you to know what’s going on.  


We have an amazing chef (we love her!) who prepares gourmet lunches every day for all employees (along with afternoon smoothies and random breakfasts and dinners), a lively office with frequent visitors, and a dedicated team who work hard and play hard, with frequent offsites (beach, anyone?) and team outings (from shuffleboard to wine tasting).  We also have more cakes than is probably healthy (welcome cakes, birthday cakes, goodbye cakes and cakes just because -- no joke).


Plus health insurance (100% paid by Noom) and a 401(k). We also have a $200 wellness budget, which you can spend on everything from triathlon registration fees to massages.

title: Software Developer (1 - 5 years experience) - Multiple Openings at Power Advocate, Inc. (Boston, MA)
description:
Looking for an opportunity to work alongside the Senior Technology team of a leading-edge Big Data SaaS technology and consulting company that provides market intelligence to the energy industry? Interface with our Executives, Product Owners and Senior Software Developers? Work on a team in a culture that fosters individual responsibility and team success? Interested in emerging Big Data technologies?


If you like to work independently and be a player on a dynamic team in a SCRUM environment, if you want to expand your software development skill sets and have opportunities for career advancement, we have the job for you!


SUMMARY: PowerAdvocate is seeking a dynamic individual to join a high performing software development team. Work with code to develop functionality as requested by product owner and our customers as well as work as a key member in a self-organizing SCRUM team, which focuses on continuous improvement and short, iterative development cycles and produces 98%+ bug-free releases.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: In addition to the following, other duties may be assigned to meet business needs.



  • Analyze and design applications

  • Write software to solve problems for customers

  • Working on front-end web development using Java, jQuery, ExtJS, Css, and HTML

  • Working on back-end website service using Java development, an Oracle database, Spring, EJB, MVC, Hibernate, Solr and Single-Sign-On.

  • Have fun!

title: Software Development Engineer, AWS Benchmarking team at Amazon (Cape Town, South Africa)
description:
Are you the sort of person who enjoys building software in the cloud? Can you automate processes so that they run continuously without manual intervention? Do you get excited by the performance aspects of complex architectures and like diving deep to find answers to hard performance questions? Do you want to make an impact on millions of developers and IT professionals? If so, we would like to talk to you.



The Amazon Web Services Benchmarking team is seeking a mid- to senior-level Software Development Engineer to join us in beautiful Cape Town. Our team focuses on understanding and improving the performance and usability of AWS and ultimately the end-to-end customer experience.



Responsibilities of the role include:

  • Designing and implementing cloud-based software solutions to automatically execute performance benchmarks

  • Analysing performance metrics and reporting to business stakeholders

  • Exploring and building new ways to make performance data accessible to internal users

  • Working closely with product teams and owners to understand the performance aspects of their services

  • Identifying performance and usability issues of cloud services and driving improvements




  • Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • 3+ years software development experience

  • Fluency in one or more mainstream programming languages

  • Working knowledge of relational databases (MySQL, Oracle, or SQL Server)

  • Great communication skills, attention to detail, and sharp analytical abilities




  • Master’s Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience

  • Experience developing distributed systems

  • Experience with developing and deploying applications on Amazon Web Services or other providers

  • Experience with industry-standard performance tests

  • Experience analyzing large data sets to identify trends and outliers

title: Senior .Net Developer at ADP (Roseland, NJ)
description:
The ADP Senior Application Developer will play a key role in the understanding and translation of business needs into technical system, scope, and objectives for our corporate website www.adp.com. The Senior Developer candidate is expected to be a leader within a growing team of professionals working to drive business success throughwww.adp.com and www.adpemploymentreport.com. If you are a creative programmer looking for a challenging position in a growing team, this is the job for you.


ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Technical component of role will Encode, prepare test data, test/debug programs at various complexity levels

  • Write structured, organized, documented, and highly maintainable programs

  • Prepare test data, test scenarios and test plans that ensure programs are working correctly prior to release

  • Follows ISD/departmental standards, procedures, and project documentation requirements

  • Analyzes the requirements for programs and define the overall structure

  • Analyze system/program problems and defines solutions

  • Prepare both functional and technical specifications

  • Perform business analysis and translates into technical specifications and develop all levels of logic flow charts.

  • Provides assistance to other staff members on selected functional and technical issues

  • Prepare project plans and assist in estimating projects scheduling

  • Assists in software package evaluation and setting ISD Departmental standards and procedures

  • Monitor changes in technology and stay up-to-date on current industry trends that impact company

  • Provides support to technical user groups to resolve system problems.

  • Responsible for the analysis of systems with a focus on technical internal/external specifications, coding, testing and documentation

  • Develop specifications, modifications, and expand new and existing programs through technical analysis

  • Ability to work autonomously with minimal direction

  • Provide guidance and assists in training of less experienced Programmer Analyst associates

title: Interaction Developer at mySidewalk (Kansas City, MO)
description:
Key Characteristics:


Your work pushes you to claim a developer title before designer. You’re observant. You’re curious. It’s your data-hungry, human-centered mindset that excels at bringing analytical insights and highly creative ideas to a product. You want to work with technologies like AngularJS, Python, Django and High Charts. Your code pushes simplicity to the user as much as you provide simplicity to our design process. Forget prototyping, you’d rather play in iterations. You are mySidewalk interaction design material.

title: Automation Engineer at Logentries (Dublin, Ireland)
description: The Automation  Engineer will be part of a growing team focused on building an industry leading cloud based infrastructure. Come join a dynamic startup while learning the latest technology, Big Data, Cloud based platforms, and business analytics. You will work with other team members to build testing frameworks, insure quality of our products and develop methodology around best practices for performance and integration. The fast paced, startup culture of Logentries makes it the ideal place to advance your career and quickly gain experience in a vast variety of areas.

title: Scientific Software Deployment Engineers at D. E. Shaw Research at D. E. Shaw Research (NY, NY)
description:
Exceptional Deployment Engineers are sought to join an ambitious, well-funded high-performance computing and research group based in New York City.  These hires are expected to contribute to the development of scientific workflow systems, deployment of software and infrastructure, standardization of tools, regression testing, configuration management, and/or third-party support for our simulation tools packages.

Ideal candidates will have strong Python programming and scripting experience, exceptional communication skills, and a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open source accomplishments.  Other relevant areas of expertise might include high-throughput workflows, structured and unstructured data management and analysis, distributed systems software, software release management, automation testing, and quality assurance, but specific knowledge of any of these areas is less critical than a track record of achievement and innovation.

Our group is developing multiple generations of the Anton supercomputer, a massively parallel special-purpose machine that speeds up molecular dynamics simulations by orders of magnitude and is designed in part to fundamentally transform the process of drug discovery.



If you are interested in working closely with a team of the world’s leading biologists, chemists, and computer scientists, please use the link below to submit your application materials.  We take great pride in the caliber of our team, and we offer above-market compensation.

To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/SciDev

D. E. Shaw Research is committed to building a diverse team.  We offer an intellectually rigorous and stimulating work environment that is also supportive, flexible, and welcoming.  We do not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

title: Senior Developer at Computrition Inc. (Bedford, MA)
description:
Senior Developer


Computrition Inc.


Bedford, MA


Computrition Inc. Is looking for a mid-to-senior level Software Developer to join our Product Advancement team in the continuous development and maintenance of our Hospitality Suite and Connect product lines. 


The position requires a self-motivated, detail-oriented, and focused individual. The successful candidate will have a passion for coding, learning, participating and be an active contributor to the overall success of the Product Advancement team. 


JOB RESPONSIBILITIES:



  • Work closely with Software Development team  during the full development cycle with little or no supervision

  • Collaborate with the Design team to help specify new applications

  • Review and maintain  legacy code

  • Translate business requirements into robust software solutions

  • Provide assistance to the QA team  during the testing phase of the software

  • Participate in the investigation and resolution of software defects

title: Full Stack Engineer - Budapest at Prezi.com (Budapest, Magyarország)
description:
We're looking for an engineer interested in writing and running the mission-critical backend services of Prezi and building forward thinking web experiences and interactions for our users.  


As a Full Stack Engineer, you’ll have the opportunity to work with a growing start-up, building things millions of people will see everyday. You will experience and experiment with new technologies and work with a group of people whom you can learn and keep pushing things forward. This position is located in our Budapest office.



You should be excited about:




  • Joining a team that focuses on the growth of the whole product




  • Working in a small, cross functional team with other engineers, designers, data analysts, marketing, product managers.




  • Creating customer facing applications




  • New technology and design




  • Working in a challenging, fast paced and always changing environment.




  • Working with big data





Challenges you will be working on:




  • Participate in building a microservice architecture which scales, routes around failure and lets us build complex systems out of small components as well as maintain existing web applications.




  • Run everything into the cloud (AWS), rethinking the assumptions that no longer hold in our current architecture.




  • Help us build our emerging JVM based stack (built on the Netflix open-source stack, mostly in Scala), which will power our next generation of services.




  • Open source some of the awesome things we’re working on.




  • Develop and maintain existing backend services (mostly written in Python) to ensure they are efficient, reliable and secure enough for our many million users.




  • Exploring exciting relationships, patterns, answers in our enormous data sets




  • Developing high fidelity functional prototypes to validate growth initiatives




  • Pro-actively enhancing our web platform

title: Data Scientist at Swisscom AG (Liebefeld, Schweiz)
description:
Your job When it comes to solving complex problems and finding patterns, you're the one to ask, because abstract thinking, parsimonious models and neat implementations are part of your everyday thinking.


Workplace:



Bern-Liebefeld


Level of employment:



80-100%


OE:



INI-BIX-BDM

That's why we need you
You feel at home in the world of Big Data. This makes you ideal for supporting our BI and Big Data Competency Centre in designing, developing and deploying analytical systems. Come and work with us on the Switzerland of the future.

Your responsibility
You will apply your theoretical knowledge to solve real-life complex problems. In doing so, you will develop analytical systems and services, new theoretical models as well as technological solutions and present the results in front of various stakeholders. Technology scouting and consulting and supporting other teams with regard to the optimal and secure use of these models and solutions also belong to your responsibilities. Through all this, you define and drive the further development of the Big Data cluster and to continuously innovate and enhance the software we build.

title: Senior Business Systems Analyst (Must have strong Salesforce.com experience) at CDK Global (Seattle, WA)
description:
CDK Global is seeking at Business Operations Analyst


POSITION SUMMARY


The Business Systems Analyst III provides advanced level of expertise in identifying, driving, developing and/or deploying technical systems and/or reporting solutions within the Services group. Associate is responsible for independently conducting the analysis of business issues and requests that require the creation, updating and/or enhancements to Services business systems and/or reporting solutions.


This person will apply their strong knowledge of established Services business processes to recommend appropriate solutions that help solve the identified business need(s). The BSA utilizes advanced knowledge of Salesforce, SQL, Tableau, and/or other applicable tools, technology, and business systems to perform gap analysis, document business requirements, recommend solutions, identify level of effort and deliver on complex business-critical projects. You will work directly with business and technology stakeholders, Services program management and supporting resources to identify and recommend appropriate technical solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst performs configuration and testing of agreed upon solutions as assigned. You will provide expert level of technical and business expertise to other team members including solution analysis, quality review and testing of developed solutions.


The Business Systems Analyst actively participates in business strategy discussions relating to new functionality, system solutions or other broadly scoped initiatives as assigned.


PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Business Analysis: Plans, conducts, and documents analysis efforts associated with assigned business processes and issues or initiatives that require creation of new and/or updating of existing business systems, tools and/or critical business processes. This includes managing business process review (BPR) sessions with stakeholders, documenting business requirements, providing relevant solution options and creation of functional specifications and use-cases to support any associated business system configuration or development efforts.

  • Systems/Application Support and Administration: Provides expert level of systems support, maintenance and administration for assigned systems.This includesadministration and configuration associated with assigned database, CRM, telephony or related applications and tools to ensure alignment with the requirements of the business. Provide subject matter expert to team members and stakeholders on assigned systems and other business-critical applications.

  • Reporting Development and Data Analysis. Develops, executes, and maintains assigned datasets, reports and data mining efforts specific to all core business systems supported by the Services Operations team. This includes performing expert level data and impact analysis on assigned metrics, business processes and systems to ensure accuracy and relevance to Services initiatives and business priorities.


KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, AND ABILITIES



  • Proven track record of researching and analyzing complex technical issues and then summarizing them via table, graphs, and written analysis

  • Strong verbal and interpersonal skills; exceptional writing skills demonstrated by delivering clear, correct and timely communications and effectively working with others.

  • Ability to analyze complex data or systems issues and to provide actionable recommendations to impacted teams based on the analysis

  • Ability to analyze complex business processes and identify efficiency opportunities and/or solutions to resolve process gaps or related business challenges

  • Identify, develop and document requirements that clearly support and communicate needs to Services stakeholders, IT and supporting teams

  • Ability to effectively present analysis and data findings to wide range of technical and non-technical audiences

  • Detail oriented with excellent time management and organizational skills to meet critical deadline

  • Ability to interface effectively with multiple functions/organizations and all levels of management.

  • Ability to design solutions that anticipate areas of contention and are adaptable to future changes

  • Strong data and problem solving ability

  • Ability to analyze, test and document solutions to ensure business requirements have been satisfied

  • Ability to administer data warehouse systems and other assigned systems/tools

  • Ability to effectively troubleshoot data inaccuracies, identify root causes, and take corrective action

  • Ability to effectively mentor and train associates within job family


PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS & WORK ENVIRONMENT


Duties are performed in an office environment while sitting at a desk or computer table. Duties require the manual ability to utilize a computer keyboard and the ability to read printed material. Duties may require the ability to travel via automobile or airplane. Duties may require being on call periodically and working outside of normal working hours (holidays, evenings and weekends).

title: Frontend Engineer for Onefootball at Onefootball GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
While being the latest platform launched by Onefootball, our web app is now at the centre of our sharing infrastructure and we are working hard to make it an important source of information for football fans on both mobile and desktop. This is why we are looking for a Frontend Engineer to join our team.


Your Role


You’ll join our web team and work directly on the existing code base of the web application and the related administration tools. The product is fresh enough so that we don’t have a lot of cumbersome legacy code and we follow the industry’s best practices to keep the job pleasant. We're always open to suggestions and expect you to use your own experience in improving our processes. You should be fun to work with and like to learn and teach everyday. Also we value pragmatism and intellectual curiosity. Since you'd be working closely with other teams from different departments, your job is to make sure your voice is heard both inside and outside your field of expertise.


The position is located in our awesome football office in Berlin. We offer free drinks and food and great team events such as tech talks, football public viewings, sport events, lunch roulette and of course support with relocation and Visa application processes.


Who we’re looking for


You are passionate about programming and have already successfully developed products for a large and diversified user base. You ideally have more than 4 years of experience in coding for the web, a solid background in computer science concepts and a good understanding of the entire lifecycle from design, engineering to release and maintenance.


You master unit testing and respective frontend developer tools (we use bower + grunt + less but any similar variation is fine). You have a good comprehension of browser performances, UX across multiple screen sizes and you are attentive to details. Ideally, you have gained a significant experience with AngularJS 1.x and have experience in developing for other mobile platforms as well.


If this sounds like you, we’d love to hear from you. And if you’re a football fan, all the better.

title: Experienced software developer in the field of Sustainable Energy Solutions at The Sustainables (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Experienced software developer


We are looking for a smart and driven software developer to strengthen our team to build the best photo-measurement tools and platforms in the industry. The tools and platforms we develop are used for the remote analysis of houses in order to accelerate the transition to sustainable energy.  


A few examples of our systems currently in use are:



  • Solar Remote Quote: an application used by solar panel installers to measure tilted roofs, design a solar system and create a detailed quote in less than 5 minutes.

  • Wall insulation Remote Quote: An application used to generate automated wall insulation quotes, by auto recognition of windows and remote surface measurement.

  • An application enabling home owners to create a detailed paintwork quote by taking smart-phone pictures only, supported by our database learning engine and photo auto recognition.


With the use of for example 3D laser scanning imagery (LIDAR) and advanced photo measurement techniques we are always looking at ways to enhance the accuracy and user friendliness of our tools and platforms.


We offer:



  • A lot of responsibility within the R&D team to make the difference by deploying your knowledge to make sustainable energy solutions available to the general public;

  • High pace, short cycle developments, directly result driven;

  • Interesting imaging and big data set challenges;

  • A lot of flexibility and freedom of choice in the use of tooling;

  • Flexible start and finish times, or partially working from home;

  • An informal environment and motivated colleagues.

title: Web Software Engineer - Equities Technology at BATS Chi-X Europe (London, UK)
description:
You will be a highly motivated developer who will build and maintain a broad range of web applications that perform a critical role in allowing our team to control, monitor and analyse our cutting-edge trading platform. Some of our web applications process millions of requests a day and are used by our members and the investing public for presenting high quality market data.


You will be responsible for designing, developing and testing these high-performance, scalable, data-driven web applications with professional browser-based interfaces using Javascript, CSS, SQL and Python.


You will be involved in all aspects of the software development lifecycle and thrive in an environment where you deliver quality code into production on a frequent basis. We are aggressive and agile. We care about code quality. We care about testing. We care about automation. We care about the user experience.

title: Operations Engineer
description: DevOps at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
python:
Summary


Wikimedia is seeking a DevOps engineer to work on the Analytics team to help maintain and build infrastructure used to measure Wikipedia’s reach and impact.  DevOps engineers work with software engineers, technical operations, product managers and researchers to ensure they have the Big Data tools they need to improve Wikipedia for hundred of millions of people around the world.


Description



  • Perform day-to-day operational tasks (deployment, maintenance, configuration, troubleshooting) on many aspects of Wikimedia’s analytics infrastructure

  • Assist in the research, design, and implementation of Wikimedia analytics infrastructure and services

  • Implement and utilize configuration management and deployment tools (specifically puppet, salt)

  • Coordinate and communicate with other members of the Wikimedia engineering teams

  • Incident response and diagnosis of system outages or alerts

  • Write and update internal documentation of systems and processes

title: QA Engineer at Remedy Partners Inc. (New York, NY)
description:
The QA Engineer should be well-versed with automated PHP, Java and Javascript testing.  As a QA Engineer, you'll be responsible for coding and creating automated test frameworks for the various languages in use, as well as participating in the design and development of Automation test strategies, using GUI verification, User defined functions, Database verification, API testing, Smoke test sets and Functional test scripts.  Qualified candidates will have extensive experience with performance testing and providing reports on test results.



Key Responsibilities:




  • Learn from mentors and code review feedback



  • Focus of quality and repeatability



  • Consult with functional groups to understand and design requirements



  • Identify, escalate and tackle problems head on    



  • Strong analytical skills



  • Highly pragmatic with a focus on delivering business value



  • Willingness to openly debate the pros and cons of a technology or solution



  • Ability to context switch when required

title: Database Administrator at Cognitive Medical Systems (San Diego, CA)
description: We are looking for a SQL Server DBA with ability to help architect and maintain multiple databases for development and production environments. This person should also have familiarity with data access techniques across multiple platforms and have the flexibility to support non-Microsoft operating systems and tools.

title: Senior Software Engineer: Web UI Applications at Exosite (Minneapolis, MN)
description:
OVERVIEW:


At Exosite, you will be working with a top-tier team to build web-based front end applications for Exosite products.  At Exosite we love building highly responsive, engaging user experiences for this data driven world in which we live, work, learn and play.


As part of the Exosite Product Team you will have the opportunity to give input into the entire design, development and deployment life cycle of the applications you are building.  Your primary objective will be to architect and implement web-based client side application code and user interfaces within a fast paced environment that is building the next generation of products for connected devices and applications.


WHO YOU ARE:


You are primarily a software engineer that shines at programming web-based user interfaces.  You have an exceptional ability to create well-designed software that meets the marketing and user experience requirements gathered from key stakeholders.  You are satisfied with nothing less than the best, yet know how to deliver to business needs.


You have experience mentoring junior level developers and are an excellent oral and written communicator, comfortable with engaging both internal and external stakeholders.  You proactively and positively engage within a team environment to deliver software of the highest quality.


You know that documenting and testing your code is an essential part of development.  You write tests that validate the implementation of your documented design and that ensure regressions do not occur.

title: Software Engineer at Logentries (Dublin, Ireland)
description:
We are looking for talented Software Engineers with a deep interest in the analysis of data, highly scalable systems, cloud computing and open source technologies. Ideally you will have some experience with the following technologies or similar : Java, Javascript, PostgreSQL, Cassandra, Python, AWS. As much as the previous is key, a strong mind and work ethic are the most important factors. At Logentries we value intellectual curiosity, a passion for technology, initiative, and a good sense of humor.


Logentries requires a Software Engineer to work on their core platform and satellite projects in Dublin, Ireland. We will provide you with a world-class mentoring program where you will learn from a team of seriously talented software developers. You might not have a Java or Javascript background, but if you’re a disciplined software engineer who is excited to learn and use new technologies and methods then Logentries Software Engineer role is for you.




Responsibilities





  • Delivering software to the Logentries production system/ getting things done

  • Follow the team’s agile practices to create world-class software





  • Interact with other engineering teams including Product, Support and Architecture

  • Collaborate with other sprinters to plan, deliver and report on your sprint

title: Senior Software Developer - Enterprise Evaluated Pricing at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
description:
The Role:

Data License (DL) is Bloomberg's market-leading enterprise reference data product. We build and maintain high-performance systems that process & deliver billions of data points per day. Our customers are key financial players that use our products to power their trading applications, settlement, risk management, corporate action processing, and much more. As a result, they require our system to be ultra-reliable and our data to be of the highest quality. Our product lines offer a variety of programmatic interfaces to a wide range of information on nearly all types of financial instruments including fixed income, CDS, currencies, equities, and futures & options. We interact closely with our business and sales teams and have many opportunities to design and develop innovative solutions to satisfy customer demands.

The Bloomberg Valuations (BVAL) product calculates pricing for over 2 million liquid and illiquid fixed income securities at several snapshots throughout the day. DL delivers this premium evaluated pricing data with related regulatory information to enterprise customers in order to meet requirements such as Net Asset Valuation calculations. We build solutions which calculate, validate, QC and deliver millions of data points in very short amount of time to fulfill client needs throughout the day. This rapidly growing product requires a highly efficient, scalable, and fault-tolerant architecture. To address the scalability needs of this product, we are working on a proof of concept using Hadoop. We are looking to dramatically increase our regulatory statistical offering by adding a suite of new products. These new offerings will allow our clients to evaluate their portfolio risks and help them meet the many new regulatory requirements that have been introduced and are currently being legislated.

In order to help us continue expanding our market share & reach, we are looking for a software developer to help us design and implement flexible, usable, and performant systems. We need a candidate who is detail oriented, has strong communication & problem solving skills, and has the desire to work in a close-knit team environment. Our work atmosphere is fast paced, spirited, and friendly. You will have the opportunity to work with a wide variety of different technologies - C++, Python, Perl, Java, Javascript, Hadoop - whatever it takes to get the job done.

title: Integration Architect - Bloomberg Law at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
description:
The Role:

Bloomberg Law continues to expand its presence in the area of legal research by providing high-quality and innovative legal research solutions. The company is committed to bringing innovative changes in the industry to the way lawyers conduct research, keep abreast of current developments, serve their clients and attract new clients. Through BloombergLaw.com, we offer integration of legal research, news, collaboration tools and market information that is unmatched in the industry. Bloomberg Law is a unique opportunity to work for a start-up team and business unit but all the benefits of working within a large, successful and well-established company.

The R&D Bloomberg Law Integrated Solutions team is seeking a self-motivated senior software developer/architect with an interest in designing solutions for complex data problems and implementing scalable architectures to support the legal research platform. In this senior role, you will work with cross-application teams to identify cross-cutting problems and develop robust solutions toward enhancing the product and building scalable applications. The candidate must exhibit excellent problem-solving, architectural and programming skills with passion for solving large-scale data problems, quickly learning emerging technologies. The candidate should also demonstrate the ability to deliver large projects independently, while positively collaborating with different teams.

title: Software Engineer at Lyst (London, UK)
description:
Lyst are looking for software engineers who enjoy writing python to work on the huge technical challenges that come with building the world’s leading fashion commerce site.


As a software engineer you will ensure that the platform continues to over exceed shoppers expectations, helping us to constantly release new features and improve functionality. You will work in a product-led cross-discipline team on everything from helping to choose the best tools and frameworks to working with design and product exciting new features. You will have a huge chance to influence the way code, culture and product are built at Lyst.


At the heart of Lyst is a huge data aggregator that lists millions of fashion products from hundreds of retailers. On top of this we build systems that help people discover and follow their favourite fashion brands, ensuring that all of our users are inspired and happy throughout their shopping experience.


As a software engineer at Lyst some of the thing you will be working on:



  • Building real products that fix real world problems, predominantly in a Python based technology stack.

  • The huge challenges that come from working with a database with over 9 million products and a spider architecture performing 3.8 million updates a day.

  • Exposure to product specific teams fixing problems like; Shopping personalisation, Universal Checkout System, Marketing automation technology, PaaS, Our own Data Analytics platform, a new search function and personalisation etc

  • Fixing the interesting problems we face in the best way possible; we are not constricted to tool sets and languages. If you find a solution to a problem that will work better, we use your idea. Best idea wins.

  • Our universal checkout system that allows our users to find any item of clothing from any retailer on our platform, in stock, in their size and ready to buy.

  • Our internal and external REST API’s

  • Creating a development platform, tools and pipeline that is effective and easy to iterate with.

  • Building your own brand and skills. Lyst is a company that will encourage and support you to get involved in the wider community. Events like FOSDEM, PyCon, JS London are regular occurrences on our calendar.

  • Creating better solutions for everything we do, from our culture to the code. This is your company, own it.

title: Java engineer at Canva (Sydney, Australia)
description:
At Canva, we work everyday to make a significant positive impact on society. Our mission is to democratise design.

Since launch in April 2013 we have grown exponentially, and the journey has only just begun. Join Canva, and be part of this adventure. We are one of the world’s fastest growing startups.

Your colleagues, like you, will be the top of the industry. We mean it, when we say it is important to us that you love coming to work.

Our culture is unlike anywhere else and our offices are designed and constantly improved to let you do great work.

At Canva you can be part of a company that is growing rapidly, building a product that users really love. Just check out our Twitter stream.

Engineering is a core part of who we are. We work hard to have a best of breed engineering culture. You will work with a carefully selected team of ex-Google, VMware, ThoughtWorks, and Atlassian engineers. Foremost; the engineering team takes pride in it’s focus and prioritisation around engineering fundamentals. The team strives to use the most appropriate tools for the tasks at hand, and to strike a measured balance between getting things done and long term maintainability. The team is tight, with no big egos, and welcome self-driven engineers to come and join in on the adventure.

We run Java+Python , using a mix of SQL and NoSQL stores.

title: Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV at SUPERNAP (Las Vegas, NV)
description:
Join SUPERNAP - A Switch Company
Switch, the developer of SUPERNAP data centers, is the revolutionary technology solutions company led by inventor and solutionist Rob Roy. As Founder and CEO he holds 218 patents and patents pending that have produced an essential and future-forward transformation in data center architecture, engineering, technology and operations. His vision also resulted in the creation of the SUPERNAP CORE Cooperative. It is the world’s only $3 trillion independent purchasing and collaboration ecosystem, guided by the company’s unique operating ideology called Truth in Technology.

Designed by Rob Roy, the Switch award-winning Tier IV Gold SUPERNAP data centers are certified as the highest-ranking colocation data centers in the world and are maintained by the highest-rated mission critical operations teams. With more on-net, independent cloud providers than any other physical cloud gateway, SUPERNAP connects thousands of clients and providers from within the facility. SUPERNAP is the recognized world leader in colocation design, development and mission critical operations.

SUPERNAP, with clients ranging from sophisticated startups to Fortune 100 powerhouses, enables unparalleled mission critical solutions that make a difference in innovation, ROI and communities as a whole.

Perl Software Engineer - Las Vegas, NV

The purpose of this position is to design, architect, develop and test new web-based software applications and address issues with production systems, while also providing technical research, support and training as necessary. The ideal candidate will have a hard time placing a title on their skill set because besides being a Perl rockstar, they are also revered as a Linux Engineer, have a very respectable amount of network knowledge, and are just as good at "putting out fires" as they are with developing new code.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:



  • Responsible for architecting, developing, and testing new web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Improve, fix, and test production web-based applications in Object Oriented Perl.

  • Utilize MySQL and DBI for data storage and retrieval within Perl applications.

  • Make technical recommendations based upon the current production applications and future applications.

  • Discuss and clearly articulate complex technical topics with technical and non-technical staff, and occasionally customers.

  • Eager to interact with other teams and departments, as well as customer facing and commercial teams.

  • Source control (GIT, SVN, CVS, etc.) experience.

  • Knowledge of PC LOAD LETTER.

  • Good sense of humor.
