title: Full Stack .NET Developer at Springbit, Inc. (Johns Creek, GA)
description:
How about an opportunity to play an important role on a small software development team in Johns Creek, GA? Maybe you live nearby and would like to shorten your commute? Maybe you want to work with a number of Microsoft development tools and technologies and some of the best open source software?


This team works on web apps built with ASP.Net MVC, ASP.Net Web API, Twitter Bootstrap, JQuery, and Angular. They work with Windows apps built with WPF and MVVM. They work with mobile apps built with Xamarin. And it's all backed by a DDD-influenced architecture with data in SQL Server 2012.


All new code is written in C#. Some open source projects that are heavily used are Castle, NHibernate, FluentNHibernate, log4Net, MassTransit, Topshelf, and Dapper.


There is a seemingly-endless supply of new project work in the pipeline that will be built using the technologies mentioned above and we need you to help get those projects done. In addition to coding, you'll participate in daily stand ups, design meetings, and customer review meetings. Full disclosure: some support of existing systems will be expected.


The developers work in an open, but respectfully quiet, environment with fast, new computers and dual monitors. Free snacks abound and flexible hours can be arranged. This small development team does work hard, but they have fun too. There are regular beer nights and the team has also been known to cut out a little early on occasion for a random TopGolf outing.


This is a contract only position and pays a very competitive rate.  Someone that fits in well will likely have the opportunity for contract renewal or possibly to convert to full-time.


Local candidates only please. Candidate is needed onsite in Johns Creek, GA.

title: Front End Web Developer with PHP Experience to Help Build Our Betting Platform! at BetBright (Dublin, Ireland)
description:
We are looking for an experienced PHP developer to join our ever-growing development team. As a PHP developer, you will be delivering quality user-friendly software for BetBright using your seriously awesome programming skills (for real).


As one of our developers, you get the requirements of a start-up environment with its fast-paced, changing nature and you are keen to continue adapting and developing your skill set- while keeping up to date with existing and emerging technologies.


You will be:


•       Developing high quality, efficient code to meet business needs


•       Designing and developing websites ensuring strong optimization and functionality


•       Taking ownership and providing expertise to the business in the products you develop.


•       Liaising with the delivery manager to release software to our production environments


•       Functionally testing all developed code to a very high standard to enable QA to test efficiently


•       Researching and proposing appropriate new technologies to meet business challenges


•       Developing websites with high levels of usability targeting specific audiences


•       Reporting on progress daily via daily stand up


•       Supporting all development streams i.e. BAU, critical issues, projects etc


•       Analysing, reviewing and modifying web systems by maintaining, documenting, testing, developing and monitoring

title: Software Developer - Planning and Scheduling Systems at Tracsis plc (Leeds, UK)
description:
A talented software developer is sought to join our fast growing, successful software company which specialises in resource planning and scheduling software applications for the public transport industry.


The role will see the successful candidate interpret business requirements to develop and deliver high quality, customer focused applications and technical solutions. Working as part of an agile team, the role includes all aspects of the software lifecycle, from assessing business requirements and design through to testing, deployment and maintenance. We strongly encourage proactive learning, and personal development. We emphasise good technical practices and value long-term quality and continuous improvement.


Both recent graduates and experienced developers will be considered for this role. Candidates must hold a 2.1 or higher degree in Computing, Science, Engineering or Mathematics or a related discipline.

title: Technical Project Manager at American Express (New York, NY)
description:
American Express is embarking on an exciting transformation driven by an energetic new team of high performers. This group is nimble and creative with the power to shape our technology and product roadmap. If you have the talent and desire to deliver innovative payment products and services at a rapid pace, serving our customers seamlessly across physical, digital, mobile, and social media, join our transformation team!

Technical Project Managers that join our Technologies team can be assigned to one of several exciting teams that are developing new virtual, Internet-based payment solutions, customer service portals, online merchant services support and integration, credit management tools, and suites of web-based applications for cardmember targeted offers that will span over 20 international markets.

You will be part of a fast-paced, entrepreneurial team responsible for delivering world class cardmember experiences across multiple channels, including native iOS, Android, web, social integration, Java services, and APIs. You will be challenged with identifying innovative ideas and proof of concept to deliver against the existing and future needs of our customers.

Responsibilities include, but are not limited to:

  • Drives integrated teams to deliver technology solutions in support of key product initiatives by working closely with product owners, architects, engineers, and quality assurance

  • Works within and across business units to prioritize, plan, and execute the development schedule for major product releases

  • Manages and tracks team velocity, financials, and other KPIs in relation to the plan and published progress reports

  • Assigns development resources to activities, and monitors performance across resource channels

  • Maintains dependency plan between planned sprints across engineering, infrastructure, and third parties

  • Manages, and appropriately escalates, delivery impediments, risks, issues, and changes tied to the product development initiatives

  • May perform hands-on reviews of product backlog, designs, code, test scripts, and results in addressing delivery impediments or product quality issues

  • Ensures deliverables across engineering teams are high quality and clearly documented

  • Conducts daily stand-ups and retrospectives at the end of each sprint, and ensures that the team is continuously learning from the past

  • Identifies opportunities to adopt innovative technologies

  • This rebel with a cause looks beyond the obvious for continuous improvement opportunities

Qualifications

This high energy Technical Project Manager must have:



6+ years of technical project management experience


Deep understanding of all aspects of software design with a demonstrated track record of increasing responsibility


Coding experience and ability to review code with team members and help drive solutions


Experience managing Agile, Scrum, or other rapid application development teams to deliver technology solutions that meet customer expectations for timeliness and quality


Experience managing project budgets and reporting


Excellent oral and written communication skills; Ability to effectively communicate across third parties and technical and business product managers


Ability to get industry leading solutions to market efficiently and effectively


Experience in clarifying objectives, dealing with ambiguity/under-defined problems, advocating for simplification, and influencing teams


Ability to enable business capabilities through innovation


Demonstrated willingness to learn new technologies and takes pride in how fast they develop working software


Bachelor's or master's degree in computer science, computer engineering, or other technical discipline, or equivalent work experience, is preferred


PMI certification is a plus


Scrum Master certification is a plus


Experience using Rally agile delivery management platform is a plus


Experience with object-oriented design and coding skills across a variety of platforms (JAVA, HTML5, BLAZE, DB2, XML, and Mainframe) is a plus


Experience with web services and open API development, as well as SOA concepts, is a plus


Experience with payments technology and industry is a plus


MG2A

title: Java software developer at AdClear GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
We are looking for a reliable, responsible and motivated Senior Java software developer in the field of BigData and AdAnalytics.


AdClear is a growing Berlin start-up and one of the leading AdAnalytics and customer journey analysis providers. AdClear offers an integrated system for tracking, analysis and optimization of the complete online marketing.


What we offer:



  • Participation in an open-minded, creative and successful berlin based team (start-up spirit!)

  • Working with the latest technologies in an agile development process

  • Portfolio of large national and international clients/brands

  • Development of innovative, straight-forward new products as well as customer requested customer journey related derivatives

  • Excellent personal and technical development opportunities


Your job:



  • You will be part of our developers team and you will be responsible for developing sophisticated solutions for our national and international clients

  • Implementation of Java software components and transform legacy code into state-of-the art code

  • You will be responsible for our core tracking technology and develop it to the next stage

  • Statistical, heuristical and programmatically deal with Big Data

  • Research and evaluation of new technologies

  • Team Lead

  • Full time position

title: Senior Linux System Administrator at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online hotel reservation service in the world) and/or its various support companies throughout the world are looking for people to support the business in the fast-growing hotel markets.


We are looking for a Senior Linux System Administrator to join our headquarters in Amsterdam, NL. As a member of our IT Production Team you’ll be given the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements impacting millions of people. You’ll be working on 7000+ boxes placed in different live operating data centers around the world. You will be part of one of the biggest e-commerce companies in the world and work with some of our industry’s smartest people. You will work on a wide range of technologies which include UNIX, Linux, CentOS, puppet, chef, Perl, Python and more. By proactively thinking about scalability we can ensure the growth of Booking.com.


B.responsible


Booking.com is all about teamwork and it's what keeps us motivated. We push the limits of our open source technology stack as we solve the challenges that come along with scaling to meet the phenomenal growth of Booking.com. As a Senior Linux System Administrator you will:



  • Combine your knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to support and maintain a world-class infrastructure and to enable our continued growth

  • Analyze, monitor, configure, and maintain the existing system and identify possibilities for improvement;

  • Ensure the reliability and continuity of our global systems;

  • Cooperate with other System Administrators, Engineers, DBA’s, Developers and Product Owners during projects;

  • Research, deploy and implement new systems and solutions, for example on automation or scalability;

  • Advanced troubleshooting;

title: Operations Engineer at Cloudreach Europe Limited (Edinburgh, UK)
description:
Cloudreach are Europe’s only top tier partner of choice for both Amazon Web Services & Google - the giants of the cloud computing industry. We’re the best at what we do. We provide a range of valued services to the Enterprise, and we see the need to recruit a number of highly technical and dynamic individuals to help us maintain our reputation and continuous customer satisfaction as we continue to grow in the cloud !!



Why do you want to work with us?



  • You want to be one step ahead: The future of IT is in the cloud, and we work with the leaders in this space. You will get exposure to new technology and new data analytics tools.

  • You want interesting work: This role is complex and analytical, with the chance to become an excellent data modeller and to work both with internal teams and directly with clients. You will endeavour to automate any repetitive tasks.

  • You want a progressive culture: The established culture is friendly, with a lot of banter and we firmly believe that work should be fun. At the same time we value personal growth and understand that a great organisation is one made up of diverse individuals.

  • You want to broaden your knowledge of food or drink: We’re in the heart of Edinburgh, next to some of the oldest and best restaurants and pubs in the UK. We regularly go out for lunch and after work as a team. And if you’re not up for a wee jaunt to the pub, there’s always beer and juice in the fridge.



What we are looking for?

Cloudreach is looking for a number of capable sysadmin engineers or developers who have a passion for operations with 3-5 years relevant experience who are keen to grow their technical and business skills in a fast growing company. We’d like to see someone who has had exposure to infrastructure with automation. If you are curious about the Cloud and have possibly dabbled with AWS and Google Apps we want to speak to you. We subscribe to the concept of "DevOps", where we use development skills in the operational environment in order to increase service quality. Typically our customers use an extensive array of technology running on either Linux (with Open Source) or the Microsoft stack.
The beauty of this role is that as the hardware layer is abstracted, you focus on honing your technical skills, and the interesting stuff, rather the heavy lifting. The intent is to fix or work around the root cause of operational issues, so that they do not reoccur.

You will be working with the following new technologies (and more):



  • Linux / Open Source

  • Microsoft technologies

  • Management of and automation of management of these systems

  • Amazon Elastic Computing cloud

  • Google Apps



Responsibilities



  • Action incident / problem cases related to the support of customer systems in line with Service Level Agreements

  • Liaise with customer directly in the case of major incidents

  • Carry out pro-active maintenance

  • Action service requests

  • Ensure knowledge of the platforms is accurately maintained

  • Produce statistical information as required to support ITIL reports

  • Assist in customer migrations by Service Delivery teams (to Google Apps / Amazon Web Services)

title: Software Development Engineer - Machine Learning at Workday (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Please Note: 
- This position requires existing work-authorization in the United States.
- If you don't already have U.S. work authorization, please don't submit your resume.


About the Team:
SYMAN is the agile data-engineering team within Workday. We build predictive analytics into Workday’s applications to help the world’s largest companies make strategic decisions about their people and finances. We are the former Identified team recently acquired by Workday.


This is an opportunity to contribute to the technology behind data normalization, search relevance, recommendation systems, and machine learning. And you’ll need to accomplish all this while achieving horizontal scalability and high availability.


We have retained our startup culture and are continuing to apply our agile principles within the larger organization. We don’t believe in QA for the kind of work we do, so the burden of quality falls on the developers. We practice scrum, pair programming, extensive automated testing, and continuous deployment. We expect that you have 3-5 years’ experience and a CS related degree.


Does this describe you working on a new generation data development team in a fast pace environment? If yes, please apply!

title: Lead Systems Developer at Tennessee Housing Development Agency (Nashville, TN)
description:
LEAD SYSTEMS DEVELOPER



APPLICATION DEADLINE IS SUNDAY, SEPTEMBER 27, 2015 AT 11:59 P.M.



Division: Information Technology


Reports to: Director of Information Technology 


Location: Nashville, TN


Full-time/Part-time: Full-time


Salary Grade: 43


Monthly Salary Range Minimum: $5,984


FLSA Classification: Exempt (03)


Note: eligible for telecommuting up to two days a week depending on workload and current projects



Critical features of this job are described under the headings below. They may be subject to change due to changes in our business processes or other business-related reasons.



POSITION SUMMARY:  Performs the role of Lead Developer on all programming projects, including the establishment, communication and enforcement of coding standards, reviewing the work of team members, and performing key, advanced code development where necessary to ensure consistent delivery of high-quality services and products to THDA staff.



ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES


Essential duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.



  • Trains and coaches all developer positions, developing staff skills and encouraging growth and development; makes assignments and monitors work progress.



  • Performs the role of Lead Developer on all programming projects, including the communication and enforcement of coding standards, reviewing the work of team members, and performing key, advanced code development where necessary.

  • Develops and enforces all programming procedures and standards with the oversight of the Director of Information Technology; uses industry best practices surrounding the Agile System Development Life Cycle (SDLC) methodology.

  • Exercises a knowledge of project management and software development techniques and works closely with Project Manager to complete the requirements of software applications; examines project deliverables in a timely manner for adherence to organization standards to ensure that user and system requirements are met.

  • May conduct reviews with users of preliminary system design products and plans; reviews program design to ensure compatibility with needs and business requirements.

  • May investigate the availability of application software packages that will accomplish proposed system or program goals, researching and evaluating similar systems and participating in vendor demos to determine if existing software may meet user requirements.

  • Creates database objects, user interface code, business logic, reports, Structured Query Language (SQL) scripts and stored procedures, and other code required to implement systems; creates, defines, and implements application frameworks.

  • Resolves problems encountered in the use of THDA-developed applications, which can include working with other Information Technology staff; de-bugs computer programs selecting approriate application development languages and troubleshooting tools.

  • Maintains technical knowledge of software development techniques, investigating new tools and utilities for software development as necessary.

title: Senior Python Engineer  (Sunnyvale, CA) at Simply Hired (Sunnyvale, CA)
description:
Simply Hired is seeking a talented, passionate, Mid to Senior-level Web Apps Engineer to refine, evolve and innovate new features for our next generation search experience that will help job seekers everywhere find a job that they love.


The Role:

As a member of the Web Applications team, you’ll be responsible for refining, evolving and innovating new features to improve the speed and functionality of our software applications.  By utilizing your expertise with all aspects of the software development lifecycle (architecture through release) and your strong coding skills, you will influence internal teams to develop software that will take our job seeker experience to the next level.  

Responsibilities:



  • Research and validate key technology decisions for our core applications and customer facing offerings

  • Work with senior team members to define technical scope of products and their features

  • Actively contribute to software development (using open-source software, such as Python/Django, PHP,  and TCP/IP, HTTP, etc.) that engages and delights our users

  • Implement and test core components

  • Create new applications which leverage our core infrastructure in new and exciting ways

  • Create slick and fast front-ends for our consumer site, partner portals, and monetization system

  • Bring SDLC best practices to our web applications development team

  • Work with Operations team to ensure smooth deployment of product releases and updates

title: Automation Quality Assurance Engineer at VMware Bulgaria (Sofia, Bulgaria)
description:
VMware is the leader in cloud infrastructure, business mobility and virtualization software. A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

With 2014 revenues of $6.04 billion, VMware has more than 500,000 customers, 75,000 partners, and 18,000+ employees in 120+ locations around the world. At the core of what we do are our employees who deeply value execution, passion, integrity, customers, and community. Want to be part of a compassionate community that thrives on architecting what's next in IT?

Responsibilities:

• Work in SDDC [Software-Defined Data Center] Solution Quality Engineering team to Design and qualify SDDC Solutions for various customers including the non-functional attributes like performance, security, interoperability, etc., in Cloud environment
• Support in design and validation of Federation Enterprise Hybrid Cloud and VVRD [VMware Validated Reference Design] document, as part of Agile groups
• Identify the potential integration/interOp challenges from reading PRD and functional spec. of involved products, talking with customers, field engineers and internal customer to understand the interoperability requirement for products in suite, towards SDDC Deployments. Write SDDC level integration/interOp test plans, test specifications, and certify integration/interOp requirements
• Ensure test environment reflects the operating environment of our customers Design and implement the customer test beds and End to End applications/various workloads simulated from a customer environment, documented in Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design and execution of automation scripts to support Automation of E2E workflows/use cases derived out of Federation EHC and VVRD
• Design Interoperability/compatibility Test Matrix and Requirements-based use cases, Test execution, reporting and tracking the overall progress, analyze risks and come up with the mitigation proposals
• Work with the required stake holders to escalate/resolve open issues
• Have an excellent Customer Focus related testing and develop Customer use cases in order to have our products work in customer like environments
• Deep understanding of customers through use cases, Alpha, Beta, IT use and the validation of those use cases
• Need to build very tight relationships with the field in collecting feedback and by sharing engineering expertise
• Co-ordinate with development and test teams for SDDC Solution testing across various VMware products and 3rd party products
• Support the BU vision of multiple SDDC Deployments
• Drive implementation of End to End Automation of customer workflows/use cases
• Act as a customer advocate, looking for innovative ways to improve current quality processes and procedures
• Mentor junior engineers

Requirements:

• BS in Computer Science or Computer Engineering, Master is preferred
• Experience in testing in an enterprise or system level environment
• Positive mindset, excellent attitude, energetic, motivated, sharp learner, dedicated and hard working
• Experience and knowledge in automation frameworks is a must
• Strong experience in gathering test/use case requirement from customers, PMs and reading spec., familiar with risk based test design, test cases (automation/manual) implementation and execution, test resource/planning knowledge and experienced in Solution level, Integration and InterOp testing
• Passionate about quality
• Good understanding about the best practices, SDLC/SQLC processes, methodologies of QE, detail oriented and good follow through skill
• Manage activities to meet their delivery dates and publish the testing status report to different functional teams, management, project, engineering etc. clearly on regular basis
• Experience in testing Cloud solutions
• Possess the in-depth knowledge of Operating Systems (Windows/Linux/Unix) and one or more of the following areas: System administration, Networking and transport protocols, Storage (SAN) and file systems technology
• Strong analytical skill, critical thinking and debugging/trouble shooting skills with initial triaging of software/hardware failures
• Strong collaboration skills, good leadership and initiative to work with teams which might cross different business units, departments and partners to finish the end to end product integration/interOp testing independently
• Excellent written and verbal English communication skills
• VMware product experience is a plus

VMware offers:

• Attractive compensation package - competitive salary, flexible bonus scheme, company sponsored mobile phone plan and additional long term incentives
• Individual career path - management and technical career growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular performance assessment, teams of world-wide IT professionals
• Healthy work environment - company sponsored medical program, food and beverage program, sport activities, open communication
• Work-life balance – 25 days paid vacation, regular team buildings and celebrations

Before you join, VMware will require you to go through a pre-employment screening process.

All applications will be treated with strict confidentiality.


No visa or work permit requirements for EU citizens or EU work permit holders

A pioneer in the use of virtualization and policy-driven automation technologies, VMware simplifies IT complexity across the entire data center to the virtual workplace, empowering customers with solutions in the software-defined data center to hybrid cloud computing and the mobile workspace.

title: IOS Developer at ICT Automatisering (Eindhoven, Netherlands)
description:
iOS Developer: Creative mind in app development
Eindhoven, The Netherlands, 32-40 hours/week

The job
The mobile app development team is a relatively new group within ICT, consisting of an international group of colleagues, English is the team language. As we are looking to grow the opportunities within mobile development, we now have a position as senior iOS developer available. However, we are not just looking for a developer, we are looking for a creative thinker who has the ability to work on Proof of Concepts, communicate with our clients at a business level and inspire the team.

Our main focus areas are Smart Manufacturing, Smart Energy and Global Health. The biggest challenge the app team faces whilst building their apps is the human interaction with data and smart machine control. To develop the best interfaces, you have to be able to get into the user’s mind. This ability is something we are really hoping to find in our new iOS developer!

title: Software Engineer Team Lead - Hadoop at trivago GmbH (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
description:
Join our team and actively shape the technical future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with top-notch technologies in a unique work environment with exciting career perspectives. Enjoy the freedom to question established processes, broaden your horizon and develop new things to impress our 80 million users per month!

Due to trivago’s rapid international growth we are now creating an exciting new position for a skilled developer and expert on systems level to lead, inspire and grow our Hadoop development team. In this role you’ll have the overview of our big data architecture and implement your own ideas to strategically drive our Hadoop cluster to the next level. We want someone not only to use but to build a complex Hadoop cluster and data pipeline infrastructure. If you are passionate about using technology in creative ways and enjoy playing with big data then we want to hear from you!


Your tasks:



  • As an expert in your field, you will design, implement and maintain data integration and data warehouse based solutions using Hadoop.

  • Translate business requirements into technical implementations based on systems‘ capabilities.

  • Ensure the solutions being defined are reusable and follow standard design patterns and architecture principles of Hadoop.

  • Coach and mentor a growing team in an Apache Hadoop environment. On this note you will support the recruitment process of further team members and liaise with HR to devise innovative approaches to finding the next Hadoop prodigy.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to other Software Development, Operations, Product and Business Intelligence teams to define deliverables and plans.

  • We promote thinking outside the box so we encourage you to initiate, promote and allocate the resources for technological innovations.

title: Mobile Application Developer at IT School Innovation (Pretoria, South Africa)
description: IT School Innovation is looking for a passionate and talented  developer to join our  team. You will be directly involved in developing  our flagship mobile application, used by students and teachers in our innovative e-learning environment. Working on our app is both challenging and rewarding since it involves concepts such as server communication, webviews, UI/UX design, encryption, databases, Google APIs, media player technologies etc. You will collaborate with developers working on other mobile platforms, as well as server programmers and designers, to make exciting new features happen.

title: DevOps Engineer for VC backed fast growning Start-up at Ice.com (Menlo Park, CA)
description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • Experience running a large-scale mobile and web operation
  • Experience with configuration management tools such as Ansible or Fabric
  • Strong Linux skills (Ubuntu preferred)
  • Strong Python development experience
  • Hands-on knowledge of high-availability approaches such as load balancing, failover, clustering and disaster recovery
  • Familiarity with performance and security best practices
  • Passion, drive, energy, a sense of humor and a great attitude!

Initial Responsibilities Include:

  • Build and improve platform services including web application hosting, databases, and networking
  • Automate the provisioning, configuration, scaling, and monitoring of our platform
  • Manage vendors and integrations used to deliver Ice.com services
  • 24/7 on-call rotation
  • Promote knowledge sharing and DevOps culture across our entire engineering department

Some of our Perks:

  • Entrepreneurial culture
  • Great Health care, Vision, and Dental plans
  • Build a team and product from the ground up
  • Have a suggestion? ...We would love to hear it. :)
  • Jewelry discounts for yourself, wife, or kids ;)

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

title: Professional Services Engineer at The Intellisis Corporation (San Diego, CA)
description:
Professional Services Engineer Positions in San Diego, CA and Austin, TX


Our Services Team is responsible for delivering real-time process-transformation consulting expertise to our customers as well as ensuring the successful implementation of Hermosa solutions. Each member of the team is armed with the field experience to deliver real world, real-time solutions.


We’re looking for product developers with customer-facing experience who want more direct customer interaction and experience. It’s important to be a careful listener, with the ability to demonstrate knowledge and professionalism throughout customer engagements. Successful candidates will have a Computer Science/Engineering degree and a minimum of 5 years relevant experience. This position reports to the Sr. Director of Professional Services.

title: Backend Software Engineer at Planet Labs (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Software touches every corner of our company, enabling us to continually improve every process by controlling the tools that run them. In addition to our internal tools that control the manufacturing, testing, operating and optimizing the satellites we also run a massive data processing pipeline that crunches terabytes of imagery (and will soon do that every single day). We run a cloud-first, API-driven architecture. Our goal is to enable everyone in the world to access our imagery, so huge web-scalability is a requirement. Our ‘full stack’ runs from the spacecraft to our web tools, and there are enough hard and interesting problems to keep many teams busy for a long time to come.


Our Backend Software engineers currently code primarily in C and Python. We run tens of thousands of jobs per day on an AWS infrastructure with PostgreSQL, Flask and ElasticSearch.  Our applications are built on a foundation of open source projects. We work to be active contributors of those projects and dedicated stewards of new open source image processing and infrastructure projects.

title: Android Developer - Judopayments partner with Apple Pay (contract 3 months) at Judopayments (London, UK)
description:
Do people call you The Android?  Can you work in a team of superheroes and defeat the villains group called "bugs"? 
Can you make sexy best in class features that leave competitors wondering, "who was that masked avenger"? 
Is your second name "testing" because your enemies fear you will hunt them down with unit and integration tests? 
Can the team rely on you making the right decision to defuse a crash in the last second? 
Can you leave superb documentation that rivals Stan lee? Do you have years of experience coding in the bat cave?

WE WANT YOU TO JOIN JUDO! We are looking for a contractor for 3 months with a possibility of an extension

Core skills in your utility belt? 

Work independently and with team members in a fast paced development environment. 
Assist with troubleshooting and bug fixing REST API based systems. Write precise documentation of new or existing programs to ensure effective communication. Take ownership of existing code Base and be able to create a new project following best practices and clean coding in a TDD matter. Experience in writing SDKs and libraries is beneficial.
Experience writing and executing unit and integration tests. (Working in TDD preferred). Knowledge of Java or similar languages, gradle and android studio, web programming and knowledge of Object Oriented design and design patterns.

Judo is a mobile payments start up and are one of the few payments providers chosen by Apple to launch Apple pay in the UK. Driven by a fantastic product, the latest technology and outstanding people, we've developed a business and culture which matches the huge ambition for our product, see our CEO Dennis on Bloomberg; 

http://www.bloomberg.com/news/videos/2015-01-28/mobile-payment-market-will-fragmentt-jones

If you are interested in this role then please let me know!

title: Senior Backend Engineer at Falcon Social (Copenhagen, Denmark)
description:
Falcon Social is a Software-as-a-Service provider in the Social Media Management space. We provide a unified approach for marketers, customer service specialists and hr personnel of big international brands to manage their social media presence. That means plenty of challenging engineering tasks, complex UIs to simplify and data, loads of data.


We are looking for senior members for our engineering team. You are joining an ambitious team of experts who keep pushing the limit in product delivery and experiment furiously while striving for technical excellence.


We are agile, organized ourselves into cross-functional, autonomous teams, focusing on one product with a clear mission. We intend to be flat, with everyone equal and with each member's role respected. Day-to-day you will work together with people of different trades: frontend, backend engineers, ui/ux designers, cloud operation engineers, and product owners.


We are a maturing startup with an engineering headcount of 20. We are not small anymore, and still growing rapidly. Working at a startup is the most rewarding choice that one can make, but it requires a certain personality as well. That being said, we value open people who take initiative more than lone rockstars.


Falcon Social’s frontend is a single page web application built with AngularJs, Bower, Grunt, D3.js on top of a REST flavored HTTP+JSON api served by a lightweight Java8 backend running on DropWizard, PostgreSQL, ElasticSearch, AWS, Apache Spark and Python.


This job requires extensive Java programming language experience and also the knowledge of how modern Java is done. We favor lightweight frameworks like DropWizard, we value a good domain model (DDD), we think in single responsibility (micro)services, we prefer good refactoring skills, pragmatism and craftsmanship.

title: Junior JavaScript Developers, AngularJS/Node.js (Berlin) at mycs GmbH (Berlin, Germany)
description:
Help us revolutionize e-commerce by building real-time 3D customization tools with a world class team of creative, smart and passionate people. Join us in the vibrant city of Berlin!


We are looking for enthusiastic


JUNIOR JAVASCRIPT DEVELOPERS (AngularJS/node.js/WebGL)(f/m)


As a Javascript Developer (f/m) you will play a major role in our development team and help us create a fabulous E-commerce platform with cutting edge 3D customization tools.


YOUR TASKS



  • You design and implement efficient and reusable software and web-applications for our E-commerce platform with its demanding real-time 3D customization tools

  • You work closely with our international, highly skilled and professional development team in an agile development environment

  • You identify and address performance issues

  • You train yourself continuously to ensure that your skills are up to date


OUR OFFER


Join a creative, smart, self-motivated, and experienced group of people at a successful company where your input will make a real difference. We offer a competitive compensation package, flexible working times, and great opportunity for advancement and long-term career building. We invest in the personal development of our people and provide high-end equipment for their work.


We work in short cycles in order to adapt our software continuously to our business needs. We like to use the newest available technologies and mainly use open source solutions when it comes to development. We work in small, agile teams using methodologies such as SCRUM, pair programming, TDD/BDD and continuous integration/deployment. Your ideas are always welcome, even if they mean that we have to change a lot of code to make things better. Besides a dynamic, highly motivated international team, you will find minimal hierarchies, quick decision-making and a pleasant working atmosphere.


For more details: https://mycs.com/#!/career

title: Senior Software Engineer at Indiegogo (San Francisco, CA)
description:
The Role: 
At Indiegogo, you will have the opportunity to literally change the world and people’s lives by developing new features for our consumer platform to make it even more robust. You’ll work with exceptional developers and there are lots of interesting technical challenges to tackle,including projects dealing with heavy transaction volume, scalability and data. 

You will: 
* Build a marketplace that empowers people to follow their dreams 
* Architect, design and implement beautiful, performant & scalable Ruby code 
* Create features for the international payment system which sees millions of transactions per day 
* Extend the reach of our platform APIs 
* Always staying innovative (we use Redis, Cassandra, Elasticsearch and more) 
* Work with the latest and greatest JavaScript & front­end tools: We use Angular, Gulp, Mocha, Chai, Jasmine, Karma and more 
* Work collaboratively in a fast paced XP environment ­­ pair programming, TDD, BDD, and continuous integration

title: Software Engineer at MDA Information Systems LLC (Gaithersburg, MD)
description:
MDA Information Systems LLC is hiring top-notch Software Engineers as well as System Engineers to help build the cutting-edge applications our customers need. Positions are located in Longmont, CO and Gaithersburg, MD.  This can take a lot of forms, from web-based frontends (HTML/JavScript) to distributed Oracle databases to backend image processing with heavy duty number crunching on big images.  A lot of the work has got an R&D feel to it with the stability of long-standing contracts.  We’re looking for developers that think this stuff is fun, have a sophisticated understanding of software systems and applications, and have the desire to innovate on what’s been done in the past.



If you’ve got a solid background in C++, Java, web design, or database design, we’d love to have you as part of our team.



Company: MDA Information Systems LLC is a major supplier of weather information and geospatial intelligence. The firm serves a diverse client base including commercial and governmental organizations in agriculture, energy, defense, and civilian government.



MDA is an industry leader in earth observation remote sensing technology and image processing.  We build satellite ground systems that enable users to acquire and process imagery from the most sophisticated Earth-observing satellites in the world:  much of the satellite imagery that you see on Google Maps was generated by our software!



To be qualified you must be a US Citizen and have an active TS Clearance

title: Software Developer in Test - Drivers at DataStax (Santa Clara, CA)
description:
DataStax delivers Apache Cassandra™ in a database platform purpose built for the performance and availability demands of IOT, web, and mobile applications, giving enterprises a secure always on database that remains operationally simple when scaled in a single datacenter or across multiple data centers and clouds. We are looking for a Software Engineer in Test, focusing on the drivers and tools used to develop applications against Apache Cassandra. Can be located anywhere in the United States. 



Essential Job Functions:



  • Conceptualize, develop, and execute driver and tool code tests (coverage, duration, and stress) against local and distributed Cassandra/DataStax Enterprise (DSE) clusters running on a variety of platforms.

  • Dive deep into the code base to analyze features and bug-fixes while using debugging and profiling tools. You will work hand-in-hand with development teams to define functionality and resolve issues.

  • Have the opportunity to learn new languages, tools, and processes in a dynamic, fast-paced, small team environment.

  • Set up automated build and testing tasks across varied platforms and create analysis/tracking reports.

  • Write user-facing blog posts, driver software demos, how-to tutorials, as well as debug customer issues.



Job Requirements:



  • 2+ years in a production software development role.

  • Motivated self-starter who has experience working in a distributed team that exchanges ideas via IRC and HipChat. Must possess the discipline and focus to work independently at a remote location.

  • Understand the complexities of testing in a distributed, big data environment, and place a strong emphasis on performance tuning.

  • Strong development background using C#.

  • Comfortable with code development and scripting in a Linux environment.

  • Comfortable interfacing with the open source community and having your code reviewed via github pull requests.

  • Passion for making great software in a small company setting.

  • History of learning new technologies on the fly.

  • Possess an assertive communication style.

title: Senior Software Engineer at Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. (Singapore)
description:
This role is also available in Kuala Lumpur and Jakarta with appropriate cost of living adjustments.


Citadel Technology Solutions Pte. Ltd. is a fully-funded and well-connected start-up providing cutting edge software development and hardware solutions for the next era in information technology.  


The company is looking to bring together an international team of world-class developers to deliver a highly confidential, critical IT service for a long-term, major government contract in Southeast Asia. This project will ultimately provide a high-profile system to be used by millions of users in the specified country.


Role


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be building a large scale, data intensive Web application using the latest technologies in an Agile environment. Your primary responsibilities will include:



  • Application design, engineering and development

  • Follow Agile practices, such as TDD, BDD, pair programming etc.

  • Own a set of stories and manage their end-to-end implementation

  • Work with distributed team to deliver end-to-end solution

  • Present and conduct demo for users, stakeholders, and technology groups as and when required

  • Using industry best practices to deliver quality deliverables


What We Offer



  • World-class software development facilities

  • Startup environment with minimal bureaucracy

  • Learning opportunities to acquire the latest and most advanced development skills (we invest heavily in our employee training and development)

  • Agile work culture, focused on innovation, team work, and open collaboration

  • Flexibility of job location (Singapore, Kuala Lumpur, Jakarta)

  • Greenfield development with opportunity to be involved in full Dev lifecycle

  • Health/relocation benefits available

title: Senior PL/SQL Database Developer at FUJIFILM Medical Systems, Inc. (Morrisville, NC)
description:
FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is a leading provider of diagnostic imaging products and medical informatics solutions to meet the needs of healthcare facilities today and well into the future. From an unrivaled selection of digital x-ray systems, to the Synapse® brand of PACS, RIS and cardiovascular products, to advanced women’s health imaging systems, Fujifilm has products that are ideal for any size imaging environment. The Endoscopy Division of FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. supplies high quality, technologically advanced FUJINON brand endoscopes to the medical market. FUJIFILM Medical Systems U.S.A., Inc. is headquartered in Stamford, CT with offices in the Raleigh, NC region. For more information please visit www.fujimed.comand www.fujifilmendoscopy.com.


Senior Database Developer


 Our team is looking for the person who was labeled “the over achiever”.  The one who let the cookies burn in the oven because you were busy thinking about database schemas instead of watching the timer.   Are we getting close?


 Being the first to figure things out and wants to work with complex data schemas because a challenge is why you get up and come into work every day.  And it’s why we want to talk to you.


 We’re hiring a database developer for our team and we want someone who gets a rush out of taking the lead and starting something new.


 Bigger is better!


 This position will let you work not oly on improving our current product with the latest web technologies but also being part of a team that is building an entirely new platform for our Synapse product for not just radiology but to include cardiology and other imaging modalities and suite of products.


 For starters, you’ll be working on our Synapse Cardiovascular product where you will be a hands-on database developer writing stored procedures, schemas, changing schema objects, normalizing, debugging issues on the front end and down to the database level. 


 And just when you think you’d like a little something more to do you will be doing a little performance tuning and optimization for peak performance because you love a challenge and want to figure out what locks up and how that can be fixed.


 Just in case that isn’t enough to challenge you, did we mention that we’d love for you to have some experience with C++ or C# and some .Net so you can do some middle level development on the database.


 And this is only the starting point. Whether you want to know more about the specific details of your systems or the leadership opportunities we offer, you’ll have the chance to build your skills and knowledge base from day one.

title: Software Engineer (Full-stack) at Factual (Los Angeles, CA)
description:
Factual is looking for an engineer to build out front-end-heavy applications. You’ll be developing and rolling out reactive front ends, big data backends to support them, and everything in between. We’re doing Rails, Node.js, Angular, Bootstrap, Solr, Postgres on AWS.   This role is specifically for someone who wants to build interactive web apps (vs data science or backend infrastructure) but because of the scale of the data and query volume, absolutely requires serious CS chops. This position is in Factual’s Los Angeles headquarters.
 
Responsibilities



  • Work with product and back end engineering teams to develop tools for exploring and visualizing data for our data, ad tech, and mobile personalization products

  • Develop website demos to help illustrate how our products work

  • Develop internal reporting tools and other API support tools

  • Develop high stakes, high volume API features

title: UX Designer at Windsor Circle, Inc (Durham, NC)
description:
You’re a seasoned product designer who’s eager to own the overall design for new and existing product innovations to support our 9 Pillars of Retention Automation framework.  Your breadth and prior experience gives you the confidence that you can go the distance from early concept sketches to detailed interaction designs and visual assets in order to make the Windsor Circle experience enjoyable and natural for users.


You’re excited to work across desktop, tablet, and mobile platforms to craft an overall experience that truly fits into the lives of customers.  You like working hands-on and side by side with a small team of people dedicated to making a successful product and company.  Finally, you’re confident in your design abilities but also flexible enough to make necessary adjustments based on market feedback, usage metrics, and the natural bumps inherent to an agile development process.  


Responsibilities:




  • Design highly usable and delightful user interfaces, experiences, and visuals week in and week out as part of a product team; owning both UX and visual design responsibilities




  • Develop conceptual diagrams, wireframes, visual mockups, click-throughs, or simple prototypes as needed to communicate ideas to the team and validate them with users




  • Continually refine and improve user-centered designs based on product goals, customer feedback, product metrics, and user research results




  • Assist in developing and maintaining detailed user-interface guidelines, design patterns, and style guides




  • Partner with product development teams to build enjoyable experiences; review designs with product managers and developers to spot difficulties, review new features as they are built to spot implementation gaps and identify future UX improvements




  • Present design work to large audiences at all levels within the company and lead constructive feedback discussions

title: Stream (Techstars) - Senior Python developer at Stream INC (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
About Stream

Stream (GetStream.io) is building a new kind of data store. A data store to build, scale and personalize feeds. Our users access Stream via a blazing fast, highly available and simple to use API service. We run on a very complex tech stack, highly optimized for performance and availability.


Stream is a well funded startup with offices in Amsterdam and Boulder. We are looking for an experienced Python developer to join our development team in Amsterdam. Your responsibilities include build features for Stream's API service and storage layer as well as contribute to our open-source library (Stream-Framework)


Here are a few of the reasons we think this work is fun and challenging:



  • High performance demands. You will get to choose efficient data structures and algorithms for high performance. This often requires understanding the details of stdlib and how other libraries such as django, gevent, celery work.

  • We run a collection of services, each with different requirements and patterns optimized for efficiency. To name a few: single threaded, multi-threaded, multi-process and event-driven.

  • Complex testing scenarios.

  • Designing a simple, clean, and easily-understandable API is hard.

title: Polyglot / Artisan Engineer at LShift Ltd (London, UK)
description:
Fantastic opportunities available for skilled Software Engineers to join LShift in our London Office. Be a part of the most interesting technical team around!


Our outlook is moulded around the principle of recruiting only candidates who combine breadth and depth of outlook and experience. We do not recruit people to slot into a particular technical role, but all-rounders familiar with a broad range of operating environments, programming languages, etc., combined with a high level of software engineering expertise.

title: Software Programmer at Data Processors (Southbank, Australia)
description:
Due to expansion we are seeking direct applications from talented and passionate software programmers to join our Estimation and Evaluation team. The successful candidate will be joining an existing team of highly qualified and professional developers with a broad and proficient range of skills.

The types of systems that the successful candidate will support and test can broadly be defined within the family of algorithmic trading systems but don't let that scare you! Specific skills in finance and related algorithms are not required and domain specific information will be conveyed as part of on the job learning. Indeed, most of the work does not require specific knowledge but rather the willingness to learn and perseverance to ensure completion. Of key importance is the desire and willingness to solve problems of importance to business outcomes. Working well within a team is essential as is a dedicated and professional outlook on software development processes.

You will mainly be focused on the testing and support of general purpose software and systems to allow expert analysts to process online (live) and offline (historical) data. Online systems perform domain specific data transformations, algorithm application and validation of input and output data along with the hard performance constraint of a real-time system. Offline systems focus on algorithm evaluation (using distributed computation) and associated research and development (performed in collaboration with or by expert analysts).

Candidates with a Bachelor's degree in Software Engineering or Information/Computer Science will need to demonstrate experience in/with:



  • Software development environments using Agile methodologies

  • Unit testing frameworks such as JUnit, DUnit and/or PyUnit.

  • Build systems such as Jenkins and/or Bamboo.

  • One or more programming/scripting languages (Python, C#, C++/C, Java).

  • Defect Tracking and Source Control tools (eg. Jira, Subversion and Git).



You will need the following attributes:



  • Outstanding verbal and written communication skills including the ability to communicate effectively with technical and non-technical colleagues.

  • A strong proven focus on outcomes and deliverables..

  • The ability to think independently, act quickly and refocus following change.

  • A strong and proven desire to learn more effective and efficient ways of working.

  • Commitment to projects including extended post-implementation.

  • Self-motivated, pro-active and strong organisational skills.



The following competencies and experience would be considered valuable:



  • Delphi.

  • 2+ years experience in Quality Assurance/Testing or related experience .

  • Distributed computing/multi-threaded programming.

  • Statistical/numerical analysis.

  • Proficiency with XML/JSON data structures and constructs.

  • Hands-on testing experience with Windows, UNIX and/or Linux operations system.

  • SQL and PL/SQL.

  • TCP/IP and web technologies.


Ideally, we are seeking applications from candidates who are located in Australia and who already have the right to live and work here indefinitely and without any restrictions. However, if you hold the right to work in Australia unrestricted and indefinitely, but are not currently located here, but plan to be within the next month please apply.

Please do not hesitate and apply via the URL below.

Recruitment Process:

Please note due to the volume of applications received in response to our job adverts, applicants who have not applied via the URL will be automatically rejected. Those who have been short listed will be contacted with 72 hours of receipt of their application by a member of our HR team to schedule telephone interviews.

Following the initial telephone interview successful candidates will be required to attend a face to face interview which will include sitting a technical test specifically designed to test candidate ability for this position. The panel will consist of the Team Manager, Direct Manager and a Representative from the HR Team.

http://apply.dataprocessors.com.au

Please note all APPLICANTS MUST APPLY via the URL above and quote job reference PO65. Those who do not will be automatically rejected.

We look forward to receiving your application.

title: Technical Account Manager at Spoon.net (Seattle, WA)
description:
Spoon makes groundbreaking virtualization software that allows businesses, developers, and consumers to stream applications over the web, distribute server workloads and create automated test environments. Imagine simply installing a small plugin and being able to instantly run Firefox, Skype, Chrome, Spotify, or any other application without downloading it.


Founded in 2006, Spoon.net is a profitable, rapidly growing company with a multi-million dollar revenue base. We are seeking full-time technical account managers to join our team in the Seattle area.


Technical Account Managers serve as the main point of contact for customers, analyze customer technical issues, create proof-of-concept solutions, provide product feedback, give presales presentations and assist the development team in debugging issues.


Responsibilities



  • Analyze and respond to customer technical and integration issues and work with the development team to improve product quality

  • Work with potential customers and partners to develop proof-of-concept implementations and other technical product evaluations, and resolve technical issues

  • Cultivate relationships with members of the IT and development communities

  • Maintain accurate account records, activity logs, and bug information in the CRM and support databases

title: Data Engineer at Namely (New York, NY)
description: Are you obsessed with data, tools and metrics? Have you used and can you build tools to perform data extraction, transformation and loading (ETL)? Are you interested in tools that gather, store, and analyze User Metrics and Product usage? Do you love Python? We are looking for a skilled Data Engineer to contribute ideas, innovation, solutions and code to our product.

title: Senior Software Engineer at Aol Adtech, Frankfurt (Dreieich, Germany)
description:
About AOL/ADTECH


At AOL, we’re radically redefining the world of online media. By bringing together innovative technologies, premium brands, original content and award-winning journalists we're transforming the way people around the world connect with information, entertainment, and each other. The home of a world-class collection of premium brands, AOL creates original content that engages audiences on a local and global scale. We help marketers connect with these audiences through effective and engaging digital advertising solutions. Building these large-scale digital advertising platforms that handle billions of requests per day is the core business of ADTECH, which is a subsidiary of AOL.



JOB DESCRIPTION



AOL Engineering – Frankfurt/Dreieich


The Opportunity – Java Software Engineer


ADTECH’s team in Dreieich creates large scale, high available software components that are all part of our digital advertising platform. This spans from real time systems that handle several thousand transactions per second to big data solutions that process many terabyte of data on every given day

title: Backend Engineer at x.ai (New York, NY)
description:
• Build, evolve and scale out infrastructure to ingest, process and extract meaning out of free form text

  • Jump between architecture, implementation, infrastructure management, and firefighting

  • Design and build a system that enables seamless human-machine interactions

  • Solve various optimization and constraint problems related to coordinating people’s schedules and preferences

  • Integrate with various external APIs

  • Constantly improve our development processes and tools to reduce friction from idea to deployment

title: Senior Developer (Brno) at Kentico software (Brno, Czech Republic)
description:
Do you want to be part of the success story of a once-small Czech company that made it big in the software industry? We are seeking experienced senior level developers that love writing clean and highly scalable code. If you possess a thorough knowledge of the .NET framework, and just cannot get enough, and are seeking new challenges every day, enjoy working in a team using the Agile methodology to deliver a successful product, then you’re a great fit for our development department.


 The main topics we are working on in the upcoming future are:



  • Better support for MVC development

  • Geo-replication

  • Big data storage and business intelligence

  • Integration of cloud search providers

  • Integrations with best-of-breed CRM, ERP and Marketing Automation platforms (Salesforce, Dynamics, Marketo, Hubspot, …)

  • Support of ASP .NET 5

title: Senior JavaScript Developer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
description:
This is a key position in our Web Core Tech Team responsible for driving next-gen ICFLIX development platforms.

In this role you will be a key member of the team developing the JavaScript platform that provides the building blocks, framework, and infrastructure used by our customers to build high-quality, high-performance applications used both internally and externally. The successful candidate will have experience implementing JavaScript applications with an emphasis on optimization, API design, and architecture. This is an opportunity to directly affect our global customer base experience using a modern stack of JavaScript technologies to enable highly interactive state-of-the-art coding solutions for TV’s, set-top boxes, gaming consoles, tablets, smartphones and any other device that is connected to your TV.  Emphasis will be placed on developing well-tested and structured code, and the ability to work in a highly collaborative and fast moving environment.

title: Frontend developer at Wiremind (Paris, France)
description:
About Us:


We are a young start-up based in Paris and dedicated to the field of Revenue Management for the transportation sector. We believe in tools that mix business intelligence, applied mathematics, ergonomics and software intelligence to make sense of very large amount of data. We aim to remove unnecessary complexity to our users while allowing them to focus on high-value actions to improve the overall margin of their business.


Our main solution is a saas software for transport companies that let them do their yield and pricing just right.


We are looking for a talented frontend engineer who is ready to work in close relation with the CTO to tackle challenges met by a young technological startup. 


Responsibilities:


You will be in charge of developping new features for the front-end part of our solution.


The back-end part is responsible for extracting data from our client's reservation system, transforming it by applying several steps (standardization, forecasting, pricing algorithms...) and loading it in our managed datastores.


The frontend is a single-page application on which clients can freely modify their pricing position according to realtime adjusted metrics like competitor's prices, daily sale's speed, suggest optimal price... 


Our technological stack is as follow:



  • Backend: Python, SQLAlchemy, Scrapy, Celery, Flask

  • Frontend: AngularJS, D3js

  • Data-store: Postgresql, Elasticsearch


Requirements:



  • Strong Knowledge of Javascript, CSS, HTML

  • Rigourous, autonomous and hard-working


Bonus Points:



  • Working experience with AngularJS or D3js

  • Experience in working in a technological start-up


Other details:


This is a fulltime position located in Paris. 
Please include a brief personalized cover letter (in english or french) with your application.
Salary: Negotiable depending on the profile and degree / training / experience.

title: Big Data Software Engineer 80-100% at Swisscom AG (Liebefeld, Schweiz)
description:
Your responsibility
You will build Big Data software solutions that properly handle Big Data's 3V: volume, velocity and variety. As a programming polyglot, you will work on our Big Data back-end as well as front-end, connecting various parts via dedicated APIs. Through proper maintenance, you will ensure reusability and extensibility of your code as well as make sure your code is documented and meticulously tested before being put into production. You will team up with DevOps and Data Scientists to continuously innovate and enhance our build, deployments and automation infrastructure.

title: Software Engineer - Want to help solve the world's Identity Crisis? at Daon (Dublin 2, Ireland)
description:
Build world class identity assurance software as an integral part of the Daon Product and Technology Group.


Role Responsibiities:


The Software Engineer will work within our Dublin Product and Technology Group to help deliver our identity solutions products. The individual should be self-motivated and interested in working on multiple projects with quick changing schedules. They will be responsible for, and must be proficient at, working in all phases of the software development lifecycle. The role will be part of our flagship DaonEngine product development team and will be responsible for evolving the product and integrating new biometric technologies as they become available. This is an exciting opportunity to work with skilled team in an interesting and growing technology space.


Core Software Engineer Duties:



  • Work as part of a cross functional project team, in collaboration with Requirements Analyst, Technical Architects, DBAs, Technical Writers and QC Engineers.

  • Responsible for working on all phases of the software development lifecycle, including requirements analysis, system design, development, unit/system testing, documentation and maintenance – with an emphasis on the design, development and testing tasks.

  • Seek to maximize customer satisfaction on all project engagements. Understand the project customers and listen to their needs. Work directly with customers to fulfil their requirements.

  • Ensure that customer commitments are delivered with the required level of quality, on time and to the agreed specifications. Note External Customers include Partners and End Customers. Internal Customers include Professional Services, Customer Support Services and Pre-Sales.

  • Produce software that complies with the company’s product architecture guidelines and coding standards.

  • Follow the agreed Daon development methodology and project management practices (e.g. Scrum, TDD, CI, SCM).

  • Making presentations to customers, partners or fellow Daon employees.

  • Keep core skill set up to date by studying state-of-the-art development tools, programming techniques, participating in educational opportunities, reading professional publications, maintaining personal networks, participating in professional organizations.

  • Be available to travel to customer sites as and when requested. (Less than 10%)

title: Senior Ruby / Rails Developer at ICFLIX (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
description:
We are looking for a Senior Billing / Subscription Management Engineer with Ruby experience who gets as excited as us about web security, machine learning, big data, and cloud scalability to join our nimble engineering team – we are looking for someone with Ruby experience but is also  open to learn other languages, as long as you're excited about learning new stuff.



  • Develop web-related event based applications including the architecture, design, coding, integration, and maintenance of web and database applications; implement and automate back end systems.

  • Maintain and develop solutions on a social platform, scaling high traffic sites for Ruby on Rails, on platforms similar Amazon Web Services

  • Build with Responsive Web Design.

  • Coordinate the needs of all business owners, create and execute project work plans and revise as appropriate to meet changing needs and requirements.

  • Analyze and resolve day to day issues and bug reports.

  • Communicate and enforce coding standards.

  • Adapt quickly to legacy and evolving architecture, systems, processes and applications.

  • Exercise sound professional judgment when solving immediate problems in production environments.

title: Senior Front End Engineer at ROBLOX (San Mateo, CA)
description:
Responsibilities:


Help our front end team build the world's best user generated gaming platform supporting integrated desktop and mobile gameplay. We have a viral gaming directory, a massive virtual goods catalog, and an active social network. Our pages are displayed in browsers and embedded in desktop and mobile apps. You will transform the ROBLOX browser experience from a traditional web interaction to a highly interactive, responsive, and efficient design. We would love to hear from you if you are a JavaScript/CSS guru with a strong frontend foundation and love having an impact in a small team environment!


ROBLOX does not accept unsolicited resumes from 3rd party recruiters.

title: Application Developer Sr at University of Pennsylvania Libraries (Philadelphia, PA)
description:
The University of Pennsylvania Libraries seeks a progressive programmer to join its growing Digital Library Developer team. Working with an innovative blend of open-source and best-in-breed development tools, the Senior Application Developer creates software for multiple, complex digital library projects in the areas that include discovery, repository systems, researcher profile services, and business intelligence. Project work is designed and executed in teams comprised of software engineers, subject matter experts, and operations staff that emphasize collaboration and creative problem solving across a range of disciplines. The position reports to the Director for Digital Library Development and Systems, and supports a wide range of computing services which enhance and facilitate teaching, learning and research efforts of the University. Digital library development makes use of a full range of skills, including coding, technical architectures, application specifications, database design, and workflow analysis. The Senior Developer is responsible, along with other programmers, for testing, quality assurance and the life cycle management of library applications. The Senior Developer is a participant in and at times leads project teams to implement IT services, technical solutions and designs, and often has the support of a small crew of junior developers. The position also provides expertise on metadata that are relevant to digital library implementation and the development of local, reusable methodologies for metadata interactions.

The Senior Developer operates with a high degree of independence and professionalism in managing job responsibilities, work priorities, methodologies, and routines. The position requires a readiness to research IT developments and tools, to apply the findings of research to design and programming, and in general, to bring best practices and the latest concepts in the field to application development. The position is responsible for researching, recommending, managing and maintaining technical metadata standards for structured data repositories such as Oracle & MySQL databases, Apache Jackrabbit, Solr, and XML documents. The senior developer participates in IT planning as well as the execution of planning priorities.

The work requires close collaboration with a variety of audiences, including Library staff at all levels, project managers and developers across campus, Penn faculty and researchers, and IT professionals from other institutions and commercial firms. The Senior Developer must be highly effective working in groups and with subject matter experts who may not be IT professionals. The successful candidate will join a team of energetic and creative contributors. Responsibilities include timely and responsive communication, fulfillment of deadlines, and a readiness to engage in the bidirectional sharing of knowledge and expertise with colleagues.

title: Full-stack JavaScript hacker @ fast growing VC backed start-up at Ice.com (Palo Alto, CA)
description:
About us:

Our mission is to use software and analytics to bring transparency to the opaque world of jewelry. We are backed by leading VCs including Khosla Ventures, Maveron, and Crosslink. 

Note: we acquired the domain name (Ice.com) a year ago (it is unrelated to the previous company). 

A few reasons why you should be interested in this opportunity:

  • The jewelry industry is a fragmented, $80B market (in the US alone), growing at 5%+ annually, that software has yet to disrupt. 
  • You will be joining an awesome team led by Brandon Proctor (founding CMO of one of the largest e-commerce retailers, Build.com) and Justin Yoshimura (3x exits). 
  • We are extremely data driven and technology/software is in our DNA. You won't be a second class citizen here, guaranteed. 
  • We don't have time for assholes or politics. 
  • Competitive compensation package including stock options. 
  • Small (17 person) and agile team. 

What we'd like to see:

  • True, full-stack engineers with 2+ years of production experience in Python/Django or Node.js strongly preferred.
  • Strong foundation in computer science, with competencies in data structures, algorithms, databases, software design and dev ops.
  • Work experience with relational databases and SQL.
  • Experience with agile development process in collaborative environment.
  • BS in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, or Physics OR 4 years of relevant work experience.
  • Good understanding of performance tradeoffs.

Bonus Points:

  • We are currently using Magento, an open source e-commerce platform built in Zend PHP - yuck), but we are building a new, badass e-commerce platform in Django, Angular.js, Node.js and integrating it with Netsuite's order management tools (no need to re-invent the entire wheel, after all). Related experience is a plus.
  • if you have an awesome Github repo, open source contributions, or a cool project you can demo, please cut to the front of the line...

Responsibilities:

As a member of our small but seriously talented engineering team, you will play a key role in both shaping and building our technologies. Your scope will be broad, ranging from user-facing features to server-side components and libraries. We are looking for a generalist who enjoys learning and working with different technologies. And of course you will be expected to commit code on your first day. 

*This job description is not meant to be an all-inclusive list of duties and responsibilities, but constitutes a general definition of the position's scope and function in the company.

title: Infrastructuurspecialist at Rijksoverheid (The Hague, Netherlands)
description:
Infrastructuurspecialist


Ministerie van Veiligheid en Justitie, Nederlands Forensisch Instituut


Functieomschrijving


Je levert bij het Nederlands Forensisch Instituut (NFI) een belangrijke bijdrage aan het ontwerp en de inrichting van de technische infrastructuur van verschillende platforms.


Als infrastructuurspecialist buig jij je over het beheer van de technische infrastructuur en alle componenten van een platform, waaronder de hardware, netwerksoftware, protocollen, communicatieverbindingen, beheermechanismen en de onderlinge afstemming en koppelingen tussen netwerkcomponenten.


Je ontwerpt hiervoor de netwerkinfrastructuur en de hardware infrastructuur en richt deze in of je participeert hierin. Je monitort de platformbelasting en adviseert proactief. Ook los je incidenten op en je rapporteert hierover.


Het Nederland van nu zoekt ICT’ers. Bij de Rijksoverheid werk je als ICT-specialist aan belangrijke thema’s als privacy, security en cybercrime. Ook draag je bij aan ontwikkelingen in big data, cloud-oplossingen en bring your own device. Zo werk je mee aan het Nederland van nu.
