title: Technologist with C++ focus for high frequency trading firm at Xanadu Trading (Barcelona, Spain)
description:
Xanadu Trading is a young knowledge and technology based proprietary trading start-up. We are active in one of the most intense industries in the world. We trade our own capital, for our own risk and benefit, and have no customers. Xanadu is focused on high frequency algorithmic black box futures trading as well grey box options market making on Eurex, LIFFE and CME. We have offices in both London and Barcelona.


Options market making software needs to be at the same time very fast and responsive as well as reliable and bug-free. This is what has made developing in this area one of the most challenging, difficult and interesting propositions around. Xanadu's young technology department not only aims to compete in this area, but to disrupt it - from (almost) scratch, and with less man power than most competitors. And in order to do so, we are looking for great technologists.


As one of the first technologists in our young startup you will work directly with Xanadu's founder and head trader and will have varied and often changing responsibilities. In general, you will be responsible for working on parts of our automated trading tools in C++. Depending on your preferences and business requirements you might also do some front end development in Java - or work on statistics, data analysis and data visualization in R. Whatever it is going to be, it will be at the very heart of what Xanadu does and crucial to its success.


In summary, we offer:
  - Highly intellectual and competitive atmosphere
  - No sales pitches (we don't have customers - we code for ourselves, to our specs, to solve our problems, on our timeline)
  - Ability to use advanced mathematical modelling skills
  - Ability to write robust and highly efficient code, where both make a tremendous difference
  - English speaking work environment
  - Free food
  - Social activities
  - Nice office space
  - Very competitive salaries (salaries are negotiable and depend on experience - for fresh graduates total remuneration starts at 36k€ excluding benefits)

title: Senior Backend Engineer - Complex Systems (f/m) at Delivery Hero (Berlin, Germany)
description:
We're a young Delivery Hero spin-off and we’ve taken on a large and complex problem. We’re building a real-time distributed system which connects to multiple data sources. Our daily lives include asynchronous messages, conflicting data, a rich data model, open ended problems, NP algorithms, pair programming, discussing (and implementing) unconventional solutions, and lots of Python coding. If this sounds like how you’d like to spend your time, please get in touch with us.





Your Mission:




  • Work with the team to design and build a complex real-time distributed logistics system

title: Video Engineer at Clearleap (Atlanta, GA)
description:
Video Engineer


ABOUT US


Television today spans far beyond the traditional TV set. Its the last few seconds of a basketball game streamed to your iPhone and all of season two on your tablet. Clearleaps software products allow TV networks, cable and satellite providers, and major studios to offer video on tablets, smart phones, connected TVs and PCs. Clearleap is committed to hiring talented, dedicated, and creative individuals that want to be a part of a fast-paced environment that is changing the way television is viewed and we need you!


THE ROLE


The Video Engineer will be responsible for working with other engineers to make sure Clearleaps video transcoding farm is producing high quality video at breakneck speeds. A qualified candidate for the Video Engineer position will understand MPEG encoding, audio/video multiplexing, and be able to develop tools to transform media to meet customer requests. The ideal candidate will have an excellent understanding of digital video and audio and demonstrate a passion for bringing digital streaming entertainment to the home.


Key Responsibilities Include:



  • Design and implement media processing pipelines.

  • Support development, QA, and Operations with installing, configuring, and maintaining our systems.

  • Actively participate in a program of continuous improvement of platform documentation


EXPERIENCE/SKILLS REQUIRED



  • Bachelors degree in computer science or other relevant field required

  • Must have 3-5 years of specific video expertise

  • Must have 10+ years of C/C++

  • Strong knowledge of Java

  • Expert knowledge of ffmpeg, mplayer, and other media tools.

  • Video encoding with x264 and other commercially available encoding systems

  • Expertise in or good understanding of one or more of the streaming video formats such as MP2TS, HLS, HDS, Smooth, DASH etc.

  • Outstanding follow-through and problem solving skills, resourcefulness, attention to detail, personal accountability, and communication skills (both verbal and written)

  • Strong ability to multi-task multiple competing priorities

  • Strong knowledge of Linux/Unix systems as well as UNIX based systems (such as OS/X or Solaris)

  • Working knowledge in Internet technologies such as XML, web servers, and other Internet/network-related protocols

  • Strong hardware and software troubleshooting skills


ADDITIONAL PREFERRED SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE



  • Video Encryption and Digital Rights Management (DRM) like Playready, Adobe Access, Widevine, Irdeto.

  • Familiarity with Elemental, Ateme, Telestream, or Digital Rapids transcoders

  • Software development in Java or Groovy

  • Experience with Video QC Tools like Manzanita, Baton, Ineoquest


BENEFITS



  • Competitive salaries

  • Company subsidized medical, dental, and vision coverage

  • Company paid life, short term and long term disability insurance

  • 401(k) and stock option programs

  • 15 days of vacation in the first year

  • 10 paid holidays and 2 floating days

  • Free lunch Wednesdays

  • Free snacks and drinks, including soda fountain

  • Gym membership and race fee reimbursement

  • Onsite gym and showers

  • 3 scooters, 2 ping pong tables, 1 foosball table, and corn hole!

  • Regular fantasy sports leagues and quarterly cooking competitions (with prizes!)


We offer a flexible, exciting, and entrepreneurial work environment and look forward to you joining our team!

title: Data Engineer at Essence (New York, NY)
description:
The Company:

Essence is a global digital agency and the world’s largest independent buyer of digital media. We blend data science, objective media and captivating experiences to build valuable connections between brands and consumers. Clients include Google, HP, Method, and Barclays. The agency is more than 480 people strong, manages over $700MM in media spend and deploys campaigns in 71 markets via offices in London, New York, San Francisco, Seattle, Singapore and Tokyo. Visit essencedigital.com for more information, and follow us on Twitter at @essencedigital.

The Role:

We are looking for a Data Developer who can write clean well designed Python and PL/SQL in a timely and scalable way. You must have strong experience building and optimizing ETL processes in a heterogeneous environment (Oracle 11g, PostgresSQL).


We’d like you to:




  • Troubleshoot, test and maintain large-scale data warehousing systems and ETL processes to ensure strong optimization and functionality

  • Develop new features and tools as needed

title: Senior Full Stack Engineer at Sophos (Burlington, MA)
description:
SENIOR FULL STACK DEVELOPER



At Sophos, we operate at the cutting edge of technology, protecting businesses worldwide against complex threats, viruses and spam. We build high quality software security products in a fast-paced, nimble environment and we've been doing it for over 20 years.


Join us to help our customers protect their business and meet compliance needs.


Role


Senior Software Engineers possess the ability to function as a technical lead, providing technical direction to other developers. Frequently have direct responsibility for product features or key technology choices and implementation. Collaborates as part of a team for the development of complex systems; including requirements analysis, concept development and design, implementation and testing, demonstrating flexibility of role as required.



  • Candidates located in other areas of MA & NH are also welcome to apply


Main Duties



  • Drive design and implementation leveraging modern design patterns

  • Ability to partner effectively with UX, PM, DevOps, QE and other developers to design and implement meeting the spirit of requirements

  • Pride in authorship of code

  • Experience in modern front end frameworks

  • Technically curious to keep present on advances in technology

  • Experience with segregation of model, presentation, and business logic.

  • TDD experience and strong desire to build in test from the start.

  • Write code (Test or Product) to deliver against project timescales, quality and requirements in various languages including Java or other selected languages for Sophos Cloud products.

  • Conduct Unit, System and Integration testing and fixing errors, with guidance if required.

  • Work with best of breed Cloud technologies (NoSQL, high throughput event processing, cloud-scale data analytics, etc)

  • Design small software components (Functionality, defect fixes or automation) that form part of a larger solution, in line with team objectives

  • Define Test scenarios and Test cases to ensure quality of the teams deliverables

  • Provide guidance and mentorship to junior developers in daily Scrum meetings.


Experience and Skills



  • BS in Computer Science or equivalent

  • 7+ years of JAVA, API, JavaScript, Angular JS, Java Web Services, UI Skills, Json.

  • Experience using and creating RESTful APIs.

  • Experience with the following technologies (recommended);

    - MongoDB
    - Redis

  • Experience/knowledge with CI/CD

  • Experience with Agile Software Development methodologies

  • Excellent attention to detail

  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills


Essential



  • Design and write high quality code

  • Evaluation of code and design quality

  • Understands how products and technologies interface with each other and fit with the strategy and business needs

  • Evaluation of technical and functional specifications and their cohesion

  • Negotiation

  • Technical problem solving

  • Effective communication with different types of audience

  • Risks Assessment and Mitigation

  • Coaching and training

  • Team Working


Benefits


In most cases, the compensation package includes:



  • Medical insurance

  • Dental insurance

  • Vision insurance

  • Life insurance

  • Long-term disability insurance

  • 401k plan

  • Vacation time

  • Gym membership compensation

title: Senior Software Engineer - Machine Learning at Quantcast (London, UK)
description:
Quantcast is an organization that lives and breathes data. Data is used in every aspect of our business, driving everything from our audience measurement service, to our real time bidding and ad personalization, and even corporate operations. We are looking for top-tier talent to design, implement, and operate large scale ML systems in a production environment. You’ll work within a machine learning group that is obsessed with improving the state of the art in performance advertising. You’ll take full ownership of the development and operation of ML systems that span dynamic ad personalization, predictive modeling, recommendations, bid optimization and pacing - all operating on a global scale. You’ll have the opportunity to work with our real-time systems that process over 2 million events per second, a distributed compute cluster that processes 30 petabytes of data per day, and a training pipeline that builds tens of thousands of models daily.


Opportunities



  • Make an impact. Quantcast performs world-class data modeling and engineering of realtime systems with a relatively small engineering team. Data science is the backbone of Quantcast; your impact will be much greater here than at a large company.

  • Thrive in a full Big Data ecosystem. Quantcast has invested heavily in its compute infrastructure and has vast amounts of data to aid in decisioning. Almost the entire platform has been built or extended in-house, to achieve our rigorous computational needs, with many systems returned to the open source community.

  • Make a name for yourself. We publicize our work through open-source projects, blog posts and papers, and we work with amazing advisors, like Trevor Hastie and Jerome Friedman.

  • Great timing. We are a fast growing pre-IPO technocracy.


Responsibilities



  • Design, build and operate large scale machine learning algorithms, systems, and supporting infrastructure

  • Develop techniques to efficiently extract meaning from petabytes of data

  • Improve existing advertising products and introduce new end-to-end products to delight our customers

  • Interface with other teams and leaders in Engineering, Product Management, and Business Operations

title: Love coding, music and gaming? Nuday Games is looking for a Senior Clojure backend developer at Nuday Games (Stockholm, Sweden)
description:
Growing game studio Nuday Games is looking for a talented backend developer to build the Nuday Game platform, first product being Rock Science.


About the Job


The Senior Backend Developer designs and implements the backend systems and APIs to support feature development and new mobile games for a global audience. You will be a key member of the digital team and report to the CEO. You and your sharp and dedicated workmates at Nuday Games will initially focus on the Rock Science game. Together with you we’ll grow to become the world’s leading target group oriented game studio.


Not only do we develop exciting products, we use exciting technology to develop them. We believe that the combination of functional programming and Amazon Web Services allows a small team to accomplish a lot in a little time. Our game backends and platform are developed in Clojure and our deployment and operations tools are also Clojure. We don’t use Clojure “where it’s a good fit”, we think it’s a good fit everywhere!


Your challenge, should you choose to accept it, will be to build a scalable and manageable system using cutting-edge technologies. You’ll need to make sure what you build is maintainable, as you’ll be the one maintaining it. You’ll want to talk about the awesome things you’ve built at meetups, conferences, blogs and Twitter, and we encourage that. We’re proud of the tech we use and the people using it, and we’re happy for the world to know about it.


At Nuday Games, we value cultural diversity, curiosity and talent. We're big proponents of Agile and Lean ways of working, meaning that experimentation and learning are part of our core. We also value self-organisation. Here you'll have the freedom—and the responsibility—to take decisions around your own work. Our game development team is cross-competence. You'll work directly with the frontend team, game designers and product owner.


As a senior member of a small team, you will be responsible for design, implementation, operations, and help setting the technical direction of the Nuday platform. In short, we want you to do it all, and trust you to do it right.


What you will be doing


You will join our Product Team where you will be:



  • Writing lots of (clean) code that goes into production continuously

  • Get to spend 10 percent on private projects to find the next big thing

  • Gain and share knowledge with expert colleagues 


Responsibilities


You will take up the position of Senior Backend Developer. This includes:



  • Backend development, architecture (approx. 75% of working time)

  • Responsibility for quality control as well as technical competence within the tech team

  • Carry out performance reviews with other tech workers in the company

  • Internal and external presentation on the company’s platform from a technical standpoint

title: Java Programmer at RavenPack (Marbella, Spain)
description:
Position immediately available for an experienced software professional. You will work within an international team of developers skilled in Java, SQL, Python and Common Lisp.


The ideal candidate will have excellent skills as a software engineer and professional experience delivering backend applications developed and deployed on Linux.  You should be fluent in current Java technologies and tools.  Experience in the following technologies and procedures is a plus:



  • Continuous integration and test driven development practices

  • Project management and build automation tools: Maven, Sonatype Nexus and Jenkins

  • Knowledge and experience with J2EE frameworks

  • SQL and JPA

title: Data DevOps Engineer at Rally Health (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement.  Rally Health is a private company of 270 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B).  We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.   


In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.


Our technologies:  AWS, Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef

title: (Senior) Software Developer (w/m) at etracker GmbH (Hamburg, Deutschland)
description:
Lust auf die Entwicklung innovativer Software im Data Science-Umfeld?

Dann freuen wir uns, dich als

(Senior) Software Developer (w/m) mit Leidenschaft


in unserem Team zu begrüßen!

Du hast maßgeblichen Anteil an der Weiterentwicklung unserer komplexen und im Markt ausgezeichnet positionierten Software und entwickelst diese in einer Open Source Web-Architektur weiter. Die eigenverantwortliche Implementierung von vielschichtigen Erweiterungen in einer High Traffic Software-Architektur, die im Wesentlichen auf NoSQL- und In-Memory Datenbanken aufsetzt, steht dabei im Fokus deiner Aufgabe.

Bei uns findest du



  • agile Entwicklungsmethoden in Verbindung mit hoch automatisierten Release-Prozessen

  • gelebtes Software Craftsmanship

  • neueste Technologien und visionäre Lösungen

  • Continuous Delivery-Prozesse und Light Weight Container

  • Testautomatisierung vom Unit- bis zum Integrationstest

  • Entwicklung nahe am Betrieb

  • ein hohes Maß an Selbstständigkeit und Selbstorganisation innerhalb der Teams

  • Freiraum, um eigene Ideen voranzutreiben und umzusetzen

  • die Mitarbeit in einem hoch professionellen Team, das Spaß an seiner Arbeit hat

  • Raum für persönliche und berufliche Weiterentwicklung

  • eine attraktive Bürolage im Herzen Hamburgs mit Blick auf Rathaus und Michel



Wir wünschen uns



  • ein abgeschlossenes Studium mit Informatikschwerpunkt oder eine entsprechende Ausbildung mit Abschluss und Berufserfahrung

  • sehr gute Praxis in Java oder einer anderen OO-Programmiersprache und im OO-Design

  • idealerweise sichere Beherrschung moderner Internettechnologien oder aber eine hohe Web-Affinität

  • vorzugsweise UNIX Know-how

  • eine systematisch-analytische sowie nachhaltige Arbeitsweise

  • eine hohe Bereitschaft, neue Methoden und Technologien kennen- und beherrschen zu lernen



Lust auf etracker?

Dann freuen wir uns auf deine Bewerbung ausschließlich per E-Mail unter Angabe deiner Gehaltsvorstellung sowie deines möglichen Eintrittstermins an jobs@etracker.com.

Lust auf etracker aber noch Fragen?


Dann kann Elke Hollensteiner bestimmt weiter helfen: 040 55 56 59 52.

title: Core Financial Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
description:
The Role: 

The Core Financial Applications (CFA) department designs and builds business-critical solutions for a diverse set of customers in the financial industry. Our products include analytical and research applications for equities, fixed income, mortgages, commodities, economics, foreign exchange and financial derivatives. The products we build help traders, investment bankers, corporate treasurers, research analysts and portfolio managers solve complex business problems.

As a software engineer in CFA, you will be responsible for the full development life cycle of key projects. You will learn about finance from our subject matter experts and through Bloomberg University courses. Your ingenuity and enterprise will help improve and progress our products in a highly competitive and challenging marketplace.

Our software engineers are quick, resourceful, flexible and collaborative. They combine their technical skills and product knowledge to craft unsurpassed solutions for our customers.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.

Derivatives & Cross Asset

The Derivatives & Cross Asset group is one of the fastest growing in both CFA and Bloomberg. We deal with analytics required by a variety of trading, risk management and regulatory reporting applications. The front, middle and back offices of major financial institutions involved in the USD 700 trillion derivatives industry use our products to make sense of the complexity, risks, pitfalls and regulations surrounding these financial instruments. Our derivatives teams meet these challenges by offering a one-stop solution that brings transparency, efficiency and excellence to market professionals.

Fixed Income Pricing

The Fixed Income (FI) Pricing group builds a product that is the market standard for pricing and provides up to date and accurate information to the global financial community. We are focused on building low latency, high throughput systems that employ advanced statistical techniques for generating real-time and accurate pricing information. FI Pricing also builds analytics products that revolutionize the fixed income market place. Our application suite includes high precision pricing algorithms, accurate end-of-day price generation systems, liquidity hubs for storing and retrieving pricing information, sophisticated user interfaces and big data analytics platforms. These products are extensively used by various market players such as portfolio managers, risk officers, analysts and traders.

Foreign Exchange

The Foreign Exchange (FX) group provides market leading analytic functionality and award-winning currency pricing and data. Because FX trades are over the counter (bank to bank; not traded in exchanges), it is important for traders to have transparency into market prices. Our tools provide this service in real-time and allow users to perform FX forwards analytics on them. We develop high visibility applications for FX valuation, idea generation and price discovery workflows, as well as high volume real-time pricing engines.

Commodities

The Commodities group builds products that offer transparency in supply, demand, and pricing of oil, power, natural gas, metals and agricultural goods. We build systems and functionality to house everything from hourly power transmission rates to 15-minute updates on ship movements. Technical opportunities run the gamut from architecting systems to designing databases to UI development. Another aspect of this group is to track and manage the lifecycle of millions of futures and options securities across 100+ exchanges around the world. Our futures and options product makes discoverability of such securities easy, which proves to be a very important for our clients in a dynamic environment.

Economics

The Economics group puts the fundamentals of our economy in front of hundreds of thousands of clients every day. We develop the tools that manage real-time releases of economic statistics coming from governments around the world. We also develop analytics and visualizations of economic data to help users better understand the underpinnings of our financial system.

Equity

The Equity group's product is used by over 100,000 financial professionals worldwide to make investment decisions aimed at increasing alpha. This functionality is among the most used across the Bloomberg terminal and is invaluable to clients. The product allows for clear understanding of vast global data sets spanning 30+ years, big data analytics, real-time alerting and complex financial data. We build applications for discovering and analyzing market trends, aggregating and evaluating analyst predictions, and screening and back-testing investment ideas. The group is made up of fast-paced teams passionate about time-to-market, performance and visual design.

Fixed Income Core

The Fixed Income Core group develops software to support analytics and data that move global fixed income markets. We cover government, corporate, money market, municipal and preferred instruments. Our clients depend on our pricing algorithms, high performance calculation libraries, trading applications and real-time big data analysis to make informed decisions. Our applications are used a million times a day and our APIs are invoked billions of times a day.

title: Foundational Applications C++ Developer at Bloomberg LP (New York, NY)
description:
The Foundational Applications department builds some of the most innovative and heavily used applications and infrastructure in the financial industry. We work on communication systems, compliance and archiving solutions, charts and visualizations, news, search and recommendation systems and big data infrastructure.

Our developers operate at the intersection of in-depth technical research and an aggressive time-to-market. We not only own the full life cycle for the products we build, but also work closely with our business counterparts and UX design teams to strategize on next generation features and functionality. We are dedicated to using and contributing to open source, have an active presence at industry conferences and collaborate with top universities.

>> More information on individual groups and their products can be found below. When you apply, you will have the ability to select your preferred group.


Instant Messaging

Bloomberg Instant Messaging (Instant Bloomberg, or IB) is used by the Bloomberg community for real-time communication including exchanging quotes, trade ideas, news and other financial information. IB handles close to 250 million post events per day. Our usage has grown considerably over the past few years, requiring that we maintain a sophisticated UI and a state-of-the-art distributed architecture which can scale to the most extreme load without compromising performance. We also build a unified multimedia communications product called BConnect. We work with open source software and encourage interaction with the wider technology community by contributing changes and taking part in related meetups and conferences.

Bloomberg Vault

Bloomberg Vault (BVault) is a startup within Bloomberg developing a cloud-based compliance archiving service, eDiscovery tools and real-time compliance monitoring infrastructure. The explosive growth of social media and web collaboration require businesses to remain compliant with an increasingly regulatory environment. Our software, hosted in Bloomberg's private cloud, archives over 60 billion messages and has gained rapid market adoption with over 700 enterprises. Our infrastructure processes over 200 million messages a day, checking content and interaction patterns, and providing analytics and event-driven reporting.

Mail

The Bloomberg Mail (Message) group builds a cloud-based platform used for Internet email, bond announcements and pricing, financial research distribution and other communication on the Bloomberg terminal. Our network of users, connected through the platform, relies on our real-time performance, ironclad security and tight integration with financial data and Bloomberg applications. Message is built on top of open source, commercial and proprietary technologies. This highly available distributed system includes comprehensive storage, search infrastructures, real-time email transport and delivery pipelines. We build APIs for integration with other applications and systems, and a feature-rich user interface optimized for our customers.

News

The News group develops one of the most heavily used applications on the Bloomberg terminal that provides search, real-time alerts and analysis. We build systems that process over one million news stories a day from over 80,000 sources. We provide scalable products that meet strict indexing latency requirements and synthesize and present an overwhelming amount of unstructured information to our clients. Bloomberg News uses our systems and workflows making them the fastest, most influential news agency in the world.

Government Intelligence

The Government Intelligence group helps investors quantify the impact of government activities such as legislation, regulation and contracting. Our work includes ingesting large unstructured public data sets and discovering actionable data points to alert clients in real-time. We design scalable search and database solutions to aid discoverability and analysis.

Charts and Custom Indices

The Charts and Custom Indices group builds visuals that make it easier to absorb information and identify data trends. In addition to visualizations, we develop analytical platforms that retrieve, aggregate and process large data sets. Our services run on dedicated Linux servers and require stability, scalability and speed.

Search and Discoverability

The Search and Discoverability group builds a federated search and question-answering engine to ensure Bloomberg clients can find the right information as quickly as possible. We use open source search technologies and natural language query understanding to build an intuitive search functionality. Our platform searches millions of data points from dozens of structured and unstructured data stores and natural language question-answering engines.

Financial Data Infrastructure

The Financial Data Infrastructure group builds the next generation of infrastructure to take in large amounts of financial data. We use big data and cluster management technologies to achieve high performance, reliability and transparency. Current initiatives include: price history infrastructure to store and manage billions of historical time series data points; data pipeline to ensure transparent and accurate delivery and governance of data; data snapshot for real time access to thousands of data points about millions of securities; and, Bloomberg Query Language to provide a rich access and calculation layer on top of all Bloomberg data.

title: Software Engineer - Core Engine at Ontoit Holdings Ltd (London, UK)
description:
Ontoit is looking for an energetic and proactive Software Engineer responsible for developing the core of Ontoit's semantic search engine platform. In this critical and exciting phase of Ontoit's growth, you will be an integral contributor in forming the future of our company.


At Ontoit, we work in various fields of computer science, including machine learning, natural language processing, graph technologies, knowledge representation (ontologies), distributed systems, and web applications. The core technologies that we use include, but is not limited to, Apache Storm, Neo4J, CoreNLP, Apache Spark, Apache Cassandra and Java Spring. As a Core Developer, you will be involved in the development of these various fields. In conjunction with the CEO and key team members you will be involved in driving the design and technical specifications of the system and responsible for developing high quality code for challenging algorithmic back end development.


The compensation for this position will be in the range of £30-40,000 per annum plus potentially equity options, all depending on the experience and skill level of the successful applicant.


Ontoit will accept applications for this position until the 18th of September, 2015.

title: System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services at Peak Games (Istanbul, Turkey)
description:
System Engineer, Platform & Big Data Services



Peak Games' Technical Operations team (TechOps) is responsible for building, scaling and maintaining highly available systems, and is also the first line of defense against all outages. TechOps detects and solves the issues in a proactive manner. Because of being a service department, TechOps engineers have limitless exposure to all technologies used in the infrastructure of all games, including numerous bleeding edge technologies. We are looking for system engineers that want to automate just about everything you can think of and build a development and deployment pipeline and set of tools that can effectively deliver our games and services. Our team is responsible for automating the entire stack of high performance, large scale, geographically dispersed resources throughout its life-cycle. We have an app stack that will challenge you and diversify your skills. Ideal candidates will have experience of AWS and/or other cloud tech. You will be building our infrastructure in AWS, EC2 or our own private hardware and software resources. You will work side by side with our engineering teams and architects to design and implement a scalable and robust cloud delivery infrastructure.


Major Responsibilities/Activities



  • Work closely with the engineering teams to design, deliver and manage our services with high uptime

  • Participate in failure, load and performance tests to ensure applications are production ready

  • Ensure security of the production infrastructure, systems and applications

  • Engage in the development of continuous integration strategy. Define, develop and maintain CI processes and systems

  • Automate, implement, administer, and maintain our databases, local and cloud-based servers including provisioning, backups and restores, upgrades, and monitoring

title: Algorithm and Software Developers for Computational Biochemistry at D. E. Shaw Research (NY, NY)
description:
Extraordinarily gifted computational scientists and engineers are sought to join a New York–based interdisciplinary research group pursuing an ambitious, long-term project aimed at achieving major scientific advances in the field of biochemistry and fundamentally transforming the process of drug discovery. 


Candidates should have a demonstrated track record of academic, industrial, and/or open-source accomplishments.  Relevant areas of expertise might include parallel computing on high performance computing systems employing multi-core, GPU, or special-purpose architectures, numerical analysis, C/C++, or Python programming, data-intensive computing, compilers, operating systems, or distributed systems, but specific knowledge of and level of experience in any of these areas is less critical than exceptional intellectual ability.  We are prepared to reward exceptionally well-qualified individuals with above-market compensation. 


Among the group’s current research activities is the development of new algorithms and software for molecular dynamics simulation and data analysis both on commodity clusters and on Anton, a massively parallel special-purpose supercomputer of our group’s design.  Successful candidates will have the opportunity to work closely with a number of the world’s leading computational chemists and biologists, and to make fundamental contributions within the fields of biology, chemistry, and medicine.


To submit an application, please use the link provided below:
http://www.deshawresearch.com/recruit/jobs/Ads/StackOverflow/CS


D. E. Shaw Research does not discriminate in employment matters on the basis of race, color, religion, gender, pregnancy, national origin, age, military service eligibility, veteran status, sexual orientation, marital status, disability, or any other protected class.

title: Data Architect at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
description:
The Twilio Architecture team is responsible for the architecture of Twilio’s platform. The Data Architect will be a core member of the team focusing on designing data topologies and pipelines for handling and storing the immense amount of data we capture every day.


About the job:


As an experienced software engineer, you will be developing the architecture that will be instrumental in operating globally available, resilient and highly performant services used by hundreds of thousands of developers and apps.

Successful candidates will be strong developers with deep experience in data modeling, data storage and Business Intelligence systems.


Responsibilities:



  • Drive the technologies and policies needed to store, manage and interact with Twilio's data.

  • Work with the engineering teams to help choose technologies, design system architecture and model data in a scalable and efficient way.

  • Develop proof of concepts, shared libraries and services that will be used across the product engineering organization.

  • Coordinate with Sales Operations, Marketing and Finance to help understand their data needs and how disparate systems will integrate.

  • Tackle some of the most challenging problems in distributed computing, data persistence, and more.

title: Java Devops Engineer at Spinn3r (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
description:
Ideal Candidate


We are looking for candidates outside of the U.S. and Canada to maximize our time zone distribution. Ideally there should be least a 4 hour overlap with the Pacific Standard Time Zone (PST / UTC-8). We're based out of San Francisco but are migrating to the international level. If you don't have a natural time overlap with UTC-8 you should be willing to work evenings to be able to communicate easily with the rest of the team.


We're interested in someone comfortable with a generalist and devops role. You should be knowledgeable of standard system administration tasks and have a firm understanding of the role of load balancers and cluster architecture. It's 100x harder to write code if you don't know how the underlying operating system works.


We are also looking for someone with a legitimate passion for technology, big data, and analyzing vast amounts of content.


Culturally, we're a remote company and want to embrace it as a way to reward our employees. We are fine with you working in remote locations as long as you're generally available for communication and are productive.


We want someone to come in full time as a contractor role. I suspect we will need about 40 hours from you per week.  


Job Responsibilities:



  • Understanding our crawler infrastructure and ensuring top quality metadata for our customers. There's a significant batch job component to analyze the output from the crawl to ensure top quality data.

  • Making sure our infrastructure is fast, reliable, fault tolerant, etc. At times this may involve diving into the source of tools like ActiveMQ, Cassandra and understand how the internals work. We contribute a LOT to Open Source development if our changes need to be given back to the community.

  • Building out new products and technology that will directly interface with customers. This includes cool features like full text search, analytics, etc. It's extremely rewarding to build something from ground up and push it to customers directly. 


Architecture:


Our infrastructure consists of Java on Linux (Debian/Ubuntu) with the stack running on ActiveMQ, Cassandra, Zookeeper, and Jetty. We use Ansible to manage our boxes. We have a full-text search engine based on Elasticsearch and store our firehose API data within Cassandra.


We have a totally new stack and infrastructure at this point. We recently did a full-stack rewrite and moved all the old code to our new infrastructure. This means we have very little legacy cruft to deal with.


Here's all the cool stuff you get to play with:



  • Large Linux / Ubuntu cluster running with the OS versioned using both Ansible and our own debian packages for software distribution.

  • Massive amount of data indexed from the web and social media.  We index from 5-20TB of data per month and want to expand to 100TB of data per month.

  • Large Cassandra install on SSD.  

  • SOLR / Elastic Search migration / install.  We’re experimenting with bringing this up now so it would be valuable to get your feedback.


Compensation:



  • Salary based on experience. We're willing to be competitive and a great company to work for.

  • Ability to work remotely at home. Live work balance is a must.

title: Principal Engineer (Matching Engineering) at eHarmony (Los Angeles, CA)
description:
eHarmony is looking for a highly talented individual to join our Matching Engineering team! Every day, eHarmony matches millions of people based on deep compatibility, built on decades of psychological research and Machine Learning. Matching is the core of eHarmony, and you have a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to be right in the middle of it. 

Your challenge as a Principal Engineer on our team will be to implement and scale these matching systems, to support ever more complex modeling processes, across a rapidly growing community of users. 


In this position, you will be responsible for:



  • Getting to work with innovative new technologies (e.g. Hadoop/Map-Reduce, NoSQL stores like MongoDB and Voldemort, AWS based cloud computing, SOA via REST services)

  • Working on a matching system that creates trillions of potential pairings in our candidate pool (over 51 million registered users)

  • Designing core back-end Matching components

  • Coding day-to-day in Java, and other languages such as Scala, Ruby, Groovy, C++.

  • Analyzing and improve the efficiency, reliability and scalability of components across the Matching infrastructure

title: Senior Java Developer at Infusion (Toronto, ON, Canada)
description:
The Opportunity:



  • Working with one of our capital markets clients on a large scale, complex, highly visible project to understand their product vision and requirements.

  • Providing technical consulting to clients while recommending technologies and solution options that provide critical business operations such as processing multi-billion dollar transactions quickly and error free.

  • Working with cross functional teams to build, engineer, architect and design an electronic trading and risk management solutions

  • Using your Java background in development to work collaboratively with capital markets Traders and IT professionals to brainstorm use cases and problem solve issues.


  WHY INFUSION: 



  • You’ll build your portfolio by working alongside various capital markets leaders on a variety of large, complex, multi-million dollar projects.

  • We’re about transformation. You’ll be challenged to come up with creative solutions working on new technologies.

  • We invest in you. We host programming contest, hackathons and fun training sessions to keep you on top of your game.

  • You’re supported. Whether it’s a training, mentorship, breakfast basket, pizza, spa services, or Infusion’s monthly social events, Infusion takes care of you. 

  • Career progression is real. You will move up if you have the drive.

  • Our Infusion Air program gives you the opportunity to work on projects out of our global offices in North America and Europe.

title: Back- End Web Developer at Michigan State University (East Lansing, MI)
description:
Back-End Web Developer



Michigan State University (MSU) is seeking an innovative and creative Back-End Web Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the application and the browser. This role focuses on the server side of programming for the web, yet also requires understanding the programming languages that control the display of content in the browser.



Responsibilities


The Back-End Web Developer:



  • Integrates user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side logic

  • Develops and modifies object-oriented frameworks both inside and outside of a CMS

  • Builds reusable code and libraries

  • Develops front-end code that meets or exceeds WCAG 2.0 AA and W3C web standards

  • Develops applications that interface with web services

  • Implements security and data protection

  • Provides detailed estimates of time and resources required to meet project objectives

title: Software Developer: Casual Data-Driven Firm at TFS Capital (West Chester, PA)
description:
TFS Capital LLC is a boutique asset management firm in West Chester, PA. We are seeking a well-rounded software developer to join our development team. This developer will help maintain and expand our proprietary automated data-driven trading systems. As a key member of a small development team, you will be an integral part of all aspects of our mission-critical trading infrastructure. In addition to working with existing systems, you will be assisting with making and implementing design decisions for new and improved data and software architecture. The position is full-time in our West Chester, PA office.


Technology is at the heart of our business. At TFS, you and the rest of the technology team will work directly with traders, quants, and portfolio managers to solve interesting and challenging problems using technology. Your actions will directly impact the success of our business.


TFS Capital will not consider applicants who require H1-B Visa sponsorship for this position.


Key responsibilities



  • Work with the rest of the development team to expand and maintain the firm’s proprietary software systems

  • Work directly with the trading desk, analysis team, portfolio managers, and other business groups to support existing systems and implement new ideas

  • Onboard new, diverse, large datasets and create appropriate ETL processes


About the IT Team
We are a small team of developers and operations admins who work together to develop, maintain, and expand our in-house trading software. In addition to our code, we integrate and assist with development of code from other teams, including the traders and analysts. We work directly with traders and analysts daily, and most of the TFS team on a regular basis.


We’re primarily a Windows shop, but use Linux where it fits best. The bulk of our software is written in Java, but we also have a ton of Perl and MATLAB, and some Python and C#. We use Microsoft SQL Server for relational data storage.

title: Software Engineer at MetaBank (Sioux Falls, SD)
description:
Do you enjoy solving complex business problems in a fast-paced, collaborative software development environment? Would you like a new challenge? Are you looking for a stable, growing company that provides work/life balance and cutting edge technology?


Due to company growth, we are expanding our software development team. We are committed to skills development, enhanced training, and career progression for qualified candidates. Does this sound like something you’d like to be a part of? Come join us! Together, we can change the way people use money.


Job Summary:


Coordinate activities surrounding all software development. Specifically, participates in the architecture and design, oversees development and maintenance efforts for enterprise applications.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities:


Review, analyze, and modify existing systems including coding, testing, debugging, and deployment efforts in support of enterprise needs.


Participate in requirements process providing feedback and engagement to ensure sounds processes are developed.


Provide support for complex issues within existing systems and applications, including resolution of user issues, errors in system data, and general maintenance items.


Create solutions based on experience, sound judgment, and creative problem solving.


Assist in solving complex development problems through the use of good design and practical experience.


Ensure business remains current and competitive in find emerging technologies to improve business processes.


May be asked to mentor, lead or direct the work of others.


Ensure high availability and reliability of business applications.


Demonstrate personal commitment to excellence in service to customers and other employees.


Conduct business with strict adherence to bank policies and procedures. Participate in the bank's Performance Management System.


Other duties may be assigned.

title: Senior Software Engineer at CreativeLive, Inc. (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Make real things. Stay curious. Have fun.



CreativeLive is looking for talented engineers to join our growing technical team in our San Francisco office. You will be forging a new frontier in online learning applications, leveraging and contributing to open source technology.


Our platform is built on Node and Angular, so you will ideally have solid experience coding in Javascript, and be excited by being empowered to contribute and learn at any level of the stack, from defining clean server APIs to creating beautiful front-end experiences.



Along with your fellow engineers, you'll be working with design and product to continuously improve the CreativeLive site and internal tools by



  • iterating on prototypes

  • architecting modules and applications

  • refactoring existing parts of the site

  • extending our content management system

  • implementing data visualization dashboards

  • interfacing with (and creating) web services 

  • improving the scalability and fault tolerance of our distributed systems

  • actively contributing to refining our Agile development processes

title: Frontend Developer (m/f) at Celonis GmbH (München, Deutschland)
description:
What’s it like working at Celonis?



  • Rewarding work, knowing you’re working on something that adds real value to companies and to the people who love to use it.

  • Get it done. Zero bureaucracy. Make a direct impact.

  • Work together with passionate people who put team before ego. People who can turn on a dime and embrace rapid changes.

  • Work at the forefront of Process Mining and join us to create disruptive and world class data analytics solutions that will revolutionize how businesses see at their processes.

  • Work on a widely used standard software product with the highest standards and requirements.


What we give you in return



  • Top notch salary

  • Hardware of your choice

  • Develop with the latest tools, libraries, frameworks, and workflows with a high qualified team

  • No IE8 support

title: Head Of Engineering (Platform & Cloud) at INRIX (Kirkland, WA)
description:
INRIX is seeking a Head of Engineering to lead the development of innovative core platform technologies, products, services and analytics in a very nimble organization with incredibly smart people. We are a company that is setting the pace with new technologies, innovative use of the cloud, and products based on data that others can only dream of. The successful candidate is an experienced and very senior Engineering leader who has successfully built high performing global teams to deliver innovative products and services to the market.  This position will report to the Chief Technical Officer (CTO) based in Kirkland, Washington.   

INRIX is a leading provider of real-time traffic information, connected car services and analytics worldwide. The company leverages big data analytics to reduce the individual, economic and environmental toll of traffic congestion. Through cutting-edge data intelligence and predictive traffic technologies, INRIX helps leading automakers, fleets, governments and news organizations make it easier for drivers to navigate their world.


INRIX is at the forefront of connecting cars to smarter cities and serves more than 350 blue-chip customers in more than 40 countries around the world.    

Primary Responsibilities:



  • Lead multiple teams of software engineers and Program Managers in the development and deployment of INRIX products

  • Contribute directly to our growth by hiring smart and motivated employees that can that can deliver

  • Manage worldwide complex systems and teams

  • Responsible for ensuring sanity of architecture, operational excellence and quality, and delivering results on time

  • Implement new technology advancements such as new development stacks or new ways to maximize value from our private/public cloud

  • Collaborate with other teams to deliver platform features that require cross-team leadership

  • Mentor, coach and develop a large group of people to reach their potential and meet company objectives

  • Review architecture, code, plans, deployments and operations to drive excellence through the organization

  • Develop long-term strategies and influence leadership decisions


In return we’ll give you the opportunity to:



  • Build new and incredibly useful products for millions of users worldwide.  Even the best design leaders can only do so much concept and design work each year – make it really count!

  • Being a part of the cutting edge of connected cars and connected cities. The products you are working on have never before been seen!

  • Work with only the very best and brightest in our field – we’re moving fast and every person on the team really counts.

  • Be part of an established business that retains a startup feel.  You’ll get a fast paced environment with tight customer feedback loops AND the benefits of company stability and resources.

  • Join an environment of shared vision where we get things done without the politics.

title: Software Engineer - Delphi/PLSQL at IQMS (Paso Robles, CA)
description:
IQMS Software Engineers are responsible, individually and as part of a team, for software design, development and testing of customer-driven and proactive enhancements to existing proprietary EnterpriseIQ ERP system. Position involves interaction with customers and project teams, development of design specifications, programming, and testing.


Job Responsibilities:



  • Software design, development and testing of customer-driven and proactive enhancements to existing ERP system

  • Analysis of project requirements and application maintenance

  • Ability to build productive relationships within project teams and the organization

  • Demonstration of products

  • Identify and apply any and all necessary changes

  • Additional job duties as assigned

title: Big Data Solutions Engineer at Prudential (Newark, NJ)
description:
Join a sophisticated Data Services Prudential team implementing high value, Information Management solutions. Looking for highly experienced Java Hadoop Big Data Engineer with experience of working with large-scale, distributed data pipelines Responsibilities span the full data engineering lifecycle from architecture and design, data analysis, software development,

QA, capacity planning and managing the analytics environment as a whole.

 

Desired Skills and Experience

Job Responsibilities:
* Build distributed, scalable, and reliable data pipelines that ingest and process data at scale and in real-time.
* Collaborate with other teams to design and develop and deploy data tools that support both operations and product use cases.
* Perform offline analysis of large data sets using components from the Hadoop ecosystem.
* Evaluate and advise on technical aspects of open work requests in the product backlog with the project lead.
* Own product features from the development phase through to production deployment.
* Evaluate big data technologies and prototype solutions to improve our data processing architecture.

 

Candidate Profile:
* BS in Computer Science or related area
* 10-12 years software development experience
* Minimum 2 Year Experience on Big Data Platform
* Proficiency with Java, Python, Scala, HBase, Hive, MapReduce, ETL, Kafka, Mongo, Postgres, Visualization technologies etc.
* Flair for data, schema, data model, how to bring efficiency in big data related life cycle
* Understanding of automated QA needs related to Big data
* Understanding of various Visualization platform (Tableau, D3JS, others)
* Proficiency with agile or lean development practices
* Strong object-oriented design and analysis skills
* Excellent technical and organizational skills
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills

title: Sr Software Developer at SPIRIT Global Energy Solutions (Frederick, CO)
description:
Position Summary:


Accountable for Real Time software design and develop of innovative automation technology used for artificial lift of oil production.  Responsible for new product software engineering throughout the product development life (idea-to launch) and sustaining engineering.  Researches, designs, and develops computer software systems, in conjunction with hardware product development.  The position reports to the Automation Engineering Director who is based in Frederick (Denver), CO. This is a senior level role where the candidate will define and continuously improve software engineering processes, practices and architectures used by the company.


Essential Duties and Responsibilities include the following.  Other duties may be assigned. 



  • Reviews and validates system software requirements to determine feasibility of design constraints.

  • Architects, designs, develops, and updates functionality for embedded automation software, systems, and sub-systems.

  • Evaluates hardware and software interfaces and system requirements working in a multidisciplinary team.

  • Develops and directs software system testing procedures to verify software functional requirements.

  • Coordinates installation of software system.

  • Consults with customers concerning maintenance of software systems.

  • Identifies, evaluates, and develops tools and processes necessary to meet engineering, project and business goals.

  • Provides timely communications on significant issues or developments.

  • Maintaining a focus on safety, quality and reliability.

  • Conducts problem root cause investigations and determines proper resolution.

  • Leads and participates actively in software design and code reviews.

  • Develops software verification strategies and test procedures to verify software functional requirements.

  • Practices and promotes modern software development methodologies.

  • Reviews and continuously improves processes used in software engineering.

  • Guides and mentors team-members on design, debugging, coding and testing standards.

title: Front End Engineer required to create beauty within FinTech at Thought Machine (London, UK)
description:
We are looking for a special person to join our fantastic team of Engineers (don’t believe us - check out their profiles on our company page). We use big data and machine learning to create beautiful, data rich yet practical personal finance apps...and that is just the start, our plans are ambitious which means that there is a big opportunity to grow and develop your own role within the team.


You will be working on some of the most exciting and innovative apps in FinTech as we push to revolutionise the industry. Day to day you will be working on a variety of challenging and interesting projects using some the most cutting edge open source frameworks while exploring all of the latest lunch places Old Street has to offer.

title: Team Lead Backend  PHP at trivago (Düsseldorf, Deutschland)
description:
Join trivago and help shape the future of the world’s largest online hotel search. Work with the latest technology and with colleagues from over 60 countries. We believe in personal development through flexible, self-directed work and cross-functional opportunities. Enjoy a working environment that encourages new ideas, fun and challenging the status quo!

We’re looking for a skilled PHP developer to lead, inspire and grow our back-end development team. In this role, you’ll have the overview of our PHP architecture and Symphony framework, work with an inspirational team and implement own ideas to strategically drive our back-end system to the next level. Are you passionate about working in an agile environment and a strong believer of scrum and test-driven-development? Are you as good with people as you are with PHP? Then we want to hear from you!


Your responsibilities:



  • Coach and mentor a team of 15 PHP developers.

  • Support recruiting of further team members by conducting interviews and working together with HR on creative recruiting efforts.

  • Initiate, promote and allocate the resources for technological innovations.

  • Be up-to-date and passionate about new technologies. Evaluate their potential for trivago to continuously drive change.

  • Ensure and improve performance, reliability, flexibility and maintainability of trivgo’s PHP applications.

  • Support test-driven development, continuous integration and continuous deployment.

  • Collaborate with and provide technical consultation to Product Owners, Frontend Developers, Technical Account Managers and Business Intelligence Analysts.

  • Foster continuous knowledge transfer between front & backend developers.

title: Talented developers in Southampton and London at Alliants (London, UK)
description:
Hello! Here's what we do...
Alliants are a bunch of people who care about building the right thing, and building things right. All of our work comes from recommendation, which is why we don’t have a sales team. Whether we're building a new startup, growing a large product, coaching in dev processes, designing new tech strategies, or refactoring a large old behemoth, each interaction we have has created more work for us.


We’re based in London and Southampton, so if you like the bustle, varied culture and tiny apartments; or instead like the sea, paddle-boarding to work and smell of farms we can accommodate you.


What were looking for
A company based on recommendation needs people who have pride in what they do. You understand how good design helps mature a system, and have probably read Martin Fowler or Uncle Bob on well designed clean code, you like to keep abreast of what you don’t know or use, like new languages like Elixir or Rust. You appreciate the professionalism that TDD (or good tests) affords. You know the trade offs of monolithic architectures and that newer ways, like micro-services, have trade offs too. And ultimately you know that there is no universal correct way of building software.


We’re a knowledge based business - people come to us because we know what to do and how to do it. So we don’t hire people to just write programs. We need people who help us build our own knowledge, and do things better. We’re not afraid to prototype and give talks on our ideas, and encourage all to do the same.


Although technical competency is important, we want people passionate about software. We think that passion is visible in our work. We’re looking for people of all levels, grads to senior developers.


How we work
We almost always try to be highly agile, goal/data driven, and collaborative. Our clients may not be. But even then our consultants and coaches are on hand to help them change to a more innovative way of working.


We predominantly use Rails for web and iOS and Android for mobile. But we're always interesting in other technologies like Node.js, Angular.js, Go. 


We like good work/life balance, limits to bureaucracy, and to letting people figure things out themselves. We have standards if you want to use them, but teams are empowered to ignore or improve on them as their work demands.


That sounds great! What else?
We have all the usual things like healthcare, life insurance, pensions, parties, conference & training budgets, your choice of hardware, beer fridges. But why not tell us what you want from your work life and see if we fit with each other.

title: Cloud Integrations Developer at Atlassian (San Francisco, CA)
description:
If you love solving problems and have a growing appetite for building robust financial systems and integrations in a dynamic environment, Atlassian has a great opportunity for you. The Business Systems team is tasked with optimizing the systems and processes that drive Atlassian from order to cash, purchasing, and people systems. You will be responsible for all aspects of designing and deploying custom interfaces and integrations across various financial modules. Projects will include building customizations and configuring existing systems in order to meet requirements that are unique to Atlassian's business model. While evaluating new technological solutions and making recommendations to enhance existing systems and tools, you will also have the opportunity to partner with Finance and IT teams to support key Business Process Transformation initiatives around Order to Cash and Source to Pay tracks, from systems stand point - this includes developing appropriate documentation for architectural, design, technical, implementation and test activities. Ultimately, it is all about building efficient systems and tools that enable finance teams to make informed, data-driven decisions.


More about You



We love developers/analysts who are self-starters, motivated, data-driven, and carry a relaxed yet enthusiastic attitude. You will need to have a BS/BA/IT Degree or equivalent experience with 2+ years of experience managing and deploying process updates and integration services to/on an ERP platform. Your colleagues describe you as a go-to person for challenges around technical integrations architecture, dealing with complex data structure patterns. If you have hands on experience with REST, Web Services, XML, XSLT and working knowledge of scripting languages (Perl/Python/Php/Unix Shell) and ANSI/SQL, then that's a big plus. You bring with you, a good 3-5 years of experience implementing and supporting ERP applications (NetSuite/Oracle/Workday) and have strong hands-on experience with Integrations like SFDC, AvaTax, 3rd Party Middleware (Boomi, Mulesoft, etc.) and off-the-shelf Billing/Revenue Recognition systems. You must have excellent written, verbal and listening communication skills and be able to prioritize and deliver the most important things first.


You are a good fit if you relish solving challenges, have the ability to see around corners and know whats coming next and your personal mantra is 'bring it on' when faced with a new challenge.

title: Software Engineer - Istanbul at Hazelcast (Üsküdar, Turkey)
description: We are looking for software developers to be involved in all phases (design, development, testing, documentation and support) of Hazelcast software modules.   Qualified candidates should have recent and hands-on experience with Java.   Experience with distributed computing and multi-threaded programming desired.

title: Data Analytics Specialist at Marist College (Poughkeepsie, NY)
description:
Data Analytics Specialist



The Information Technology Department of Marist College is seeking a candidate to assist in development and deployment of data analytics technologies and services for both internal and external groups and organizations.  When engaged internally, the Data Analytics Specialist will work with other College offices and academic departments to assess how data analytics can be used to improve institutional effectiveness by addressing issues such as advancing student performance, increasing retention, and assisting with admissions, advancement and enrollment management.  Working with external clients, the Data Analytics Specialist will support revenue generating activities providing similar services including the development of predictive models that are customized to meet specific client needs.



Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Mathematics, or Statistics and three years of proven working experience as a data analyst.  Position requires significant knowledge of databases, analytic tools, data warehousing, business intelligence techniques, strong data mining skills and developing predictive models.   Candidate should have previous experience using report generation and analytic tools such as Argos, Cognos, SPSS and Pentaho.  Familiarity with Ellucian Banner is a plus.  Ability to multi-task in rapidly changing technological and team-oriented environment and excellent oral and written communication skills are required. 



Marist College is an independent and comprehensive liberal arts institution located in New York's historic Hudson River Valley. Situated on 210 acres overlooking the Hudson River, it enrolls 4,787 traditional undergraduate, 799 full and part-time graduate and 543 continuing education students. Marist also has a branch campus in Florence, Italy, and extension sites throughout New York. Marist has been recognized for excellence by U.S. News & World Report, TIME Magazine, The Princeton Review's The Best 376 Colleges, and Barron's Best Buys in College Education and is noted for being a pioneer in the area of online degree programs.



To learn more or to apply, please visit http://jobs.marist.edu. Only online applications are accepted.



Marist College is strongly committed to the principle of diversity and is especially interested in receiving applications from members of ethnic and racial minority groups, women, persons with disabilities, veterans, and persons from other under-represented groups.



AN EQUAL OPPORTUNITY/AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER



Apply Here



PI91563090

title: Ruby Web Developer at Trimble Navigation (Westminster, CO)
description:
About Trimble Data


Trimble Data develops scalable, cloud-based geospatial systems. Our goal is to make geospatial processing simpler and faster for consumers by interfacing many varied geospatial applications into a cohesive whole.


Our primary system is the Trimble Data Marketplace, a storefront for geospatial data. The Marketplace enables customers to find, customize, and download data quickly and easily.



Ruby Web Developer


We are seeking a self-motivated, creative, and enthusiastic full stack developer to join the Trimble Data Web Development team. As a full-stack developer, you will maintain and design applications from top to bottom and work with everything from front-end HTML, CSS and JS to server-side databases, search indexes, and web servers as well as AWS cloud operations.


As a member of the Trimble Data Web Development team you will leverage new technologies, services and best practices to build the best solutions. You will have the opportunity to develop innovative solutions to new problems and will work with a wide variety of technologies to assist in the design of our API-driven front end UI as well as the backend API itself, all within scalable cloud infrastructure. Developers deal with a wide variety of tasks. A typical week may include coding, architecting, debugging, working with databases, and learning new technologies.


Key Responsibilities




  • Software engineering with a healthy dose of performance engineering and DevOps.




  • Develop, design, and support web app (SaaS), with focus on performance and scalability.




  • Maintain existing systems, while investigating and prototyping new technologies.




  • Build user interfaces to make large sets of data and processing operations available to end users.




  • Design APIs and work with consumers to support automated processing goals.




Work within your team and with other teams to ensure the overall vision of the project is being fulfilled.

title: Senior Backend Web Developer at Architect (London, UK)
description:
We’re looking for a senior backend web developer with OOP experience.


You’re the kind of person that thinks through what they’re writing so that it’s testable, easy to read, and built to last. You can come from a computer science background or have fallen into programming, but either way we want you to be passionate and keen to learn. You should be able to think of the bigger picture of how a project will work, keeping an eye on detail and ensuring total quality management.


Our 12-strong development team mostly use PHP, but we also used JavaScript (Meteor, Node.js) and RoR. The backend development team mostly work on intranets or internal systems, such commonly building or working with APIs. We also have a few consumer-facing sites, and more unusual one-off projects.


Day to day:



  • Writing testable, maintainable, object-oriented code

  • Working with project managers and UX designers to help plan and scope new projects

  • Upholding coding quality standards through code reviews and PRs

  • An ambassador for usability, accessibility and general web standards


We’ll give you:



  • Twice a week fruit delivery

  • Friday breakfast

  • Friday drinks trolley

  • Staff socials

  • Company pension contributions

  • Other benefits (health, dental, discounted gym membership etc)

  • 25 days holiday + bonus day off for your birthday

  • Discretionary annual bonus

  • Bike store and showers

title: Research Technician - Programmer at University of Cambridge (Cambridge, UK)
description:
Applications are invited for a Research Technician / Programmer based at the University of Cambridge under the supervision of Dr Paul Bays. The successful candidate will work on a Wellcome Trust funded research project investigating how internal noise influences human perception and action.


The appointee will develop and support software platforms for experimenting in a technically-advanced lab, including interfacing with motion tracking technology and web-based crowdsourcing methods (e.g. Amazon Mechanical Turk). He/she will also be responsible for sourcing, developing and maintaining the laboratory's equipment and computer facilities. The post would suit someone with a computing background interested in behavioural science, or someone with a scientific background and a keen interest in programming. There will be opportunity to expand the role to include collection and analysis of research data.


If you have any questions about this vacancy or the application process please contact Dr Paul Bays (pmb20@cam.ac.uk). More information is available at http://www.bayslab.com/.


To apply online for this vacancy and to view further information about the role, please visit: http://www.jobs.cam.ac.uk/job/7815. This will take you to the role on the University’s Job Opportunities pages. There you will need to click on the 'Apply online' button and register an account with the University's Web Recruitment System (if you have not already) and log in before completing the online application form.

title: Senior Machine Learning Scientist, Personalization at Booking.com (Amsterdam, Netherlands)
description:
Would you like to translate terabytes of data into unforgettable holidays for millions of people around the globe? Booking.com, the world’s largest accommodation booking website, is looking for rock star Data Scientists to add to join our highly successful Personalization Team within the Front End department.


This team crunches endless amounts of data to provide our customers with the best possible experience. They focus on anything from understanding and predicting market data, to ranking all properties on our website, and providing our customers with the most relevant personalized recommendations.


B.responsible



  • Work in a multi-disciplined team where you’ll take full ownership of turning discoveries and ideas into machine learning models. You’ll use the model’s output to create and improve products for our customers, preferably in short development cycles

  • Research on how to improve customers’ experience, by using our vast amount of data

  • Actively contribute to taking data science at Booking.com to the next level

title: Senior Software Engineer at ALTX (San Francisco, CA)
description:
The Role:
We’re hiring a Senior Software Engineer to build out the next generation of our product and platform. We have a lot of interesting challenges that all involve innovative data delivery within a service-oriented architecture -- from entity detection, related entities, extracting data from unstructured sources, machine learning systems, and a single page application to tell our users about this data.

Our engineering team is collaborative and small, and you’ll have the opportunity to influence positive change within an industry that’s excited about it. You’ll also have the support of in-house subject matter experts from behavioral psychologists to data engineers.

Here’s what you’ll accomplish with us:
* Drive the implementation of components for a Single Page Application, including application frameworks and back end code.
* Coach and mentor peer engineers and recommend best practices and tools.
* Design and build REST APIs and services including data serving, caching, and authentication.
* Employ development best practices and tools in a Continuous Integration environment.

title: Senior Software Engineer (Full Web Stack C#, WPF, Xamarin) at Trainer Road LLC (Reno, NV) (allows remote)
description:
TrainerRoad is looking to expand our engineering group. We're looking for smart software engineers who "get things done". Candidates can be located anywhere on Earth (sorry, Watney).


We're a small group with a lot of potential. Areas of work include Xamarin iOS/OSX, WPF, ASP.net MVC, Web API, HTML/Javascript, Azure, ANT sport devices, Bluetooth Smart sport devices, Build/Test integration, and SQL among others.


Engineers will have the opportunity to work in all of the above technologies, but would be able to focus on particular areas if that's where their passion lies.


We create the world's most effective cycling training software, you can learn more about us at www.trainerroad.com.


Who We're Looking For


We want smart engineers! You should have an intermediate to advanced understanding of the Gang of Four design patterns and how to apply them to software development. The ideal candidate is a "developer's developer" and enjoys reading about programming in their free time, tinkering on the weekends with side projects and staying abreast of the latest frameworks/technologies in their area of expertise.


We basically want someone with a passion for development.


Required Technology Experience



  • C# Experience - Intermediate to Advanced proficiency


Optional Technology Experience



  • ASP.net MVC

  • LINQ

  • Web API

  • Azure

  • Xamarin

  • SQL

  • ReactiveUI

  • WPF

  • Javascript Frameworks (Angular, React, ect)

  • HTML

  • Build/Test CI 


Work Remote or in Reno, Nevada


We're looking for the best candidate worldwide. Don't let a little thing like geography get in the way. One third of our team currently works remotely. It works very well with the help of Slack, Screen Hero, Basecamp, and Github.


We do require you to be able to make our 1pm pacific time standup and have at least a four hour overlap with our 8-5pm mon-fri Reno office hours at least four days a week. 


For example, we have an Australian employee who works from noon to 9pm pacific time Sunday through Thursday (that's his mon-fri). That works just fine for us.


Job Salary
