Let us know what you want to get paid when you submit your resume. We want experienced and proficient engineers. The higher salary you request, the better we expect you to be.


Job Perks



  • Competitive Pay

  • Unlimited Vacation

  • 401k with 4% company matching 

  • 100% of employees individual health care paid

  • Flexible schedule

  • Access to the latest fitness devices (power meters, trainers, sensors, etc.)


Your Resume Should have...



  • Examples of C# projects you have worked on

  • Links to any open source projects you've contributed to

  • Github/StackOverflow username if you'd like

  • Examples of experience in the "Optional Technology Experience" area

  • Links to any sample C# code that you're proud of

  • Your required annual salary


We also Require...


The best engineers only want to work with other great engineers. We've found that the best way to find great engineers is to actually have them code, not just answer trivia questions during an interview.


That's why we require applications to do a refactoring exercise as part of their job submission. The right candidate won't find this a pain in the ass; it should be enjoyable.


This also weeds out the vast majority of candidates who just fire off resumes everywhere. In our previous job posting, 90% of candidates did NOT do this step.


The refactoring exercise is attached to this job posting. It has a readme.txt in it with instructions.


Excited about our Company?


In your application let us know why you want to work with us and why you think you'd be a good fit for our company.


FAQs


Do I have to be a cyclist to apply?


Nope! We'll encourage you to ride, and will even buy you an entry level bike if you want, but it's not required. Not everyone in the company is a cyclist.


What's unlimited vacation mean?


We don't keep track of vacation hours. The CEO of TrainerRoad used to be an engineer at a Fortune 500 company where life was a grind. We believe employees put out their best work when they are happy and not burnt out.


If you're brain just isn't working at 3pm, we encourage employees to go home and rest up. It does no one any good to sit and stare at the computer screen for another two hours. We don't track that time.


Employees generally shoot for around four weeks of REAL vacation time (no e-mail checking) but some take more and some take less.  The thing we care about is how productive you can be and how much value you can add to the company. Bottom line, we want people who are passionate and get things done. If you meet those requirements everything else works itself out.


That being said, if you end up taking massive amounts of vacation, come in late, leave early and aren't producing outstanding work we're going to have a problem.


How do you work?


We try to work as pragmaticly as we can.  We have excellent designers on staff who go from mockups to responsive HTML with light javascript work.


Development uses Github with a strict pull request process. We test, comment, refactor and improve each other's pull requests.


We have partial test coverage and we can definitely improve in that area (maybe you can help?).


We often pair program via Screen Hero.


Our developers float between mobile, desktop and web development. Our future engineers can specialize in one area if that's where their passion is.


You didn't ask about education, what's required?


Please put your education on your resume, but we're not going to reject someone because they don't have a degree in Computer Science. We understand that some of the best and most passionate engineers are self taught.


This is the longest job posting ever, when does it end?


Right now! Congrats if you made it this far! We look forward to looking at your resume and refactoring exercise.

title: Software Engineer - Visual Editor at Wikimedia Foundation (San Francisco, CA) (allows remote)
description:
Summary


As a core engineer you will be deeply involved in the VisualEditor project, building a sophisticated, elegant and responsive visual interface for editing content on Wikimedia websites using JavaScript, CSS, AJAX and HTML5 technologies. You will join the Editing Department, where we build collaborative, inclusive tools for creating and editing free knowledge.


Description



  • Develop Visual Editor's contextual and toolbar-based interaction tools, ensuring they are simple, consistent and intuitive on all platforms

  • Help develop other elements of VisualEditor as needed

  • Participate in and conduct design and code reviews, and discuss discuss design, development & testing of features

  • Support testing efforts for deployments of features

title: Senior Quality Assurance Engineer at Sparx (Exeter, UK)
description:
You’ll use your skills and expertise to help bolster, improve and optimise our testing process to ensure robustness of the Sparx system.  You’ll be working directly with developers and other quality assurance engineers, immersing yourself into our Agile/SCRUM environment.


If you’ve got a strong academic background in a technical subject, experience with programming languages and a passion for technology, then you’ll relish this opportunity.


Key responsibilities:



  • Performing quality reviews to ensure solutions meet our high standards.

  • Providing early feedback from exploratory testing to resolve issues as soon as possible.

  • Logging, retesting and closing bugs, reproducing and debugging issues and providing developers with good bug reports.

  • Helping to maintain our testing and demonstration infrastructure and hardware.

  • Designing and implementing automated tests.

  • Working with the wider Sparx team to ensure the product is the best it can be.

  • Being a good team player – help out if someone asks.

  • Being positive and infectiously enthusiastic about the values and vision of Sparx.

title: Senior Front-end Developer at Coolblue (Rotterdam, Netherlands)
description:
As a Senior Front-end Developer you maintain the balance between creativity and functionality for our web shops, and you coach your fellow developers. 


What you tell your friends you do
"I am the chosen one who brings balance to the force."


What you will really be doing



  • Improving the usability and performance of our web shops.

  • Delivering a working functionality for our web shops, once every two weeks.


How will you be doing this?



  • You are an all-rounder in a Scrum team. Besides your own specialization you will learn to perform all other tasks within the team.

  • You prioritize your own work together with your team and Product Owner. You will receive immediate feedback from end users and you will have a lot of opportunities to experiment.

  • You will be using the right tools for whatever job will be thrown at you. Choices that were made in the past are not rules.

  • You will work in a motivated team to meet ambitious deadlines. There is always a budget for good ideas.

  • Big data and experience are your gurus, your gut feeling isn't. To measure is to know.


What we have worked on last quarter



  • Responsive design. One codebase, lots of devices, but always the optimal user experience.

  • Reviews. A completely new infrastructure for better performance and scalability. Improved usability for both customers and moderators. More reviews, more interaction, less spam, better conversion rates.


What a day in the office might look like
You and the interaction designer from your Scrum team finalize the first step of the new checkout.  Proudly you examine the result: a well-considered combination of semantically correct HTML(5) and Javascript/Jquery and CSS(3) for added value. All in order to create an optimal user experience.Now, you are both dying to start working on the next sprint regarding the payment page. You and the other developers have made very sure, over the last few weeks, to keep things as simple as (humanly) possible. So, creating this page should be a piece of cake.


Team
You will be working in a team with three to five other developers, each of them with their own specialization, ranging from PHP to Javascript. Your team will be managed by a Scrum Master and a Product Owner.

title: Software QA Engineer - Zurich, Switzerland at PlusQuote.net AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
description:
We are a young and growing startup company based in Zürich, Switzerland. We already hit the market with one product, Quiz4Deal, and we are now developing the second one. The new cloud-based enterprise-grade product is developed by our Zürich-based development team, for which we are currently hiring.


Your challenges



  • Be a valuable part of our great team: participate in the creative process of product development, bring new ideas on the table, challenge and improve the existing ones

  • Be ready to find creative solutions to client requirements (we don’t speak “impossible”)

  • Develop comprehensive unit tests, stress tests, integration tests, and code quality tests

  • Encourage and motivate the team to follow the test-driven development process

  • Fine-tune servers and services; benchmark these to find the sweet spot in the parameter space so that our products are fast and reliable

  • Never stop learning, be up to date with current technologies and future trends


You are a young, dynamic, fast and avid learner who wants to join our offices in Zürich as a Software QA Engineer. You understand that in a Web 2.0 startup, the agility and the quick response to the consumer needs are critical. You have some years of experience as software developer, and at least 1 year of Java development. You understand the concepts of distributed systems, you have experience with large scale data processing (Big Data), machine learning and process optimisation. Additionally, you worked with Cassandra, Hadoop, JUnit, Mockito and/or Spark. You have a solid understanding of OOP and classical relational databases. You are familiar with the Scrum methodology, you are fluent in English (written and spoken) and you have at least a BA/BS in Information Technology, Computer Science or equivalent. You must be eligible to work in Switzerland.


We offer a full time position in a friendly, flexible and fun working environment in a small team. An open, fluid environment where we not only share ideas but also contribute towards the development of our peers in the team. This is a growth opportunity that can lead to a nice progression within the company.

title: Web Developer at Greenhouse Partners (Boulder, CO)
description:
Who We Are:



Greenhouse Partners is a professional services firm focused on the growth of brands and people. We have high profile, national and international clients and work with early stage growth companies and leaading small to mid-size national brands across multiple verticals including consumer packaged goods, real estate, cable, financial services, and many more.



We serve our clients through five core competencies:



  • Greater Purpose and Culture: Includes Vision, Values, Mission, Culture Development and Evolution, HR Strategy, and Internal Understanding and Buy-in

  • Research, Insights, Brand Strategy: Includes all forms of Stakeholder and Competitive Research, Actionable Insights, Brand Positioning, Annual Planning, Content Strategy, Brand Personality, Brand Architecture, Brand Roles

  • Core Creative: Includes Name, Logo, Tagline, Visual Identity System, Concepts, Campaigns

  • Stakeholder Experience: Includes Digital, Advertising, Social, Video, Sales Support, Grassroots, Mobile, Retail Environment, Internal Communications, Thought Leadership, Events, Public Relations

  • Innovation: Includes Ideas, Methodology, Facilitation, Products, Services, Packaging



Our culture is inspiring, entrepreneurial, and collaborative – driven by smart, strategic, creative people focused on growing our clients’ brands. Greenhouse Partners has a high-performance environment requiring creative problem solving and a commitment to doing amazing work.




What We Are Looking For:



Digital Associate: We are looking for a Web Developer with 4-8 years of experience who wants to work in a collaborative, entrepreneurial, positive environment. Our ideal candidate will possess strong knowledge and experience in all things digital.



Job Description:



  • Consult with broad team on strategic discussions and decisions related to all-things-digital

  • Consult with our design team on IA/UX/UI best practices during the design phase

  • Export optimized graphics (standard and high-dpi) from PSD design files

  • Translate PSD files into standards based HTML/CSS/JS using responsive design

  • Setup hosting environment and address technical requirements for CMS 

  • Install CMS and needed add-ons

  • Integrate front-end programming into CMS

    • Maintain ongoing client needs and development within CMS





Must Haves:



  • Expert knowledge of HTML5, CSS, and PHP

  • Deep knowledge of JavaScript language, not just specific frameworks

  • Demonstrated CSS framework experience including but not limited to Sass

  • Able to design, code and assemble an entire website from concept to delivery

  • Knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, and Flash

  • Experience with SEO, SEM, social media, mobile and app development

  • Up-to-date on digital trends and strategic implications related to decisions

  • Conceptual skills and general design skills are a plus.

  • Ability to lead complex development projects, including working with client-side development teams (sometimes integrating with data services), and translating complicated topics into understandable concepts for the client



Bonus Points:



  • Experience with Git code versioning system

  • Drupal

  • Wordpress

  • ExpressionEngine

  • Previous integration experience with ASP.NET



Applicants must be committed to:



  • Exhibiting a high level of personal accountability in work product and career growth of self and others

  • Bringing energy, passion, and optimism to work every day

  • Doing amazing work



Please email portfolio and resume to Greenhouse Partners at kgreenawalt@greenhousepartners.com and include “Digital” in the subject line. No calls please.

title: Software Engineers at Apex Learning (Seattle, WA)
description:
Apex Learning is headquartered in Seattle and is looking for talented Software Engineers to join our creative, dynamic, and supportive Technology team based out of our Seattle office. Our Software Engineers collaborate with senior-level staff to develop, test, and deploy critical business applications using current and past .NET Framework versions and SQL server technologies.


We are a shop with mature Agile implementation and wide company support that strives to explore new technologies to solve our challenges. This is a great opportunity to have your contributions count at a company that is truly passionate about making a difference for students by contributing to their future.


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Coordinate with the Client Support team to address platform defects and issues reported by customers.

  • Assist senior-level technical staff and Product Management to build, test, and deploy new features or enhancements to existing features.

  • Utilize both Agile and traditional software lifecycle methodologies.

  • Analyze performance of software interfaces and identify alternatives for optimizing the usage of computer resources.

  • Apply generally accepted programming standards and techniques to assure efficient program logic and data manipulation.

  • Participate in designing, coding, testing, debugging, configuring, and documenting and software.

  • Provide assistance and routine consultation to users in the development of operating systems and software.

  • Plan and execute software version upgrade releases and custom interfaces.

  • Collaborate with others to develop alternative system and software designs.

  • Other duties as assigned.


QUALIFICATIONS



  • Bachelor’s Degree (B.A.) in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering, or a related field.

  • 2+ years of development experience with the Microsoft .NET platform, including C#, VB.NET, ADO.NET, and ASP.NET.

  • 2+ years of direct development experience in Microsoft SQL Server technologies, including SQL 2005 and more recent versions.

  • Strong knowledge of and experience with Microsoft SQL programming and best practices.

  • A great attitude and a team focused mind set.

  • Ability to pass a pre-employment background check.

  • Ability to pass a Social Security Administration E-Verify check for U.S. work authorization.


HOW TO APPLY


We’d love to hear from you! Please submit your resume via our careers portal, found at: https://jobs-apexlearning.icims.com/jobs

title: PaaS Software Developer at Cloud Foundry (London, UK)
description:
The Cloud Foundry engineering team is looking for a few great engineers to join us in building an open source platform that transforms how the world deploys and scales software.


You


You love shipping features, but know that well factored code is what lets you keep shipping features in the long run.  Maybe you get antsy writing code without tests, or perhaps you’re a large-scale system operator interested in leveling-up your coding skills.


Either way, you measure your success by the success of your team; you are interested in learning about distributed systems; and you are excited to work on open source.


Us


Cloud Foundry is co-developed with Pivotal Labs, a leader in the field of agile software development. We are opinionated about how software should be built. We pair program, all-day every-day, because we know it delivers remarkable results. We work in small teams, and rotate between them frequently. We believe in working at a sustainable pace – you’ll typically code hard for 8 hours each day, but then you’re off work to relax, recharge, and refocus.


As part of the London team, you’ll be immersed in all the latest database technologies – Cassandra, Neo4j, Redis, MongoDB, Memcached, Elasticsearch, and more.  A solid understanding of these services as well as VM and container technologies (cgroups, LXC, Docker) is a plus.


To make sure you start your day energized, we provide a catered breakfast every weekday morning, and unlimited snacks/drinks are of course available all day. Our collaborative, open-plan office space is filled with talented, like-minded engineers who enjoy taking advantage of our weekly Tech Talks, playing ping pong, and hanging out with their co-workers.


We’re seeking more amazing developers to add to our London team. Apply by sending us a resume and a cover letter.

title: Web Crawling Frontend Developer at Bloomberg LP (Princeton, NJ)
description:
The Role:

Data Technologies R&D in our Princeton, NJ office is seeking a talented, motivated UI programmer to assist in re-imagining and development of our Web Crawler creation application suite. Bloomberg's web crawling technologies are some of the most advanced web scraping capabilities in the world. Candidate must be experienced in designing and coding applications, possess strong object-oriented analysis and design skills, and have experience with web technologies (html, xml, xslt, http). Candidate should have significant experience in the areas of multi-threading and design patterns.

title: Software Developer for Scientific Applications at Stellar Science (Albuquerque, NM)
description:
Stellar Science is a growing Albuquerque-based scientific software development company seeking talented software developers to create and extend exciting scientific and engineering analysis applications. We maintain high standards in all our software development efforts, utilizing modern development practices including continuous integration, test-driven development, and code reviews in order to develop high quality, maintainable, and reusable code. By employing a lightweight development process, we remain highly productive and responsive to changing customer needs.

We develop custom software products in domains that include computer vision and image processing, image simulation, high power microwave systems modeling and simulation, laser source generation and effects modeling, computational electromagnetics (CEM), space situational awareness (SSA), high performance computing (HPC), and computer aided design (CAD) tools, among others.

Applicants may range from recent college graduates to experienced software engineers; the main requirements are that candidates be top-notch, responsible, self-motivated, honest, able to work well independently or in small teams, and be able to rapidly learn new languages, tools, and techniques as needed to meet mission requirements.

Minimum Requirements:

  • B.S. in computer science, physics, math, engineering, or a related field
  • Substantial software development experience
  • Object-oriented design and programming in Java or C++
  • Ability to implement, understand, and maintain mathematical and scientific codes
  • U.S. citizen willing to undergo background investigation and perform some work at Kirtland Air Force Base

Desired:

  • M.S. or Ph.D. in computer science or a scientific or engineering field with substantial software development experience

Experience in any of the following is a plus:

  • Cross-platform software development on Linux, Windows, Mac
  • 3D graphics using Open Scene Graph and/or OpenGL
  • User interface development with Qt, Java Swing, Gwt
  • Supercomputing, OpenMP, threads, MPI, GPUs
  • Microsoft Visual Studio, Qt Creator, Eclipse
  • Google closure or similar tools for large-scale javascript development
  • OSGi, orekit, commons.math
  • Image processing, imagery analysis, or computer vision
  • Aerospace vehicles, orbital mechanics, electromagnetics, space situtational awareness
  • Directed energy modeling and simulation
  • Computer aided design (CAD)

A representative sample of your code may be requested early in the evaluation process, e.g. something you've written for work, for a class, or for fun. It need not compile, but should be long enough to help evaluate your programming and software engineering skills.

Stellar Science is a forward-thinking business that allows its developers and scientists to work at home on occasion when consistent with job requirements. Standard benefits include ten paid federal holidays (which may be floated as desired), three weeks vacation, a generous fully employer-funded SEP IRA, and fully employer-funded health insurance, as well as dental, disability, and life insurance.

All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, or national origin, in accordance with CFR 60-1.

title: Big Data Architect at HelloFresh (Berlin, Germany)
description:
HelloFresh is among the Top 3 largest companies to come out of Europe over the past 4 years (market cap). Our growth trajectory and expansion has been phenomenal – only 3 years after inception we are active in 7 markets on 3 continents, all of which are managed and maintained from our global headquarters in Berlin.


We aim to revolutionize the way we eat by making it more convenient and exciting to cook meals from scratch at home. We have received almost US$ 200mn in venture capital and have won multiple prizes for our work. Our team is diverse, high-performing and international, helping us to create a truly inspiring work environment in which you will thrive! Join us and help building up a fresh food global champion!


About the job


As a Big Data Architect at HelloFresh, you will be in charge of building, scaling and architecting one of the most advanced big data platforms in Europe. You will develop a distributed BI system that processes data in near-time and real-time, with focus on scalability, data quality and integration of machine learning models. 



  • Plan, Implement and maintain a distributed data warehouse using the Hadoop ecosystem, real-time event processing engine and message brokers

  • Develop data warehouse process models, real-time, near-time and batch ETL processes, perform data enrichment, record linkage and integration of distributed statistical models

  • Create or implement metadata processes and frameworks

  • Create plans, test files, and scripts for testing the BI framework, ranging from unit to continuous integration testing

  • Review designs, codes, test plans, and documentation to ensure quality

title: Localization Developer at Translate House (Fleet, UK) (allows remote)
description:
Translate is looking for a localization developer to join our team.


You will be working with us on Pootle, our open source community localization platform.  Pootle itself is used by commercial companies and open source projects such as LibreOffice, Mozilla and Evernote.


Your development skills in Python and Django will be important to help build Pootle.  But as, and if not more importantly, your skills and experience in localization are critical.  Marrying your experience in the issues and problems of localization with your coding skills makes the code that your produce able to address the real needs of localizers.


You will be part of a remote team, working from home. You will contribute in all aspects of the product evolution, coding, specification, testing and deployment.  We work openly with our code hosted on Github and the majority of our development work happening in public.

title: Developer (DevEngineer) at ING (Bucharest, Romania)
description:
At ING Bank, we work according to the Scrum-Agile methodology.


In short time sprints, you will be bringing new business expectations from paper to production. Your exact role within a project will depend on the type of project and your technical skills, but the main focus will be on:



  • gathering the requirements;

  • designing and developing the functionality;

  • testing the developments;

  • implementing aftercare (monitoring/maintenance);



In addition, the key responsibilities in the position of Developer are:


Analysis and Design: refinement of the product backlog and decomposition of product backlog items into user stories; estimation of the complexity of user stories and decomposition of user stories into sprint tasks; the creation of designs, including solution and data models, user experience, and application architecture;


Coding & Packing Configuration: code debugging / code refactoring / configuration of middleware for application use and configuration of applications and packages;


Build and Package: configuration of build servers and workflow;


Tests: creating automated functional tests for user stories; building SMOKE tests as well as building and executing (automated) functional and integration tests; building (automated) user acceptance and production tests.

title: (Senior) Ruby on Rails Developer for Startup in Munich at Shore GmbH (München, Germany)
description:
We are Germany’s leading provider of web-based business solutions for local service providers and offer locally operating businesses a user-friendly communication and productivity-software open to all industries. All features – from the online appointment booking function to a customer management system and intelligent marketing tools – are combined in one cloud-based solution.

Experience the unique spirit of a start-up with an ever-improving product and service and quickly develop your skills in a low hierarchy environment! Be part of something bigger. Apply now!


Your Tasks


You are responsible for shaping and implementing best practices. You develop new features for our products and consult product owners to help them define solutions. You are a team player, helping in ramp-up processes and sharing knowledge with other developers.


Your Profile



  • Bachelor's or Master's degree in Informatics, Information Technology, Computer Sciences or related field

  • 3-5 years of Ruby on Rails Development experience

  • Ruby, SQL, JavaScript (jQuery, JSON), HTML + CSS (Sass/Less), Linux, GIT and Test Driven Development

  • You are a quick learner and a team player


Nice-to-have



  • Experience in SOA, AWS, docker and scaling databases

  • An open-source profile with own projects/plugins

  • Knowledge of modern JavaScript Frameworks (Backbone.js, Ember.js, AngularJS)


 Additional Info



  • Start date: asap

  • Location: Munich (relocation covered)

  • Salary: competitive


Contact Info:


Human Resources


Phone: +49 89 416143312
job@shore.com

title: Senior Software Engineer Python - Join us at dubizzle, Dubai! at Dubizzle Middle East FZ LLC (Dubai, United Arab Emirates)
description:
Are you a thought leader and expert in your technology stack? Can you solve any task thrown at you, irrespective of complexity or scale? Do you mentor those in your team and push the boundaries of perfection? Do you know which corners can and can't be cut? Delivering A-class products that scale to millions of users,  applying new industry trends and challenging your peers are all part of the daily gig.


Our Senior Software Engineers conceive, design and deliver the most complex products within their stream. They have an intimate knowledge of the business domain and always put our user's experience first.


Your Responsibilities?



  • Hit the ground running - Gather up-to-date and in-depth understanding of the dubizzle code base and technologies stack within weeks;

  • Lead planning sessions around new product features, deliver detailed roll-out/roll-back strategies for releases.

  • Research and apply industry trends as part of your daily work;

  • Create unit tests in accordance with our established standards to cover assigned work;

  • Write and maintain exemplary code following dubizzle’s programming practices;

  • Actively contribute in post-release maintenance issues;

  • Develop elegant solutions for complex problems;

  • Pioneer reliability and efficiency of our current code base, platforms and/or core systems;

  • Impact on the direction and scope of dubizzle’s technical vision within your stream;

  • Define the architecture of your product steam;

  • Gain a detailed understanding of the complete architecture of our product and the position of your product stream in it;

  • Work in a mentoring capacity within a peer-programming environment and provide guidance on tasks, irrespective of complexity or scale;

  • Code review all major pull requests, defining programming standards and providing constructive feedback.

  • Provide and share a broad knowledge of technologies and architectures and function as a mentor within the scope of your product stream (and outside of it when required);

  • Capacity to push back requirements when incomplete;

  • Handle the entire software development life cycle, end to end

title: Software Engineer at Panduit (Folsom, CA)
description: Panduit’s software team in Folsom, CA, develops next-generation technologies that view data centers as a system to be optimized to save energy and run reliably. We're looking for a range of junior to senior level engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including UI design, data storage and retrieval, third-party device communication and control, distributed computing, large-scale system design, security, enterprise scalability, functional programming; the list goes on and is always growing. As a software engineer, you will be a member of a dynamic development team where you will apply your software engineering skills on commercially released products critical to Panduit’s corporate vision with opportunities to switch focus to other components of the system as you and our products grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, self-motivating, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full stack as we continue to push technology forward.

title: Applications Developer (French Services) - MON04037 / Développeur d'applications at CBC/Radio-Canada (Montreal, QC, Canada)
description:
Applications Developer (French Services) - MON04037



What it’s like working at CBC/Radio-Canada


Whether on-air or behind the scenes, here you join a team that thrives on making the connections and telling the stories that are important to Canadians. So, if you’ve got the ability to keep up with the pace of our ever-changing industry, the passion to make the next great idea even better and the drive to make things happen, this is the place for you.



Please note this is a temporary position for one year.



CBC/Radio-Canada's Media Infrastructures and Media Presentation team is currently seeking a talented and Application Developer to join the media expert group. Based in Montreal, this position focuses primarily on the analysis, programming and integration of applications in accordance with best practices and established standards.



You are also responsible for handling support and maintenance requests, as well as for troubleshooting and debugging computer systems.



As Application Developer, you have the following duties:



  • Identify the appropriate programming language for each target platform

  • Develop applications in the various programming languages, then test, debug and document your code to ensure highly reliable system integration

  • Document architecture and technical solutions according to the internal standards

  • Support and maintain applications, in addition to answer questions and fix troubleshooting

  • Ensure effective implementation and integration of applications, as well as the availability of appropriate documentation

  • Provide leadership in handling high-level technical issues

  • Produce implementation plans for approved changes, ensure that the various stages of the system construction, integration, testing and implementation are carefully planned and carried out

  • Research, analyze and document technical requirements of complex systems based on the functionality required by the client

  • Analyze complex business requirements and recommend appropriate, efficient and cost-effective solutions

  • Conduct feasibility studies for new technologies and draft detailed technical specifications

  • Participate in the delivery of new applications and the maintenance/enhancement of existing ones, with lead responsibility for technical issues

  • Coordinate application systems problem resolution with software vendors, hardware vendors, and internal staff



You possess:



  • Bachelor’s degree in computer science or the equivalent

  • Minimum of three (3) years of experience in a Multi applications  Developer role with one of the major development framework, such as .Net, Java or Python

  • Knowledge of relational databases, NOSQL and at least one ORM

  • Understanding of the SOA architecture and its various possible implementations. Strong interest in various techniques of integration

  • Solid knowledge of development and deployment tools  in a large company (Source Management, Project Management, EDI)

  • Knowledge of several of the following programming languages: Python, Perl, PHP, Ruby on Rails, Java, Javascript, C, C +, C #, Shell scripting is an asset

  • A strong interest in agile methodologies, Python, Linux and Open Source is an important asset

  • Excellent communication skills (spoken and written)

  • Client service skills

  • Excellent interpersonal skills

  • Experience working in a collaborative, teamwork-driven environment

  • Up to date on the latest development technologies, trends and approaches, while staying committed to projects and support requests

  • Ability to act as a technical mentor

  • Ability to learn other programming languages

  • Knowledge of English


Candidates may be subject to skills and knowledge testing.



CBC/Radio-Canada is committed to reflecting our country’s diversity.



In becoming the leader in expressing Canadian culture and enriching democratic life, we need to be as diverse in every way as the country we serve, both within our workforce and on air. As an employer, we value equal opportunity and nurture an inclusive workplace where our individual differences are not only recognized and valued, but also extend to and pervade all the services we provide as Canada's public broadcaster.



For more information, visit the Talent and Diversity section of our corporate website.



If this sounds interesting, please apply online! We thank all applicants for their interest, but only candidates selected for an interview will be contacted.



Please apply online at: https://rita.illicohodes.com/go/55c8957312497d478d547a1c/52cc274258b7007a6ef89fd6/en



-----------------------------------



Développeur d'applications (Services français) - MON04037



Travailler à CBC/Radio-Canada


Que ce soit pour travailler en ondes ou en coulisse, vous pourriez faire partie d’un groupe dynamique, qui réussit à créer des liens et à présenter des sujets qui passionnent les Canadiens. Alors si vous avez la capacité d’évoluer dans une industrie en pleine transformation, la passion nécessaire pour que la prochaine grande idée soit encore meilleure et la volonté de réaliser de grandes choses, ce poste est pour vous!



Veuillez noter qu'il s'agit d'un poste temporaire d'une durée d'un an.



L'équipe de services d'Infrastructure médias et centre de diffusion de Radio-Canada est activement à la recherche d'un Développeur d'applications talentueux pour rejoindre le groupe d'expert-médias. Le poste qui est basé à Montréal, se concentrera  principalement sur l’analyse, la programmation et l'intégration des applications selon les meilleures pratiques et standards établis.



De plus, vous seriez responsable de demandes de soutien et de maintenance en plus de répondre aux problèmes de systèmes informatiques et d’effectuer les corrections des bogues.



En tant que Développeur d'applications vous aurez à:



  • Identifier les langages de programmation appropriés pour chaque plateforme visée;

  • Faire le développement en différents langages de programmation,  procéder aux tests, débogage et à la documentation afin d'obtenir une intégration des systèmes hautement fiable;

  • Documenter l'architecture et les solutions techniques en conformité avec les standards internes;

  • Mettre en œuvre le support et l'entretien des applications en plus de répondre aux questions et résoudre les problèmes;

  • Assurer l'implantation et l'intégration efficaces des applications et documentations appropriées;

  • Faire preuve de leadership dans la gestion des problèmes techniques de haut niveau ;

  • Produire les plans de mise-en-œuvre pour les changements approuvés en s’assurant que les différentes étapes de la construction, de l'intégration, des tests et de l'implantation du système soient attentivement planifiés et effectués;

  • Rechercher, analyser et documenter les exigences techniques des systèmes complexes en fonction des fonctionnalités exigées par le client;

  • Analyser les besoins d'affaire complexes et recommander des solutions appropriées, rentables et efficaces;

  • Procéder aux études de faisabilité pour la nouvelle technologie et rédiger les spécifications techniques détaillées;

  • Contribuer à la livraison des nouvelles applications ainsi qu'à l'entretien des applications existantes en exerçant un leadership technique;

  • Coordonner la résolution des problèmes de système d'application avec les fournisseurs de logiciels, de matériel et le personnel interne.



Vous possédez :



  • Baccalauréat en informatique (ou l'équivalent);

  • Minimum de trois (3) années d'expérience dans un rôle de développeur d'applications multi-tiers avec l’un des « Framework » de développement majeur tel que .Net, Java ou Python;

  • Connaissance des bases de données relationnelle, NOSQL et d'au moins un ORM;

  • Comprendre l’architecture SOA et ses diverses implémentations possibles. Intérêt marqué pour les diverses techniques d'intégration;

  • Connaissance approfondie des outils de développement et de déploiement dans une grande entreprise (Gestion de source, gestion de projet, IDE);

  • Connaissance de plusieurs des langages de programmations suivants: Python, Perl, PHP, Ruby on rails, Java, Javascript, C, C+, C#, Shell script est un atout;

  • Un intérêt marqué pour les méthodologies agiles, Python, Linux et l’Open Source est un atout important.

  • Excellentes habiletés de communication (à l'oral et à l'écrit);

  • Aptitude avec le service client;

  • Excellentes habiletés interpersonnelles;

  • Expérience de travail dans un environnement axé sur le travail d'équipe et la collaboration;

  • Être à l'affût des plus récentes technologies, tendances et approches en matière de développement tout en restant engagé aux projets et aux demandes de support;

  • Aptitude à agir comme mentor technique;

  • Capacité d'apprendre d'autres langages de programmation.


Les candidats peuvent être soumis à des tests de compétences et de connaissances.



CBC/Radio-Canada est engagé à refléter la diversité canadienne.



À titre de chef de file de l’expression de la culture canadienne et de l’enrichissement de la vie démocratique du pays, nous devons afficher par tous les moyens la même diversité que le pays que nous servons, tant au sein de notre effectif qu’à l’antenne. En tant qu’employeur, nous valorisons l’égalité des chances et favorisons un milieu de travail inclusif, où nos différences individuelles sont non seulement reconnues et mises en valeur, mais se retrouvent également dans tous les services que nous offrons comme radiodiffuseur public du Canada. 



Pour plus d’information, visitez la section Talent et Diversité de notre site web institutionnel.



Si ce poste vous intéresse, postulez en ligne! Nous remercions les candidats de leur intérêt, toutefois, nous ne communiquerons qu’avec les personnes retenues pour une entrevue.



SVP Postulez en ligne au: https://rita.illicohodes.com/go/55c8957312497d478d547a1c/52cc274258b7007a6ef89fd6/fr

title: C++ Software Engineer at B-Line Medical (Washington, DC)
description:
B-Line Medical, a leader in healthcare simulation, is on the lookout for a brilliant C++ software engineer. You will be working alongside a small team of very capable software engineers, QA engineers and product managers to help develop and advance our video products and web-platform. Our platform is used by 7 out of the top 10 medical schools, and helps train more than 50% of all medical students in the country. If you know C++ inside and out, and enjoy low level programming, we’d love to have you on our team.


Our team culture can be described as creative, problem solving, and fun. We're engineering-driven from the top down, and we really believe in delivering the best product in our industry.


Our video products are a key part of our web platform. They allow customers to capture, encode, and stream high-resolution video from multiple video angles, synchronized with real-time data from medical devices. We support video using our own encoders, along with custom-built applications for devices such as Google Glass.  These devices in real time transmit to our centralization server to be accessed through an elegant web interface. You’ll be working on these products along with the web platform.

title: Do You C#? - Expert developer for internal tools and automated tests at Milestone Systems (Brøndby, Denmark)
description:
Your passion and your quest


Delivering quality software is your passion and your quest. You have the technical expertise, proven coding skills and now the opportunity to make this a reality. From our engineering playground at Milestone Systems, you will continuously maintain and innovate our in-house solution for automated testing of Milestone Systems’ product suite. A glimpse from your everyday contains:



  • Design and development of high quality software used for continuous integration and test automation

  • Providing improvements and new ideas for our continuous integration framework

  • Working closely with our development teams in Copenhagen, Denmark and Sofia, Bulgaria



The Test Automation team and our engineering playground


The focus of your team is to invent, design, build and maintain our test automation framework, and in cooperation with our feature teams develop test suites for our software. In this regard, you will also be engaged in instructing and supporting the end users of our tools and frameworks, why your communication skills must reflect this.


Our work is closely coordinated between our teams in Copenhagen and Sofia. You will have daily contact with developers in both locations as we drive the Milestone test automation effort. The rich interaction between functional and cultural diversities foster creative play with technology both in the daily collaboration and at the annual Engineering Challenge, where all functions meet to innovate new features.



Your tech stack and other important skills


You will be in contact with a wealth of Microsoft technologies including C#/.NET, TFS, WCF Services, Powershell, and Microsoft System Center 2012 R2. It is desirable that you have an interest in Windows instrumentation and we expect that you exhibit a deep understanding of .NET including topics such as reflection and LINQ. Other required skills/experiences are:



  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Software Engineering

  • 3 years of experience with developing commercial software

  • You need to B# on C# and .NET

  • Fluent in written and spoken English

  • Experience with Microsoft System Center 2012 R2

  • Analytical and structured

  • Interest in teamwork across functions and countries

  • Kick-ass attitude and will to confront any challenges standing between you and building great solutions



Career and perks


Milestone Systems is a great place for you to continue your career. We have a career model that supports your development, and the perks are numerous:




  • Individual career path – technical and leadership growth, enhanced by learning and development program, regular 1:1 follow-ups with your manager

  • Multicultural environment with IT professionals from a wide range of countries in a high-tech organization

  • Healthy work environment - company sponsored “All Inclusive” program with breakfast, lunch, afternoon snack, fruit and beverages, health insurance, massage and company bikes

  • Social work environment – active employee club hosting events like cooking classes, tasting events, outdoor activities, cultural events, Friday bar and annual Christmas and summer parties

  • Work life balance – flexible working hours and five extra vacation days



The future is up to you


Take your valuable C# skills to the next level. Become part of our fast growing high-tech company by submitting your CV in English today.


For more information, please contact Software Architect & Engineering Manager, Lars Hammer at +45 50 842 565, or visit our website: www.milestonesys.com.


The future is up to you!

title: Front End Developer / Integration Specialist at Digital Animal (Birmingham, UK)
description:
As a Front end Developer you will work as part of our Birmingham-based Development team to:



  • Create - create new advocacy solutions for our clients.

  • Build - create tools to support the creation and management of advocacy campaigns.

  • Integrate - help clients’ developers implement Digital Animal's technology on their websites

  • Support - help support clients in dealing with integration issues.



Who are we looking for?


We are looking for a web developer with strong front end development skills. You have both the ability to write good code and an eye for layout, design and UX.  You will have spent time integrating third party technology in your own web sites and applications, and as a result have an appreciation for the nuances of creating web-based technologies.


You will be a crucial part of our development team. You will be involved in projects from concept to completion. You will work closely with members of our consulting team and with our development team. You will communicate directly with client developers throughout the design and implementation of their marketing campaigns.


You will be involved in designing and building new solutions in our Labs projects.



Characteristics required:


We are interested in your characteristics and not just your skills and experience.


These are the key characteristics we apply to everything we do. You will possess these characteristics too:



  • Thoughtfulness at start

  • Communication, helpfulness & openness during

  • Quality & precision throughout

  • Organisation & structure throughout

  • Learning & sharing knowledge at the end



For this specific role, we are looking for someone who:



  • Is digitally savvy.

  • Is able to communicate clearly in writing and in speaking

  • Has an organised and systematic approach, complemented by creative flair

  • Pays close attention to detail

  • Believes in excellent customer service

  • Wants to learn about digital advertising and data

  • Has a passion for technology, social media, advertising and marketing

  • Wants to be part of a fast-growing startup with big ambitions



Ideally you will also have experience with Web technologies used by our clients; and with design technology, including:



  • Creative design, layout and UX

  • A basic knowledge of automated testing

  • Coding in cross browser compatible HTML, Javascript and CSS

  • Responsive design and coding

  • Vanilla Javascript as well as the popular Javascript frameworks

  • A basic knowledge of Photoshop, Illustrator, Fireworks, InDesign or similar

  • Exposure to the MEAN stack

  • Working closely (and patiently!) with client developers.

  • Strong use of source code repositories, like Git and understanding of Git workflow

  • Willingness to learn new technologies

  • Familiarity with Cloud based SAS applications

  • Experience in contributing to open source projects is a plus

  • Literacy and numeracy.

  • Experience with SQL databases is a plus

  • Teamwork is a must, but you should also be confident working independently, and be a self starter



Education/Certification:



  • A degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, IT or a related field is a plus - but attitude and experience come first

  • Note: A demonstrable portfolio will hold more weight than any academic accreditation



A Day In The Life:



  • We start the day with standups to make sure the code you write is building the software that you want to use, and address anything that is blocking your progress. This is a great place to pick up on the latest and greatest practices and patterns in tech, and get support from more seasoned members of the team.

  • We pause often, holding fortnightly retrospective meetings where we ask ourselves: “How could we do better?”.  It’s an opportunity to consider ideas (big and small) that can have a big impact on how we deliver as a team.

  • We try to foster a working environment that’s fun and friendly, and where all ideas are considered properly. We are not very hierarchical, and our people tend to have a broad range of skills, rather than being narrowly focused.

  • We also love to experiment with bleeding edge technologies and are encouraged to develop innovative applications in Digital Animal Labs. Recent projects include hooking our core architecture to the Internet of Things and ibeacons.



Salary


Your initial salary will be between £25k and £40k, depending on experience, plus stock options.



How to apply


Send an email with a covering letter and CV to: zaid.crowe@digitalanimal.com


In your letter, answer the following questions:




  • What’s wrong with our website?



  • Which software product from the last two years would you be most proud of building and why?



If successful, you will be invited for an interview at our Birmingham office.


If we like the look of each other after interviews, we will invite you to work with us for a week or two (paid, of course) so that we can see how you fit in, and you can get a real feel for what your job would be like.  We appreciate you may already be in full, or part time employment/education, if that is the case - we’ll work with you to find the best way forward.



Please phone 0121 6982144 or email zaid.crowe@digitalanimal.com for any further information.

title: Java Developer in Fintech 100% in Zurich City at swissQuant Group AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
description: You are an expert in Java or another object oriented programming language. You can work independently or as part of small groups in the development and delivery of software components and services. Your mastery of technology allows you to build prototypes quickly to help support business development and to build high quality robust products. You will be responsible for the technical delivery of multiple projects and provide technical leadership to other quant engineers in software design and development. You will liaise with clients and technology partners to identify requirements and define technology architecture. You are confident and articulate and possess excellent presentation skills. Your excellent multi-tasking and time management skills complete your profile and ensure your success.

title: Software Engineering Team Lead at Cake Solutions Inc (NY, NY)
description:
About Cake Solutions Inc


Using the very latest technologies, Cake Solutions helps organisations take innovative and disruptive ideas and develop them into reactive software solutions. Cake’s success is underpinned by our unique One Team® approach that allows for standalone projects or close collaboration with the clients’ technology teams. Cake provides mentors to guide the entire organisation through modern software engineering, continually transferring skills and knowledge to client teams in the process. This enables Cake to deliver not just software but to transform the way organisations think about and execute software delivery.


As an early adopter of change in the IT industry, Cake embraces the use of the latest bleeding edge programming languages and tools to implement system components including big data, machine learning and the Internet of Things. Cake delivers the appropriate technical solution to a business problem and can transform the way organisations think about and deliver production-ready high quality systems safely and predictably.


Our experienced, cross-functional agile teams enable the delivery of entire solutions not just lines of code. They appreciate the importance of continuous integration, continuous delivery, DevOps and rigorous testing.


Cake team members are published authors, prolific bloggers and experienced speakers. They have extensive experience in designing, building and implementing scalable Reactive Applications and are encouraged to continually research and innovate and to publish thought leading insights.


We make the most of messaging infrastructures, modern DBMSs, and all other services that make up today's enterprise systems. Automated provisioning, testing, integration and delivery allow us to release high quality systems safely and predictably.


.

title: Senior Back End Engineer - Node.js / NoSQL at Unscene (Chicago, IL)
description:
About Us:


Print-based Unscene City Guides* have been produced in 18 different cities with multiple local editions since 2003.


Here’s the deal…


We are in the early stages of building a modern web-based city guide with social media integration in one seamless platform. This new product will celebrate the diverse neighborhoods and shape the way locals and visitors discover, share, and explore their urban surroundings.


Agile, small and bleeding edge -- Our roles overlap frequently and we learn a lot from each other. Communication is key and we have a lot of exciting plans for the future.


We are looking for an engineer who is capable of working on different aspects of the server side of our game. The ideal candidate has extensive experience in NoSQL databases, server code, and a proven track record solving web and database engineering problems.


Enter, you.


You want to own and drive the product that you are working on like it's your own (because it is). As a leader of our engineering team, you will be responsible for developing well-thought-out back end logic and services for our new platform to communicate with at our startup office in Lincoln Park.


Along the way, you’ll:



  • Lead by example -- Support and develop other engineers by offering advice and guidance

  • Write code -- Implement and manage the interchange of data between the server and users

  • Contribute to the continual improvement of our development process

  • Develop NoSQL database structures

  • Partner with business leads to make key engineering and business decisions

title: Software Engineer - ElasticSearch / Data Processing at Tenable Network Security (NY, NY) (allows remote)
description:
Tenable now has over 400 employees globally and 20,000 customers in 150 countries. Tenable Network Security is recognized as one of the fastest growing security product companies by SC Magazine, Red Herring, Info Securities, Deloitte, E&Y and as a Best Places to Work by the Washington Post, Baltimore Sun, Baltimore Business Journal and Expert Marketplace.

Description


Do you get amped learning new technology? Does brainstorming new product ideas and ways to implement them keep you energized?  Then Tenable’s Engineering team is the place for you.  We are looking for a Senior Software Engineer to help create new product features built around ElasticSearch. You’ll also assist in the architecture of features and functionality of a robust platform that can handle powerful data processing and analytics. 


Responsibilities



  • Leverage the latest technology in search, data model design, optimization and devs ops tasks.

  • Participate in planning and architecture meetings with senior management and Product Management to define the product roadmap.

  • Build key platform features with a focus on data processing

  • Build high volume and scalable services.

  • Define and set coding standards for the team.

title: Infrastructure Engineer at KCG (Jersey City, NJ)
description:
KCG is a leading market maker working in three continents, across four asset classes, on over 50 markets around the world. Our team is strong and growing, always going after new ways to create better and more efficient markets. Working at the intersection of financial markets and technology, our tight-knit, interdisciplinary teams create the innovations that are improving the markets of tomorrow. We put our newest talent side-by-side with some of the leading thinkers in the industry, creating a vibrant work experience that promotes mutual learning and respect.


We cultivate an environment that is challenging and rewarding for each and every employee. Over the years, we’ve come to attract a unique kind of person—confident but humble, competitive but collaborative, focused but flexible. It’s a combination of traits that tie back to the values that have shaped our success to date, and will be critical to our success in the future.


The KCG Market Making Business seeks a  talented engineer to work in our team to manage the infrastructure of the ETG group.


The Infrastructure team is responsible for providing daily support to the Trading Operations Team, including support for our Quantitative Research computing environment (GRID based computing).


This position will be managing for capacity planning of our server, network, and storage environments.  As well as providing support for our Market Data Recording System which is a key component for quant research. This position will be working closely with Quants/Traders to address any issues they may have with our production and research environments.


The engineer will  provide system administration for our multiple trading systems (>1500 servers) and will be responsible for design and implementation of new server hardware and networking technologies.   This includes performance testing and validation of new hardware and Operating Systems to ensure they meet our requirements. 


Role Requirements


·          4 - 6 years’ experience implementing and administering Linux Servers in an enterprise environment.  RH/CentOS experience preferred but not required. Experience working in a Linux environment.


.           Strong scripting skills a must (e.g. Shell, Python, Perl, etc.) 


·           Solid understanding of core networking concepts such as IP Routing and various IP related protocols (e.g. TCP, UDP, Multicast UDP).


·          Good understanding of storage solutions and storage related technologies


·           Understanding of how Financial Trading Systems work at a high level and knowledge of Exchange Protocols is ideal but not required.  General understanding of ULL/HFT concepts a bonus.


·           Knowledge of grid computing, and/or HDFS/HBASE a plus.


.           Bachelors, Masters or PHD in computer science or closely related field  


.           Team player, good communication


·          Self-motivated and able to take ownership of projects.

title: Lead Software Engineer for the NIH/NCI Genomic Data Commons Project at The University of Chicago, Center for Data Intensive Science (Chicago, IL)
description:
The Center for Data Intensive Science (CDIS) is looking for a Lead Software Engineer for the National Cancer Institute (NCI) Genomic Data Commons (GDC) project. Alongside our team of experts, the Lead Software Engineer will develop the scalable and interoperable software stack for the GDC, supporting upwards of 5 petabytes of centralized and harmonized cancer genomic data.


The GDC will provide a open source, scalable, modern informatics framework that uses community standards to make raw and processed genomic data broadly accessible. The GDC will harmonize and centralize existing petabyte-scale cancer genomics datasets through cutting edge approaches to data storage and analysis similar to what is used by successful companies. The GDC will eliminate a major chokepoint, streamlining access to data for researchers regardless of their institution's size or budget, effectively democratizing access to the material. It will also enable previously infeasible collaborative efforts between scientists.
The GDC serves as a key step toward the development of precision medicine, targeted treatments that are tailored to individual patients. Once fully developed, it will provide an interactive system for researchers and clinicians to upload genomics data and use it to identify the molecular subtype of cancer and potential therapeutic targets. Genetic data will be linked to extensive clinical information from patients and their response to treatment.


The Lead Software Engineer in the Center for Data Intensive Science manages all aspects of programming projects, including requirements, design, implementation, deployment/delivery, and support. Leads team efforts and oversees the work of other software engineers. Provides technical oversight and develops standards, guidelines, and processes for applications. Reviews the design and code development of key architectural components. Contributes to decisions on project and infrastructure needs, including the evaluation of server technologies, languages, platforms, and frameworks. Develops timelines, technical diagrams, project plans, and resources allocation in an agile methodology. Works with cloud computing infrastructures including OpenStack, Amazon AWS and Google Cloud to design, develop, maintain, and evaluate software applications to meet business and technical requirements. Works in Linux-based systems primarily with Python and C/C++, with the ability to work with other programming languages as the need arises. Oversees code testing and ensures appropriate standards are met. Works with users, collaborators, and technical staff to resolve problems and respond to feedback regarding potential improvements and enhancements. Ensures appropriate documentation. Serves as a liaison with internal and external collaborators on multiple research projects.


Research includes the full stack from systems to algorithms to user interfaces. Research projects span management, sharing, and provenance of large data sets; resource allocation and scheduling for cloud computing, large scale pipelining of next-generation sequence analysis, transfer programs/protocols for high-speed networks and resource visualization.
Perform other duties as assigned.

This position is grant supported and longevity of the position is dependent upon future funding.

title: Machine Learning Engineer at Sense Labs (Cambridge, MA)
description:
Sense is looking for a Machine Learning Engineer to join its team. At Sense, we are developing a consumer product consisting of hardware and software for analyzing home energy consumption at a detailed level. The insights and data provided by Sense help consumers see what is going on in their homes to save energy and make things work better.  Sense is conveniently located in the heart of Cambridge in Harvard Square.


The ideal Engineer/Scientist will mine wattage/energy data, design algorithms, and develop models which improve Sense's automated disaggregation platform. The right person for this role will enjoy diving into messy time-series, designing high-performance models, and developing robust code that scales on live data.

title: Sr Systems Engineer at VOSTROM (Phoenix, AZ)
description:
Senior Systems Engineer – Emphasis on UNIX / Virtualization / Storage / Clusters

The Opportunity:

We're looking for experience systems engineers based in Phoenix, AZ metro area. Candidates should have at least five years of work history performing devops, or managing large scale UNIX-like computer systems and/or clusters (using a wide range of Linux, *BSD, and other systems). Candidates with specific expertise in systems security hardening, cluster management or automation of software and network monitoring will be given priority.

The Day to Day:

  • Manage systems with hundreds of computers running advanced, modern software
  • Plan for and deploy new infrastructure to meet growing customer needs
  • Interface with data center staff to plan and prepare for growth
  • Anticipate tomorrow's problems and set up proactive monitoring to avoid them

Requirements:

  • Substantial experience with different UNIX-like systems, more=better
  • Experience setting up database platforms (but not necessarily a DBA)
  • Experience with virtualization systems
  • Information security experience
  • US Citizenship / Legally authorized to work in US

Bonus Points:

  • DevOps experience with Linux or FreeBSD 
  • Security training and/or certifications
  • Familiarity with large scale storage systems such as Ceph or GlusterFS
  • Familiarity with large scale clusters
  • Hands-on experience with a variety of deployment / automation tools
  • Experience with Python, Ruby, Perl and/or shell scripting 
  • Mac OS X familiarity 
  • BS or MS in a technology or scientific field of study
  • High energy level and pleasant, positive attitude!
  • History of participation in organized sports (high school or college athletic teams)
  • Evidence of working well within a diverse team

Compensation:

  • Salary commensurate with experience, generally higher than competitive industries
  • Comprehensive benefits package
  • Opportunities for advancement and a clear career path

About Us:

We conduct advanced technical research and develop innovative software and systems that help meet network security and reliability challenges for organizations world-wide.  You can read more at our web site.  

Career Opportunities:

We have many other openings available. For a complete listing, visit jobs.vostrom.com

title: Write Code, Learn from the Best, Change the World! at Literacy Bridge (Seattle, WA) (allows remote)
description:
If you want to learn and apply a broad range of technologies while helping the world’s poorest people avoid hunger and deadly diseases, then this unique opportunity may be for you. Through partnerships with organizations like UNICEF, Literacy Bridge uses technology to help people in some of the world’s most remote villages, often without electricity, learn to grow more food and stay healthy.  We do this today for 175,000 people; with your help, we will reach millions more.


You will be Literacy Bridge’s first full-time software engineer, working in a startup-like environment with the mentorship of volunteer senior engineers from places like Twitter, BMW, Zillow, Groupon, Tableau Software, and the Apache Software Foundation. You will work on a broad range of projects such as our:



  • Java-based audio content management system to allow people around the world to contribute local-language audio recordings of health and agriculture knowledge


  • Java-based usage statistics data gathering system integrated with visual data analysis and reporting


  • C-based firmware of our Talking Book audio computer, a battery-operated device with an innovative audio-based interface and the ability to conduct and track quizzes on knowledge retention


Note about working remotely: To work remotely, we would require an initial 3-6 months in Seattle, U.S., and ongoing semi-annual visits for one or two weeks.


You would also have the opportunity to travel to Ghana to meet with our users, partners, and local staff.

title: Senior Software Engineer at University of Maryland, College Park (College Park, MD)
description:
University of Maryland, College Park


Department of Residential Facilities


Senior Software Engineer (Position # 100981)



The University of Maryland is a global leader in research, entrepreneurship and innovation. We rank No. 21 among public universities by U.S. News & World Report and in the top 40 research institutes worldwide by the Institute of Higher Education. We’re also among Glassdoor’s top 10 highest-rated D.C.-area employers. We offer IT professionals excellent opportunity in a stimulating, innovative, and highly rewarding environment.



DUTIES: Reporting to the Assistant Director, IT Services, this position serves as lead programmer/analyst for complex information systems including integration of programmed solutions with commercial software. The incumbent analyzes, designs, creates or modifies, maintains, and enhances critical applications use campus-wide by department staff and within the departments served by Residential Facilities. This position serves as part of the joint development team with Facilities Management (FM) for the University’s enterprise-wide Facilities Management System (FMS) using the current version of IBM’s Tririga Facilities Manager.



QUALIFICATIONS: Required - Bachelor’s degree in management information systems, information technology, computer science, or related field; will accept work experience for a degree, with one year full time experience equivalent to 30 credit hours.  Minimum of  five years IT experience performing business systems solution analysis, system architecture and design, programming, testing and implementation services.  Has written and/or incorporated software specifications and testing plans into programming, completed individually or within a team environment.  Progressively more complex programming experience with individual programming languages, rapid development tools, and/or application building platform toolsets to create complete applications as defined by customer specifications. Configuration, administration and/or programming IBM Tririga products is strongly preferred but will train qualified candidate. Preferred –Experience with application web database application development, and using object oriented analysis and design development tools.  Experience with report generation programming. 



SALARY and BENEFITS – Starting salary in the high $80’s.  Benefits include 25 days annual and personal leave; 14 paid holidays; 15 days sick leave, tuition remission up to 8 credits per semester; choice of two retirement programs; and eligibility for a variety of group health insurance plans.



TO APPLY: Review of Applications will begin August 28th and will continue until position is filled. To apply, submit a resume with cover letter and a list of references online at https://ejobs.umd.edu. Click on“Staff Positions” and follow the directions for position #100981. The University of Maryland is a smoke free environment since July 1, 2013. For more information about the position and the department, visit http://www.drf.umd.edu/programmer.



The University of Maryland is an Equal Opportunity Employer.


Minorities, Women, Protected Veterans and Individuals with Disabilities are Encouraged to Apply.



Apply Here: http://www.Click2Apply.net/49r45zs9r4



PI91518819

title: Software Engineer (Global Service Now) at DHL IT Services Europe (Praha, eská republika)
description:
The position of Software Engineer is encompassing within the Global Service Now Competency Centre the whole 'value-added' chain involved in practically developing and implementing complex solutions in ServiceNow that meet the needs of the business partners. This includes the analysis of functional and technical requirements, and the design and configuration or customization of solutions.


Main requirement is the configuration of highly customized solutions on the DPDHL ServiceNow platform – mostly in the area of the end user portal (“RequestIT”).


RESPONSIBILITIES



  • Configures, customizes and implements the requirements on the GSN platform working in an agile international team

  • Works together with 3rd parties (contractors, business partners) in configuring GSN successfully and contributing to GSN as a global service management and workflow platform for DPDHL

  • Applies standard best practice ServiceNow programming and configuration methodologies when creating new solutions or extending existing ones

  • Adheres to DPDHL rules for GSN projects: Security, data protection, architecture, …

  • Documents his work (technical documentation and also user documentation if needed) using the required standards, methods and tools – mostly as part of a SCRUM agile development cycle

  • Coordinates with external service providers or 3rd party systems interfacing GSN in terms of using GSN, configuring interfaces, and assembling own or third-party system components

  • Works as a great team player in a global team of developers, architects and support staff assisting developers and the support team if required to prevent delays or misunderstandings

  • Assists in definition, initiation and design of architecture in projects/programs

  • Provides expert advice, training and technical assistance to partners and team members

  • Hands over his development work once completed to the GSN support team providing technical advice, guidance and training

  • Participates in workshops or demo sessions with business partners to establish their requirements (presents technical concepts and proposals, and provides updates on deliverables)

title: Sr. DevOps Engineer - User Data at Twilio (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Twilio operates a cloud communications service that is distributed with points of presence throughout the globe at a scale of thousands of servers. Because we are mission critical infrastructure for our customers, operational excellence is a key objective and that’s where DevOps comes in as a core competency.


About the job:

Twilio engineers own and run their products and services from conception to continuous operation. DevOps engineers play a key role and are embedded within teams to focus on the operational aspects of our services. 

Responsibilities:

Twilio's User Data engineers develop services to implement RESTful data services, MySQL & DynamoDB databases and power ETL through Kinesis-powered data pipelines. Some operational concerns are availability, throughput, latency as well as data consistency guarantees. Our DevOps engineers are focused on 24x7 availability, performance and manageability concerns of these services. 

You will collaborate with Architects and Engineering leaders to define and develop operational features, tools and processes including:



  • Tools and processes for configuration management of large numbers of databases and services. This includes participating in technology selection and architecture review to ensure zero downtime releases and maintenance as well as enable auto-scaling. 

  • Instrumentation for monitoring the health and availability of services including fault detection, alerting, triage and recovery (automated and manual).

  • Performance management, including benchmarking and monitoring of vital metrics, capacity planning, and resolution of performance problems affecting service levels. 

  • Custom diagnostic and troubleshooting tools. 

  • Developer facing support tools made available via our developer portal and to our customer support organization.

title: Software Engineer, Product Testing at Tableau Software (Palo Alto, CA)
description:
What you’ll be doing…


In this position, you will be a member of a team of dedicated software engineers focused on testing a suite of next-generation Visual Analytics and Collaboration products. You will help define the strategy for testing interfaces in a cross-platform manner. You will leverage open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. In addition, you have a special fondness for things that are simple, elegant and effective.


Some of the things you’ll be doing include…



  • Writing code to create, improve and maintain new and existing frameworks

  • Analyzing source code to understand areas of risk and complexity to provide optimal test coverage

  • Helping Drive a Test Culture across the entire company

  • Other duties as assigned


Within Product Testing, there are different technical groups:



  • Client:  Tableau designs products for people who use software, not necessarily for people who buy software – the Client team in Product Testing is all about ensuring these products we build provide a delightful experience for our customers.  We understand our customers and how they use our products.  We build robust automation systems with Java and Python that precisely mimic product scenarios and validate the look and accuracy of the resulting visualizations.  We also use our in-development products every day to visualize data in the same way our customers do.  Our team is focused on our desktop client application for Windows and Mac, our browser rendered visualizations on all browsers and all platforms (Windows, mac, mobile) and also our native mobile apps on the iPad and Android tablets.

  • Mobile: The shift towards mobile devices and the increasing need to see and understand your data, are two of the hottest trends in the industry today, and the Mobile team at Tableau is at the confluence of the two. The Tableau Mobile team has been tasked with a single mission: to make the mobile experience the most delightful way for our customers to stay on top of their data. We build next-generation apps for iOS and Android for consumers and enterprises alike, and ensure quality through a variety of modern, innovative techniques, including white-box automation, data-driven pair-wise testing, and instrumentation tools.
