  • Platform: As a member of one of our platform teams you’ll work on Tableau’s secret sauce. We are about connecting, querying, integrating and preparing data from nearly 50 different data sources. We are about calculations and statistical analytics. We are about first class test frameworks and more. Ideal candidates will be skilled in one or more programming language, for example Python, C++, C# or Java. Working knowledge of one or more database technology like SQL Server, MySQL, Oracle, DB2, Hadoop or Apache Spark is preferred. Our team verifies that Tableau’s platform is functionally correct, reliable, scalable and high performance for our Windows and Mac desktop as well as our server products. We employ modern testing methodologies to tame the permutation explosion beast and we have fun doing it.

  • Server: The Server Testing group at Tableau owns product quality for Corporate Enterprise Server and Cloud Hosted Services (Tableau Online and Tableau Public). We have a group of dedicated software engineers focused on quality covering overall end to end scenarios as well as functional, performance and scale-out testing of Frontend and Backend components. You will help define the strategy and for testing interfaces and implement tests in a cross-platform manner while leveraging open source tools and build new tools to help ship a high quality product that delights customers. We work closely with our developers and do our daily develop in Java.

  • Performance: Tableau is a product where smart meets speed. This means you can use Tableau to make sense of your big data and be creative. The Performance Test Engineer at Tableau measures and verifies the latencies of Tableau functionalities using different data sizes and sources; they also measure the Page Load Time and throughputs of the Tableau servers.  Our Performance Test engineers use cutting edge testing strategies, frameworks and tools to hold the product to a very high performance bar. Candidates for this group need to be familiar with object oriented languages and feel comfortable to use industry standard performance test frameworks such as JMeter.


Who you are…



  • Experienced. 1-5+ years of experience testing and profiling large-scale C++ systems and highly scalable Java and/or Ruby server systems that back dynamic, highly interactive web experiences. Experience testing on Windows platforms, with experience testing on multiple platforms including Linux. Strong knowledge of database concepts is a plus.

  • Highly Technical. You love writing things that “just work” – things that are robust, scalable and that perform well. Excellent understanding of languages such as C++, Java, Ruby, and Python as well as programming experience with Javascript and css/html. Strong knowledge of development and test tools, in particular Selenium, junit and java tools.

  • Passionate about Quality. A love of testing, tuning and analysis through a rigorous scientific approach.

  • Self-Motivated. You do good work and the drive to deliver is just a part of you.

  • Team Player. You enjoy collaborating with, learning from, and teaching others so we all can become better. You assume the good intent in others, and actively do your part to create a positive work environment.

  • Customer Focused. You want to learn about customers, their challenges & scenarios and you find satisfaction in shipping quality products that delight customers.

  • You have high standards, and your personal software practices ensure you deliver high quality no matter what.  You believe in constantly releasable quality, iterations, design for testability, and you build your own tools & techniques to achieve high quality and low cost of support.  You deliver better results through using quality practices every day, and you even have taught or influenced others to improve their practices.

  • Educated. Bachelor of Science in Computer Science or equivalent

title: DevOps Engineer / FinTech Startup at IEX (New York, NY)
description:
IEX is looking for what we are calling our next System Reliability Engineer – you may also know this role as DevOps, WebOps, SystemsOps, and so on. The right person for the job will be an insatiably curious tinkerer with technical chops, who may or may not have done this type of role before. Bonus points if you take an interest in the stock market, though a willingness to learn all about the inner workings of the market is a must. In this role, you’ll be constantly optimizing and automating our processes and systems, in an effort to improve reliability, scalability, and maintainability. Plus, you’ll take on real-time responsibilities, such as monitoring, incident management, and recovery.


Coding and scripting is part of our daily life (we like python, bash, awk, sed and we are currently exploring Go). You’ll be exposed to how the technology interacts with the business side, and will gain a deep understanding of application logic and business data work-flows which is essential during the recovery process when an incident occurs. Experience with any layer in our stack (Linux, Java, C++) is highly beneficial particularly around the areas of performance and capacity. Experience in an agile environment is a plus, and a willingness to tackle the challenge of innovating within a regulated environment is key.


Primary Responsibilities



  • Responsible for monitoring the health of our systems

  • Participate in the engineering process as we design, build, and manage our systems.

  • Build tools to monitor and automate processes.

  • Be a core contributor in our change management and the post mortem processes

  • Troubleshoot issues across the whole stack - hardware, software, applications and network.

  • Document current and future configuration processes and policies.

  • Translates customer needs and projected product utilization to operational reliability targets.

  • Write systems reliability plan and report progress on attaining reliability targets to team and senior management.

  • Guides other functions (e.g., development, market operations, business development, subscribers, etc.) on reliability techniques, application and system functionality.

  • Educates and mentors team/company on operational best practices

title: Senior Ruby / Python / Java Developers - Awarded Best Company to Work for 2015 ! at Simply Business (London, UK) (allows remote)
description:
If you’re smart, passionate about technology and enjoy solving complex technical challenges then you should apply to join our best-in-class tech team. We believe that people are our most important asset and one worth protecting. As such, we’re known for creating an enviable working culture to keep our employees smiling on a day to day basis. 


We offer things such as flexible hours, remote working, fortnightly hackathons and freedom to work on projects of individual interest to name just a few. In fact, our impressive working culture has recently earned us 1st place in the Sunday Times 100 Best Companies to Work for 2015. 


We have two different positions.


1. Senior or Lead Developers who would like to lead a team / projects (fulltime in London) - We envisage the split here being about 70% hands-on coding and 30% leading the team, liaising with product owners on prioritization work, attending iteration planning meetings with stakeholders, delegating tasks to dev team, and making sure we are following Lean / Agile processes correctly.


2. Senior Developers who want to be 100% hands-on coders with no lead responsibilities (this can be fulltime in London OR remote) - This role will be 100% hands on working with our other Devs to code beautiful products for our customers! 


Please be aware the salary will vary dependent on experience and whether you are working remotely or onsite in London)



Some of our Current Projects: 

Seedy - Our custom built CMS. A hybrid, markdown based, sinatra driven CMS but with a TDD undercurrent. Content changes are no different to backend refactoring. Templates are written in a custom DSL that enforces our style guide while still supporting iterative changes and automatic deployment. Across the company people (including business teams) are now being tagged in pull requests and even writing code!

Aerie - We’re overhauling our data and analytics architecture. Using the latest approaches in event streaming, we are building a brand new data pipeline based on Kinesis and Redshift that will support the analysis of both structured and semi-structured data in near real-time. This will provide rapid and intuitive customer insight to our decision makers, while also providing exciting machine learning capabilities back to our core product offering.

AAA - We are enhancing our new world platform. Our current focus is on security with a view to building out ‘infrastructure as code’ using tools such as AWS CloudFormation, AWS OpsWorks, Chef/Puppet and many others. Essentially, we believe a well architected system allows us to avoid unnecessary complexity and can enable individuals to generate great output.

Our Tech Stack



  • Ruby

  • Rails                                                                                                                            

  • Scala  

  • MongoDB

  • RabbitMQ

  • Puppet/Boxen

  • AWS                                                                                                                        

  • Hadoop / RedShift / Looker /Tableau

  • Cucumber / RSpec / Jasmine                              

  • SASS / HAML / HTML5 / CSS3 / JavaScript / CoffeeScript / jQuery



This list changes all the time, as being on the lookout for new technology trials and opportunities is part of our code. We don’t believe in limiting ourselves, or the company. If there are other tools that could get the job done better, we’re committed to exploring them.

Things we believe in:



  • TDD / BDD

  • Continuous Delivery

  • Pair Programming

  • Build – Measure - Learn

  • Active participation to open source

  • Our business people writing code (we've not seen this anywhere else!)                                

  • Cross functional teams (Dev / QA/ Data / UX / Product owners all sitting together)            

  • Release early and learn quickly - we release our software to production around 15 times a day on average!        

  • Continuous learning - we look to pay for courses and conferences and actively encourage our Devs to get out and about in the community. We have even sent some of our Devs to Miami, Portugal and Barcelona for conferences recently.                                                              

  • Have fun! We do ruby coding challenges during lunchtimes over pizza, we have desk beers on a friday, we have several social events throughout the year, we do fortnightly hackathons, we have afterwork clubs like: UX, Data science and Robotics club, we have flexible working hours, weekly 'show n tell' sessions, and lot's more!

title: Senior Ruby on Rails developer at Shop2market (Hilversum, Netherlands)
description: To strengthen our core development team, we are looking for an experienced RoR Developer. Do you have experience with cloud application development, agile development and TDD? Also with RoR, Javascript, SQL, API’s, JSON/XML? Do you want to learn web scale technologies like Mapreduce, MongoDB and big data? Do you like to use innovative technologies and methods to develop a functional, flexible and scalable big data platform? Please, don't hesitate and contact us!

title: Chief Engineer ADAS (Advanced Driver Assistance Systems) Connected Safety (m/f) at Harman Becker Automotive Systems GmbH (Karlsbad, Deutschland)
description:
Your Responsibilities:



We are developing several industry-first ADAS products. Our ADAS products combine powerful in-vehicle processing, V2X connectivity, and cloud analytics, taking advantage of Harman's strength in highly complex systems. Now we need an experienced chief engineer who can help us design our next generation products and deliver those that we have already been awarded. As the ADAS chief engineer you will directly supervise a team of systems / software engineers, and provide technical guidance to a larger cross-functional team. Your tasks at Harman will include:




  • Work with systems and software engineers to develop and document connected safety implementation requirements, from the physical to the application layer, including key vehicle interfaces.

  • Lead the technical architecture development for Connected Safety, defining the interaction between external environmental sensing, map data, V2X communications, and cloud connectivity.

  • Define / invent features that support our Connected Safety roadmap: What will it take to make cars drive themselves? We are looking for your creativity to refine our plans.

  • Lead the activity to develop a demonstrator for Connected Safety features: Proof that your ideas will work.

  • Participate in industry forums and stay current on state of the art to ensure a competitive position for Harman. We want you to be a thought leader in the industry.



Our Offer


Continue your career at Harman, one of the worldwide leaders in infotainment and car audio. We have been successfully doing business for decades and are proud to have all premium car manufacturers as clients. As a Harman employee, you will have the opportunity to actively shape the future and be an important part of Harman's success story. Our dynamic and international business offers you numerous opportunities to further develop and make an impact. Your knowledge and commitment will be rewarded with an attractive compensation package. HARMAN is an employer who values equal employment opportunities for both, women and men. Applications from qualified women are particularly welcome.

title: Data Analytics Engineer at Sharethrough (San Francisco, CA)
description:
Sharethrough is looking for engineers interested in building data products and infrastructure to power our business and provide insight to our customers.  You'll be taking the lead on the design and implementation of a data warehousing infrastructure used by our product, engineering and operational teams.


What You'll Be Doing:



  • Greenfield architecture and construction of a modern data warehouse

  • Working with new technologies such as Apache Spark and Amazon Redshift

  • Deriving insight from large quantities of data, starting with our 500GB/day performance pipeline

  • Collaborating with data science and business intelligence teams on visualization and data wrangling platforms such as Looker


Let’s talk if...



  • You’ve got experience with SQL, ETL, python/shell scripting, and MPP Data Warehousing

  • You’ve worked on or are interested in data integrity governance and semantic layer design

  • You possess an intense curiosity about data and a strong commitment to practical problem solving

title: Senior .NET Developer at Cie Digital Labs, LLC (Irvine, CA)
description:
Cie Digital Labs is looking for a Senior .NET Web Developer to play a pivotal role in the architecture and programming of interactive applications and backend systems to support web-based applications. This is a great position for the self-motivated, organized candidate with exceptional level of attention-to-detail.  We’re looking for people who are creative problem solvers and “out-of-the-box thinkers.”

You must be creative, focused, results-oriented, self-motivated, and a resourceful problem-solver.  Our ideal candidate is one that can thrive in a fast-moving, creative company.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Work with other developers to develop and build systems on the .NET platform using cutting-edge techniques, tools, and utilities

  • Assist in the back-end architecture and modeling of data-driven applications

  • Research, test, and implement new technologies, frameworks, and utilities

  • Be a mentor to more junior developers working on your projects. Set development schedules, delegate tasks, and review code

  • Help enforce development standards and best practices for other developers

  • Work with non-developers to execute the full software development lifecycle on projects

  • Participate and provide feedback in brainstorming sessions and scoping meetings

title: Senior Software Engineer at Crytek GmbH (Frankfurt am Main, Deutschland)
description:
Crytek is looking for an experience Senior Software Engineer to support our Web / Publishing team.


As a Senior Software Engineer, you will be responsible for working on the design, development and ongoing support for game, application and tools technologies used by Cytek’s games-as-a-service (GaaS).


The successful candidate will be an experienced engineer in developing game technologies and have an interest in distributed systems, multiplayer games, databases, tools development and game client technologies.


Responsibilities:



  • Develop, support and iterate on the integration of company products.

  • Creating a reliable and high performance online service which stands for quality.

  • Work directly with Crytek studios to resolve technical issues.

  • Participate in the scoping and sizing of tasks.

  • Work towards the goal of shared common technologies where applicable.

  • Ensure appropriate, accurate and up-to-date technical documentation.

  • Debug, reproduce and triage bugs to create solutions.

  • Take ownership for building and maintaining platform tools.

  • Contribute to making self-publishing a success.

title: Senior Software Engineer / Architect at ASML (Veldhoven, Nederland)
description:
Introduction
Is solving complex software engineering problems your passion? Does working in a multi-cultural environment make you spin? Does contributing to world’s most advanced lithography machines make you feel proud? Then this might be the right opportunity for you.

Job Mission
As a part of ASML’s Metrology Software department, you will provide the software solutions that realize the metrology system functions, producing sub-nm measurement and control accuracy. Your solutions emerge from sound software engineering practice and take low effort to develop and maintain. You choose for system-wide experience and drive for successful customer deployment.

Job Description



  • Specify, design, develop, realize, and test subsystems within the limits of system specifications, costs and project planning. Cooperate with other disciplines and suppliers to ensure the timely realization of competitive, achievable and serviceable products. Participate in the definition of system specifications

  • Reshaping the software architecture to facilitate the efficient implementation of the required functionality within a machine environment.

  • Taking the lead in decisions about the direction that need to be taken and driving these ideas.

  • Show technical leadership to assist and steer Software Engineers and influence stakeholders to realize the software architecture changes and development methods.

  • Reviewing functional and software design documents.

  • Taking ownership of software building blocks for which you’ll be responsible for the quality of the department.

  • Communication with Architects and Designers from different fields.

  • International working environment.

  • Experience with C/C++, object oriented design and programming and Linux within a Software Engineering “in the large” environment.

title: Software Engineer  Mobile development at Qnective AG (Zürich, Switzerland)
description:
Software Engineer – Mobile development


A Zurich-based software company is looking for a Software Engineer in Mobile Development to complement a team of highly qualified professionals devoted to the design and the development of innovative secure mobile communication solutions.


Your responsibilities:



  • Participate in the whole life cycle development of Qnective's solutions

  • Analyze, design and implement new functionalities for client-side mobile application (Android, iOS…)

  • Bring expertise in mobile application system design

  • Identify issues, improve, and troubleshoot existing code

  • Implementation of automated tests

  • Monitor and assist other developers with coding issues and quality assurance

title: Java Software Engineer with a passion for modern tooling at Bol.com (Utrecht, Netherlands)
description:
Over 5 million Dutch and Belgian customers have already discovered that bol.com is a great place to shop. Because we offer over 9(!) million products. Because our products are easy to find on any device. And because every visit is an inspiring, ‘strictly personal’ shopping experience. With 15 to 20 million page views per day, bol.com is a textbook example of a state of the art big data environment. This environment is developed and maintained by 30+ Scrum teams. From desktop to mobile, and from product catalogue to CRM systems; our Scrum teams create the bol.com landscape and make it future-proof. Do you combine a passion for modern tooling with a drive to be at the cutting edge of the big data revolution? Prove to bol.com that you’re a forward-thinking Software Engineer!


As a Software Engineer you develop, test and implement innovative Java based solutions for our retail platform and back-end processes. How can we port web-based solutions to mobile? How can we integrate the catalogues of external vendors (bol.com Plaza) into the ‘regular’ bol.com catalogue? What tools will enable us to automate the test process? You analyze these questions – often in tandem with business units – and come up with answers that go beyond functional requirements to address performance, scalability (think HBase) and security. You provide proactive go-live support, including organizational embedding (tests, user support, demonstrations). Additionally, you develop tools that further optimize the development process itself, helping us to realize our ambition of making continuous integration a corporate standard. You adhere to best practices, including specification by example, and are regularly asked to share your ideas with the entire organization.


Your role in bullet points



  • Develop, test, and implement Java based solutions

  • Deliver software that goes beyond basic functional requirements

  • Provide go-live support, including organizational embedding

  • Develop first-in-class tools, e.g. to automate testing

  • Ambassador of innovative ideas in software development

title: Cloud Developer at Cloudreach Europe Limited (Edinburgh, UK)
description:
Cloudreach’s Cloud Developers work with challenging, but very cool and leading edge, technical solutions for industry leading clients including well known global brands.  We love all things cloud related and believe passionately in the innovation it can drive.


We’re Europe’s only top-tier partner for both Amazon Web Services and Google - two giants of the cloud computing industry.  We are looking for a Cloud Developer who is capable of delivering awesomeness to our incredible client base.


Don’t worry about prior “cloud” experience, what we want are smart, friendly developers.


Not if. When will you join the best Cloud team in the industry?


What we are looking for?


Cloudreach is looking for a capable developer who has a passion for DevOps relevant experience and is keen to grow, and share, their technical skills in a fast growing company.  If you are curious about the Cloud and have possibly dabbled with AWS and Google Apps we want to speak to you.  We subscribe to the concept of "DevOps", where we use development skills in the operational environment in order to increase service quality.


We have been fortunate enough to work with a wide variety of technologies to facilitate the delivery of operational services to our customer.  Now we need to pick things up a gear by developing a bespoke platform unique to our team, integrating disparate sources of information into a unified platform that can be used as a foundation for further automation of operations tasks.  This will allow our core operations team to focus on solving the unique and interesting problems that crop up, as well as working with you to define and implement new features as they are required.


You will be working with the following cool technologies (and more):




  • Amazon Web Services cloud, Google Apps and Salesforce




  • Linux / Open Source including Apache, MySQL, Varnish, Nginx plus others




  • Splunk, Chef and Ruby




How will you spend your time here at Cloudreach?  As a Cloud Developer you will be a key member of our Platform Engineering team and will help drive the development of our bespoke and unique cloud management platform:




  • Establish and maintain our Test Driven Development, Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery platform




  • Work with key stakeholders from other areas of the business to design and document core functionality such as an API layer, a variety of backend task processing application, a frontend UI to allow our Operations engineers to leverage the new features as they are added




  • Actively mentor and develop software development skill across the team in a DevOps environment.




  • Providing 3nd level support to resolve incidents and problems related to our cloud management platform

title: Data Scientist (The Walking Dead) at Next Games (Helsinki, Finland)
description:
If you’re a startup-minded pro with a passion for games and a brain that can tackle any given problem in a unique way, then keep on reading as we’re on the look for our new team member for The Walking Dead game team:


DATA SCIENTIST


As our Data Scientist, you’re responsible for generating insights from large data sets produced by our games and players. Working closely with our EP’s and game teams you’ll get to service and manage our day-to-day data requests and analyses hands-on.


This is what you’ll get to work on:



  • Work with product teams to define data to be collected from our products for analysis

  • Analysis of key performance indicators, such as customer acquisition, retention, lifetime value and virtual economy balance

  • Defining the data acquisition of AB tests and analysis of the gathered AB test data to estimate the effect on key metrics and choose the best features

  • Develop models for predicting player behavior

  • Answer in-depth analytics questions from the team and create reports of the results

  • Identify and report actionable insights to internal stakeholders, suggest recommendations and influence the direction of the business by effectively communicating results


Your experience and skills include:



  • 2+ years experience in a data scientist or analyst role, involving some of the following: data analytics, CRM data analysis, data mining, business intelligence, machine learning, predictive modeling

  • Expert knowledge in SQL-related languages

  • Knowledge in statistical programming languages (R, etc.) and in Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Hive, Pig, NoSQL, etc.)

  • Experience in interpreting data and analytics results to provide actionable insight into user/product behavior and deriving conclusions from those insights

  • Comfortable working in an international, fast-paced, challenging and stimulating organization

  • Excellent written & verbal communication skills in English


Here at Next Games we aim high, and will ask you to do the same. In exchange, you’ll be part of a team that is great to work with, who is dedicated and passionate about what we do – we believe passion is contagious. Giving each Nextgamer the tools and means to succeed in their job is our priority. We believe the fruits of our labor should be shared with everyone at Next Games. We offer the opportunity to work with a great bunch of passionate and dedicated people, a competitive salary and benefits package, and first and foremost a big challenge.



If you believe in the same things, don’t hesitate any longer, apply now!



When you apply, please email your CV, a cover letter along with your salary request to data.scientist@nextgames.com. Please apply soon, as we’ll proceed once we’ve found the right person to join our team!



For further information about the position please contact our CPO, Joakim Achrén at +358-500 625 398 during the following time:



Friday 21.8. between 13.00 – 14.00 (EEST)

title: Senior Software Engineer at 33Across (Sunnyvale, CA)
description:
The role:
We’re looking for a Lead Software Engineer to join our 12-person engineering team. We’ve had 10x growth in our new product line over the past year and we’re looking for a Ruby on Rails expert to drive this growth and service 100’s of millions of users in an impactful way.

What will you do? You’ll build consumer-facing web applications (link to this ) and lead a small team of Rails engineers in building new dashboards and extending tools for our network of publishers. Our products offer over a million websites worldwide unique insights into how their content is being consumed and shared online, drive incremental traffic to these sites, and help some of the largest publishers in the world monetize their content.

Your mission, should you choose to accept it:
* Provide technical leadership, software design, and architectural guidance to a team of full-stack engineers, instilling best practices in the software development process, “the Rails way”, and mentoring other engineers.
* Design, build, enhance, and maintain our Publisher dashboards and workflows, providing new insights and control to our customers as we extend our products to mobile & tablet.
* Partner with User Experience and Visual Designers to implement intuitive and aesthetic web UIs.
* Integrate with our Big Data/NoSQL back-end infrastructure to pull data that feeds insights and reports.

title: Research Software Engineer C++ at NYU Center for Advanced Imaging Innovation and Research (New York, NY)
description:
About Our Group


The mission of the Center for Advanced Imaging Innovation and Research (CAI2R) at New York University School of Medicine is to develop innovative solutions to key problems in today’s medical imaging practice and to make these developments rapidly available for patient care. The center is embedded into the Department of Radiology and brings together a unique group of ~70 full-time researchers, consisting of imaging scientists, developers, clinical researchers, and research technicians. It is located in the heart of New York City on Manhattan’s east side, in a landmark building that also houses our radiology offices and multiple clinical MRI systems. This close proximity enables us to test our next-generation imaging techniques very rapidly in a clinical setting and to obtain immediate feedback from physicians.


Our scientists have access to over 12 modern MRI systems, including various clinical MRI scanners as well as a PET/MR and 7T MRI system. We are supported by a team of onsite industry scientists. A dedicated RF lab can be used for custom coil and phantom building. Extensive computational resources are available for numerical simulations and for the development of computationally demanding image reconstruction algorithms.


For more information about our center, please visit http://cai2r.net.


Available Position


To support our research projects, we are looking for a highly motivated and qualified software engineer with a strong passion for creating the next generation of radiologic imaging techniques, aiming at earlier and more precise detection of diseases. The successful candidate will work together with our researchers on exciting software projects, including our open-source processing framework Yarra and other open-source tools for the medical-imaging community. Additional responsibilities include code maintenance and testing, programming of modules for our web portals and development of web applications for supporting multi-center studies. If desired, a portion of the time can also be used to conduct own scientific work and to engage in some of our ongoing research projects.


Requirements for this position include:


-  University degree in computer science


-  Strong development skills with proven professional experience in C++, QT5, and Boost


-  Profound experience with Linux, preferably including package management, and state-of-the-art web-development techniques, including design and implementation of RESTful APIs


-  Experience with distributed version management tools such as Mercurial or GIT


-  Experience with virtualization and cloud-computing infrastructure, such as AWS, Azure, or OpenStack, and preferably knowledge about container systems such as Docker


-  Experience in managing open-source projects


-  Preferred: Experience with image-processing techniques and the DICOM standard


-  Self-driven work attitude and good organizational skills


We offer a competitive salary and benefits package. For candidates applying from abroad, a work permit and visa can be obtained through the medical center’s immigrations office.

title: Algorithm Performance Lead Engineer at Seeing Machines Limited (Braddon, Australia)
description:
Due to our success and increased demand from our customers all over the globe, business growth has created the need for an Algorithm Performance Lead Engineer to be a critical part of our Engineering Group in Canberra.


There are two major components to this role:



  1. To develop and drive a culture of using data to validate algorithmic performance, systems and products across the company. This includes helping with tooling, processes and managing relationships between teams.

  2. In addition, at Seeing Machines, we have collected large amounts of data that could be used for many applications across the company. The challenge now is to make the data accessible, searchable and convenient to use.


In particular, we are looking for someone with:



  • Tertiary qualifications in computer science, software/systems engineering, or demonstrated equivalent industry experience;

  • Experience developing software on Windows using Visual Studio or commercial experience with software development on Linux;

  • At least five years’ experience writing C++, C# or Java or equivalent;

  • At least five years’ experience writing Python, Ruby or equivalent;

  • Demonstrated experience managing a team of software engineers/data scientists/tools developers;

  • An understanding of agile methodology; and

  • Experience with statistical analysis.


In addition to these specific requirements, you will also have:



  • Ability to champion ideas and achieve consensus within a team;

  • Strong drive to apply software engineering principles, and pragmatically improve software quality within a dynamic development environment;

  • Ability to set priorities and meet deadlines; and

  • Ability and desire to continuously learn new skills.


Academic experience with data mining or as a data scientist would also be desirable.


While strong technical skills and experience are a must, you must also demonstrate an ability to express technical concepts clearly and calmly, and be of a nature that promotes team collaboration and cohesion.  Strong communication skills, coupled with a pragmatic approach to problem solving and willingness to champion ideas are therefore essential characteristics you will possess. 


This role will be primarily based in Canberra, and you must be able to live and work in Australia to be eligible for appointment.


If this sounds of interest to you, please send your application and resume to recruit@seeingmachines.com quoting the reference SO-ENG016.



Please note: only personalised applications will be accepted. Applications received by robot or via recruitment agencies will be rejected (we love technology, but not that much).

title: Software Engineer, Performance Data Analytics at SolarCity (San Mateo, CA)
description: The primary goal of the Software Engineer of Performance Data Analytics will be to use SolarCity’s extensive data resources to develop methods and techniques to better integrate widespread solar deployments with the grid.  SolarCity believes that better predictability and optimization of distributed energy systems will provide significant value to grid operators and energy market participants.  The Data Engineer will be responsible for engineering tools for that prediction and optimization.

title: Senior Back End Developer at SMTP, Inc. (Gainesville, FL)
description:
SharpSpring is looking for an experienced, and innovative Back End Developer to join our team in Gainesville, FL. If you are interested in joining a growing, dynamic and successful Tech company where your work makes a significant impact on the entire organization, then we want to talk to you!

The Company

SharpSpring is a cloud-based marketing automation provider offering a next-generation marketing automation solution rivaling the industries top platforms in terms of features, functionality and performance. SharpSpring is one of the most flexible platforms on the market, offering native or 3rd party CRM integration, fully integrated call tracking, universal CMS compatibility, in addition to integration with hundreds of applications. With SharpSpring, see every lead that comes in, whether by phone or form, and compare all data side by side to get a full picture of end-to-end ROI. SharpSpring is usually less than 1/3 the cost of other competitors, yet powerful enough to be trusted by hundreds of agencies and thousands of businesses around the world. In 2014, SharpSpring was acquired by SMTP, Inc - a publicly traded company on the NASDAQ (SMTP).

The Opportunity

The Back End Developer will work in a dynamic, fast-paced environment using the latest open source technologies for software development. You will work with our experienced Development, Design and QA teams to produce and maintain the highest quality of software products. You will be part of a team that is changing the face of an industry and producing an application that is used by thousands of clients. This position allows you a huge complex product to work on where you can take ownership of your back end kingdom!

The Responsibilities

  • 2+ years experience as a Back End Developer (working with Java, C#, PHP, Python)
  • Working on complex data problems
  • Design, development, and maintenance of code
  • Experience with Big Data (Hadoop exp . a plus)
  • API development and Feature Development
  • Writing code and running appropriate diagnostic tests to proactively solve potential issues
  • Identify and solve problems creatively and efficiently
  • Design, communicate, and implement solutions effectively
  • Test orientated development

The Person

  • 5+ years of experience as a Back End Developer
  • Effective communication, decision-making, and problem solving skills
  • Professional development experience, either through a full-time job, internship or personal projects
  • Solid understanding of back end technologies
  • Familiarity with responsive web design techniques
  • Experience building and or designing web applications
  • Familiarity with PHP
  • Experience with Backbone, Ember . js and/or AMD

The SharpSpring Culture and Perks

As a team, we want to differentiate ourselves by hard work, disciplined execution, friendly service, a commitment to solving our customers' problems, and to demonstrate that we can accomplish more than others with a fraction of their resources.

Our company culture is based on the belief that our people are our #1 asset:

  • We empower you to make decisions and get things done without all of the bureaucracy!
  • We ensure communication across the organization, including actively soliciting your feedback
  • We are committed to our team's personal development at all levels of the organization
  • We offer competitive salaries and company bonus programs
  • We offer health and dental insurance for full-time employees
  • We offer a paid holidays and PTO to our full-time employees
  • We strive to reward team members who operate as "business owners" with stock option grants in our firm, creating a strong team-oriented dynamic across the entire company

About SMTP, Inc.

SMTP is a NASDAQ-listed provider of email services that is growing rapidly on a global basis. The company's easy-to-use and highly affordable SharpSpring marketing automation platform is empowering the next generation digital marketers with tools once reserved for large enterprises. The company's long history as one of the early pioneers of SMTP delivery services provides a solid backbone for the company's growth, which will be supported by its global operations. Its recent acquisition of GraphicMail provides a global footprint and both email and mobile functionality for a wide range of business users. Its profitable operation and access to the public markets for capital positions it well for both organic growth and synergistic acquisitions. Learn more about us and our subsidiaries at: www.smtp.com

title: C / C++ and Qt Development Framework  Software Development Engineer (m/f) at service-drone.de GmbH (Berlin, Deutschland)
description:
To expand our team in Berlin we are looking for a software development engineer at the earliest possible date.


You will develop software components and their interfaces in a team up to the stage of series production - including the documentation - in C ++ (OOP) and the Qt Development Framework (especially for GUI programming) in an exciting environment, which is characterized by rapid innovation cycles . Your mandate also includes creating software requirement specifications as well as test runs and analysis of our software systems.


Our requirements:



  • Independent work and implementation of system specifications both in the group as well as for individual projects alone

  • High level of motivation and commitment for a team that belongs to the technological industry leaders

  • Very good knowledge in C / C ++ / Qt and in the Cross-Platform

  • Development, among others for Windows and Mac or Linux

  • Knowledge of hardware dependent programming (embedded systems) is a plus

  • Relevant degree in computer science or equivalent formation with appropriate experience

  • Good German and English skills


Your application quoting your salary expectations should be directed to Mr. Oliver Knittel


under knittel@service-drone.com.

title: Software Developer at RES Ltd (Kings Langley, UK)
description:
Role General Characteristics - Purpose

The position will be a temporary role lasting 6 months, commencing between September and November 2015.The successful candidate will join the "Project Systems" team to support and develop software used during the development phase of projects. The applications supported by this team and deliver functionality in the following areas:
  • Finding potential sites for wind or solar farm projects
  • Managing relationships and contracts with landowners
  • Assessing the suitability of potential sites in the face of a fast changing political landscape.

title: Software Developer Consultant - Singapore at ThoughtWorks (Singapore)
description:
ThoughtWorks welcomes talented developers who are passionate with creating great code, to join our Singapore office!. 


Being a consultancy, our teams work on a huge variety of projects. You could be part of a delivery project set up for a large hotel, building a new mobile platform for a bank, support some of our training or enablement teams or join some of our teams getting involved on inceptions with new clients and getting hands on the project from scratch.  All of this whilst building quadcopters or robotic arms in your spare time! 


Examples of some of our current and past projects:



  • Mobile applications including responsive web, native Android and iOS for telcos, retailers, banks as well as local Singapore organisations 

  • HTML5 rich web applications using frameworks such as AngularJS and Amber

  • Integrated enterprise solutions on RoR covering front end to back end

  • Large scale distributed systems with big data using technologies like Storm, Hadoop

  • Continuous delivery, Infrastructure as code and one-click deployment on cloud

  • Functional programming languages like Scala and Clojure for heavy data processing projects


We don't do bureaucracy, or hierarchy and you do get lots of autonomy so we actively encourage you to experiment with new technologies without limitation.

title: Java Software Engineer at bol.com (Bucureti, Roemenië)
description:
Sterksen is a Recruitment Agency, for our client Bol.com (E-commerce company) we are looking for a Senior Java Developer".


Do you combine a passion for modern tooling with a drive to be at the cutting edge of the big data revolution? Can you parse and interpret a terabyte of click data on a Hadoop cluster? Prove us that you’re a forward-thinking Java Software Engineer for our client in Utrecht the Netherlands!

You provide proactive go-live support, including organizational embedding (tests, user support, demonstrations). You adhere to best practices, including specification by example, and are regularly asked to share your ideas with the entire organization.

Your role in bullet points



  • Develop, test, and implement Java based solutions
