title: Lead Software Engineer at Premier, Inc. (Charlotte, NC)
description:
Are you a Lead Software Engineer interested in working at a Health IT startup?   Premier has invested in a new emerging business incubator to try and solve the biggest problems facing healthcare by utilizing Big Data and Predictive Analytics.


This Lead Software Engineer will be helping health systems create data warehousing capabilities on top of an enterprise platform in order to share real time data across a collaborative.  This cutting edge startup will be helping Premier’s member health systems solve issues within population health through accelerators and dash boards created off this new platform.  


Premier’s new product is truly a Platform as a Service (PaaS).  We are currently seeking a Lead Software Engineer with Platform as a service (PaaS) experience for an immediate fulltime need.  This Lead Software Engineer will be on a team of experienced Health IT Professionals working with raw data from all of our healthcare clients to extract, transform and load data into data marts ready for new application development.  If you are looking for an opportunity to work with a leading edge Health IT start-up without the risk of one, this is definitely the opportunity for you.


Key Accountabilities:


Software Development



  • Planning, analyzing, and directing the coding and testing

  • Provide guidance and direction on development approach for coding – review, analyze and meet with business analyst to fully understand requirement

  • Provide guidance and direction on the development of the data approach for coding – Understand data guidelines, and understand data sources available, what is new based on requirements, and how the project will impact common data stores

title: Web Application Developer at Dito, LLC (Huntsville, AL) (allows remote)
description:
As Web Application Developer at Dito, you should possess strong web application development skills, creativity, and an affinity for solving complex problems.  You will be working closely with clients and Ditomites (Dito team members) to create custom solutions that utilize some of the newest technologies available in Google’s ecosystem; Apps Script, App Engine, Google Apps REST API’s, Compute Engine, DataStore, Cloud SQL, Cloud Storage, Big Query, Google Maps Engine, Maps API for Business, Google Search Appliance and even Google Glass.  Many times, clients will have legacy apps that need to be rebuilt with the Cloud in mind.  That’s where you come in!  We need an individual who takes a specific interest in hacking and building upon Google Apps APIs and its various Cloud Platform products, and other 3rd-party systems to create robust and complete solutions for our customers.



Ideal candidate: You spent hours learning JavaScript and Python, you’re asking questions in online communities and getting answers, you’ve built some apps that integrate with APIs and/or some server-side processes with JSON, you consider yourself highly skilled in JavaScript with confidence to take on the world, have a few go-to frameworks (Angular JS, jQuery), and now you’re ready to get hired full-time with a successful company that can ignite your career!  Conceptual understanding of different JavaScript methodologies, libraries and frameworks is key. JavaScript projects will range from Google App Scripts to full, single-page applications. Understanding and potentially being able to use different tools in the appropriate situation, such as Angular JS, Backbone, Mustache and jQuery, will be important - as is the ability to solve problems without using those tools at all. You have built applications on Google App Engine, and are comfortable modeling data with App Engine’s Datastore, specifically NDB.  If this site excites you, that's a big step in the right direction: http://javascript.crockford.com/



Responsibilities:




  • Develop professional, highly scalable and interactive web applications as custom solutions for clients

  • Full lifecycle application development

  • Designing, coding and debugging applications in various software languages.

  • Software analysis, code analysis, requirements analysis, software review, identification of code metrics, system risk analysis, software reliability analysis

  • Performance unit-based software testing and quality assurance while building out the application

  • Performance tuning, improvement, balancing, usability, automation

  • Support, maintain and document software functionality

  • Integrate software with existing systems

  • Evaluate and identify new technologies for implementation

  • Work closely with Project Manager on client discovery, project estimating and project progression, testing, deployment, and iterations

  • Maintain standards compliance

title: Software Engineer - UI/Front End at FireEye (Reston, VA)
description:
The Role:


As a UI/Front End Software Engineer, you will make data beautiful and easy to navigate so we can solve real world problems.  You will develop fully functional web applications that align with business objectives.  You will grow your skills, work with cutting edge technologies and introduce new tools and techniques to the team.  You’ll work in an environment that encourages creative thinking and limits red tape.  You’ll collaborate with fellow engineers, UX designers, product management and end users.  You’ll come up with ways to do things more quickly and more effectively while maintaining a laser focus on quality.  In a nutshell, you’ll create software that makes our team smarter, faster, and better at what we do – protect the world from evil.


Responsibilities:



  • Design and develop dynamic web applications in an agile development environment

  • Engage in architecture sessions, challenge existing solutions and inspire ideas for future enhancements

  • Evaluate and utilize cutting edge JavaScript frameworks

  • Rapidly prototype and refine applications based on user experience feedback

  • Promote strict code testing and validation to ensure high-quality coding standards

title: Sr. Software Engineer- Big Data
description:
About the Position

The ideal candidate will be familiar with working in a Linux environment (and able to use the appropriate tools), needs to be fluent with C++ (C++03 is great; familiarity with C++11/14 is a bonus) and have experience with test-driven development. Familiarity with Python and other web API technologies would be a bonus.

We are constantly innovating new features that require analysis of petabytes of data. That requires us to think of distributed scalable solutions, so we are always looking for those candidates who can think outside the box but still understand the inherent costs and complexities of distributed systems.

We are also working on different ways of visualizing (via the browser) the state of the overall system to help analyze failure scenarios and develop tools to preemptively spot potential problem states before they become critical.

The team as a whole is actively involved in development on HBase and Hadoop and feed patches back to the community. There are potential opportunities to become involved in this core work on this bleeding edge technology stack.

About the System

There are four parts to our main indexing service:

  • Sorting and prioritizing 200 billion URLs into a schedule
  • Crawling the generated schedule and processing individual pages
  • Processing the crawled pages and building and inverse link graph: 1,000,000,000,000 links
  • Serving the inverse link graph via an API
  • Each of these systems is a distributed parallel system running in the cloud (We had to throw \cloud" in here somewhere :-) ) that runs on multiple nodes: 10 nodes for part 1, 20 nodes for part 2, 40 Nodes for part 3, and 8 nodes for part 4. We use a custom-built DB as the interface between these four systems.
  • The code is written in C++ (Parts 1-3) and Python (Part 4), with a deployment system built with Bash.

Qualifications:

Required

  • BS in Computer Science *Or a great reason for not having one, and believe us, there are plenty
  • Experience with Linux/Unix environment (you can handle the shell, preferably bash)
  • Experience with C++03
  • Experience with Python
  • At least 2 years of relevant industry experience

Nice to Have

  • MSc/PhD in Computer Science
  • Experience with Java
  • Experience with scripting languages Ruby/Node/Bash
  • Experience with C++11 or C++14
  • More than 5 years of relevant industry experience
  • Experience debugging multi-threaded/multi-process/distributed applications
  • Experience using one or more DB technologies in a production environment
  • *SQL is nice
  • **NoSQL is very nice
  • Knowledge of web services; experience utilizing and creating APIs
  • Knowledge of BigTable/Hadoop/HBase

About Moz

We build analytics software that gives our users the technical edge towards better marketing on the web. We are dedicated to the future of marketing analytics. We’re obsessed with it. We’ve been at it for over 7 years and we’re in it for the long haul. We’re a leader in our space, growing fast and receiving frequent recognition for our accomplishments (2014 lists include: Inc 5000, Deloitte Fast 500, and the Puget Sound Business Journal's fastest growing private companies).

Behind our software is a sea of Mozzers with a wide array of personalities, experiences, and expertise. We’ve worked hard and deliberately to build a cultural roadmap. It’s not just about ping pong games and company parties (though we have those, too!). Learn more about it below before you apply:

  • TAGFEE is the glue that holds us together and binds how we do everything at Moz. As Mozzers, we aspire to live and breathe these values.
  • We make the web a better place: (http://moz.com/about) and this is how we do it: (http://moz.com/products).
  • Not convinced we are awesome yet? Check out our video “Why We Love Moz” and our amazing benefits package.

Sneak Peak at the Goodies

  • Competitive salary, 401K, stock options
  • Generous time off plus $3,000 per year towards your vacation!!
  • Home internet and transportation subsidies
  • 150% charitable donation match
  • And so much more (feel free to grill us about the rest in the interview!)

Why Moz? Because we love what we do.

Moz is an equal opportunity employer and we are committed to providing a work environment that is free from any form of discrimination. Moz values diversity and fosters mutual respect among its employees.

"

title: Senior Web Application Engineer
description:
What Will You Do:

Glint is looking for a senior UI engineer to join our engineering team. Your primary responsibility is to help architect, design and implement key UI components of Glint’s real-time employee engagement platform, including the application tier and the browser. You will also be working with product management and the design team to push the boundaries of what's possible for a great user experience.

Who You Are:

  • Minimum of 5+ years of experience building highly interactive, data-driven web applications.
  • Expert knowledge of node.js and application frameworks such as Express.
  • Strong proficiency with JavaScript and asynchronous programming with its quirks and workarounds.
  • Solid understanding of HTML5, CSS and cross browser compatibility issues.
  • Solid understanding of web application security and vulnerabilities (such as the OWASP top 10 list)
  • Experience working with REST based API services.
  • Working knowledge with AngularJS is highly desirable.

More reasons why you’re qualified:

  • Ability to work in a fast paced startup environment. Flexible, open minded, willing to do what it takes to achieve important milestones.
  • High engineering standards.
  • BS in Computer Science or related fields.

Who we are:

Glint is an early-stage, VC-funded software startup backed by investors such as Norwest Venture Partners, Shasta Ventures, Evan Williams (Twitter) and Geoff Ralston (Y Combinator). Its leaders are seasoned entrepreneurs with a track record of building and growing highly successful companies and teams such as Turn, SuccessFactors, Jaspersoft, Glassdoor, & Altavista. Jim Barnett, the company's CEO, has led several successful companies. Check out the media buzz about us!

What we are all about:

Glint provides a real-time employee engagement platform that enables companies to improve employee satisfaction, build stronger teams and deliver better results. At its heart, it’s a state-of-the-art interactive communication platform that builds on top of cutting-edge predictive technology, the latest in behavioral science, and superlative design. Our B2B SaaS product just launched and is already being used by well-known customers to re-invigorate workplaces and create happier, more effective teams and thriving organizations. Our company has an extraordinary team of passionate high-tech professionals. The market for Glint is huge, and our customers are seeing powerful results–calling it “transformational”.

Stuff to perk you up even more...

  • Competitive compensation and full benefits including healthcare, life insurance, PTO and 401K
  • Early stage equity play
  • MacBook Pro or MacBook Air and 27" Thunderbolt monitor
  • Catered lunches and flexible work arrangements
  • Learn from smart people and strong leadership
  • Work for a dynamic early-stage startup, helping organizations thrive
  • Next to Caltrain in downtown Redwood City .................................................................................................................................

Glint provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Glint complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leaves of absence, compensation and training.

title: Software Engineer – Vector Maps - 40692089
description:
Changing the world is all in a day's work at Apple. If you love innovation, here's your chance to make a career of it. You'll work hard. But the job comes with more than a few perks.

Seeking extraordinary coders to work on the server side of vector map display. An ideal position for a strong generalist, you’ll have exposure to a rich variety of topics including computational geometry, graph algorithms, map-reduce, analytics, data compression, client-server protocols, and computer graphics.

Key Qualifications:
•Excellent skills in C++ or Java, and object-oriented design
•Broad knowledge of computer science and systems; ability to quickly learn new domains
•Solid system development skills in UNIX-type OS (e.g. Linux, Solaris, BSD, OS X)
•Excellent problem-solving and analytic skills
•Good communication skills and teamwork
•Experience with Hadoop would be an asset

Description:
Apple is hiring senior software engineers for our vector maps service.

You’ll be working on the cutting edge of GIS technology, crunching massive amounts of geographic data which will be visible\nto customers worldwide. In a fast-paced, continuously-integrated environment, you'll use your engineering know-how to design robust, flexible software for a mission-critical pipeline, while taking a hands-on approach and working with client engineers to deliver the next generation of Maps features.

Education:
BS or MS in Computer Science or a related field

Additional Requirements:
The following experience is nice to have, but not required:
• Navigation or GIS software
• Computational geometry or computer graphics
• Python


Apple is an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer that is committed to inclusion and diversity. We also take affirmative action to offer employment and advancement opportunities to all applicants, including minorities, women, protected veterans, and individuals with disabilities.

\n

title: Backend Engineer - Data Team
description:
Summary

Grammarly is a bootstrapped, profitable company with millions of registered users. Grammarly’s automated proofreader helps the world’s 2 billion English speakers improve the quality of their writing.

We are looking for talented engineers who will have a big impact on our technical direction. You will join a company where risks and exploration are the norm. You will be part of a team that envisions, collaborates, designs, and develops highly scalable and highly available services to help writers around the world communicate more effectively.

As a Backend Engineer on the Grammarly Data Team, you will work on constructing the Grammarly analytical data pipeline using the coolest building blocks out there and effective creations of your own. You will also be responsible for building out our code metrics, log collection, and querying stack, which in effect will enable other teams to build data pipelines for their services. Your ambition and skill will drive and impact our entire platform. If you want a big challenge, this is your next gig!

What You Will Accomplish

  • Build internal real-time analytical data acquire-attribute-aggregate pipeline using: Spark & Spark Streaming, Reactive Streams Cassandra Kafka Scala
  • Build a high-load, big-data, distributed, no-single-point-of-failure, horizontally-scalable, lambda-architecture app
  • Build extensible high-load APIs and client-side instrumentation tooling
  • Build querying and visualization layer on top of Looker, Tableau and custom web-app
  • Perform integration to loop the analytical insights back to Grammarly product
  • Relentlessly work to optimize performance and data processing
  • Help to improve our development cycle, including CI/CD, deployment, documentation, instrumentation, and monitoring processes

Qualifications

  • BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent experience
  • Experience writing code in one of the following languages: Java, Scala, Clojure, Lisp, Erlang, Python, C#/C++, Go
  • Experience working with relational databases (PostgreSQL, MySQL) as well as a strong grasp of - -NoSQL systems (Cassandra, Redis)
  • Experience with asynchronous systems including message queueing (RabbitMQ, Kafka)
  • Experience designing and maintaining distributed systems
  • Experience building APIs
  • Experience crunching data with Hadoop and Spark

Benefits

  • 401(k), Medical, Dental, Vision
  • Subsidized commuting benefits
  • We are located in beautiful downtown San Francisco, blocks away from BART

About Grammarly

Grammarly improves communication among the world’s 2 billion native and non-native English writers. Our flagship product, the Grammarly® Editor, corrects spelling mistakes, checks for more than 250 common grammatical errors, enhances vocabulary usage, and provides citation suggestions. Millions of registered users worldwide trust Grammarly’s products, which are also licensed by more than 600 leading universities and corporations. Grammarly is an Inc. 500 company with offices in San Francisco and Kyiv.

title: Software Developers for Back- & Frontend
description:
Maritime Data Systems develops software for the maritime industry.

We design tracking systems, develop routing algorithms, compute traffic & weather data and analyze flow of vessels and cargo. We deal with huge amount of data sets and develop and implement sophisticate algorithms to analyze the data. Our clients are mainly bigger size companies from all areas of the maritime and transportation sector.

We are looking for young, highly motivated, smart developers from different parts of the world to join our team in Hamburg / Germany. You can join us,even if you have just finished university or if you want to do an internship or your master thesis in our company.

At the moment we offering several positions for Backoffice and Frontend developers.

-Java Backend Developer

-Javascript (Angular or Bootstrap) Frontend Developer

-Internship (Software Developer)

-Master Thesis (Algorithms & Big Data)

We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:

Required skills:

  • Bachelor or Master Degree in engineering, mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science
  • software development skills, for example: Java, Ruby on Rails, Node.js, Angular or JS
  • Good English level (spoken and written)
  • Passion for software development and great interest in new technologies

Would be a big plus:

  • Browser side: Javascript, Angular.js, Bootstrap, HTML, CSS
  • Knowledge of No-SQL databases: MongoDB, Neo4J
  • Proven experience in development of software products (commercial, personal or open source)
  • Knowledge of Big Data technologies: Hadoop, Elastic Search
  • Visa for Germany / working permission

We offer:

  • Assistance in a dynamic international team
  • Opportunities to learn about the latest Big Data & Webtechnologies
  • Wide scope for implementing creative and innovative ideas
  • Many opportunities for career-related development plus participation in conferences & bootcamps
  • An attractive modern office located directly on Hamburg's Alster Lake
  • Regular team events (e.g. "Friday Lunch")
  • Fitness program – SUP on the lake !!!!
  • Support with visas, resettling, accommodation and establishing yourself in Hamburg

Application: We look forward to receiving your application and CV in English via email to jobs@maritimedatasystems.com or on our Website www.maritimedatasystems.com/career

Maritime Data Systems GmbH Schwanenwiek 24 22089 Hamburg 040 – 22 86 78 99 0 www.maritimedatasystems.com

"

title: Forward Deployed Engineer - Customer Success Team
description:
Summary This role exists to ensure that all of our customers are successful with their Jut deployments. We’ve built an incredibly powerful analytics platform and need to make sure users are tapping into this power to maximizes Jut’s impact in their organization.

This is the sole customer facing team at Jut and as such, this role is the best parts of sales, part support and part account management. This is a technical customer facing role where your product expertise will be a key factor in customer success.

Jut is located in Downtown San Francisco

Responsibilities

  • Customers, customers, customers
  • Be the main point of contact for customers and evaluators to ensure an awesome customer experience with Jut - work to delight customers both pre-sale & post-sale
  • Help customers fix technical challenges (there is little chance of customer delight if the product is not working)
  • Help customers understand how they could maximize their usage of Jut in their organizations
  • Deliver product demos and other product centric webinars
  • Improve the Organization & the Product
  • Collect, collate and present product feedback from users and work with Product Management and Engineering in order to shape product direction
  • Develop and execute a backlog of projects and experiments to improve Customer Success metrics
  • Assist with growth experiments to understand what actions drive adoption and usage and improve evaluator on-boarding, conversion and retention rates
  • Work closely with product and engineering to achieve the goals above, from a relationship perspective (embody the voice of the customer internally to help shape our decisions)
  • Cultivate customers success stories for use in website, speaking engagements, etc

Measure & Scale

  • Help define success measurements for Customer Success including a measure of a customer satisfaction (or NPS), customer conversion and retention and product usage metrics
  • Scale the impact of Customer Success by creating scalable systems, processes and customer facing material to improve customer experience. Content could include knowledge base articles, tutorials, best practice guides, quick video overviews, solution guides, upgrade guides, etc.

Measurements Naturally we will be using our own analytics platform extensively internally to measure and improve our work. We are focused on holistic measurements shared within the organization so that we are all working towards common objectives; you will have a dramatic impact upon these measurements.

These metrics will likely include the following:

  • Product usage: we want our customers to engage more and more with our product and you job will be assist in driving great product usage
  • NPS or satisfaction: a measure of customer satisfaction or NPS
  • Land: (evaluator conversion rate) continually improvement of rate at which evaluators decide to purchase Jut
  • Expand: assist with product penetration

Secondary measurements could also include items such as:

  • Contact rates: reducing customer contact rates while growing conversion rates (optimizing & build to scale)
  • Success stories: we need to broadly share the stories of success and this role will need to cultivate and capture those stories

Requirements You would be a perfect fit if you…

  • Love getting into deep technology challenges which you can explain in a way your grandparents can understand
  • Love helping customers fix problems and make the most of technology
  • Have a proven ability to understand complex technology and articulate the value in a clear manner
  • Enjoy influencing product development
  • Relish making data based decisions and recommendations
  • You’re a natural born communicator and collaborator
  • Passion, curiosity, a sense of humor and a desire to leave a mark
  • Have worked selling or supporting web based enterprise software (bonus points for doing this with big data, analytics or database software)
  • 4 or more years in a customer facing sales engineering, technical support or similar role

Have a mix of some of these:

Technical background including:

  • Intermediate skills in operating systems & networking
  • Database experience including Hadoop, no-SQL or SQL
  • Knowledge of HTML, XML, JavaScript and CSS
  • Node.js experience
  • Experience with RESTful API
  • Basic understanding of UNIX commands (for search, and other command line features)
  • AWS experience
  • Experience supporting Java applications
  • Experience in data analytics / big data
  • Working knowledge of DevOps, IT automation, build and release management, etc
  • Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent demonstrated experience

title: Back-End Web Developer
description:
Back-End Web Developer

Michigan State University (MSU) is seeking an innovative and creative Back-End Web Developer responsible for managing the interchange of data between the application and the browser. This role focuses on the server side of programming for the web, yet also requires understanding the programming languages that control the display of content in the browser.

Responsibilities

The Back-End Web Developer:

  • Integrates user-facing elements developed by front-end developers with server-side logic
  • Develops and modifies object-oriented frameworks both inside and outside of a CMS
  • Builds reusable code and libraries
  • Develops front-end code that meets or exceeds WCAG 2.0 AA and W3C web standards
  • Develops applications that interface with web services
  • Implements security and data protection
  • Provides detailed estimates of time and resources required to meet project objectives

Qualifications

Candidates should have:

  • A Bachelor’s degree in computer science, information systems, business, or related information technology field, with course work in an information technology specialization related to robust content management solutions and integrating databases/APIs and related back-end systems, or an equivalent combination of education and experience
  • At least three years of related and progressively more responsible or expansive work-related knowledge of PHP, HTML, XML, JSON, and CSS
  • Experience writing regular expressions and database queries
  • Demonstrated knowledge and use of web-accessibility fundamentals
  • Experience in scripting development best practices, architecture, scalability, etc.
  • Demonstrated success executing tasks with both procedural and OOP development techniques
  • OWASP-based knowledge in best practices for securing web applications
  • Experience using version control like Git and CSS preprocessors such as LESS or SASS
  • High level of verbal and written communication skills
  • Previous employment with a corporation or agency as a back-end web developer

Learn More or Apply

To learn more about this opportunity, visit cabs.msu.edu/careers/back-end-web-developer.

To assure full consideration, please apply online at jobs.msu.edu (posting #1702) by August 18. Applications must include a letter of application, résumé, and contact information for three references.

About MSU/East Lansing

Michigan State University is situated on a beautiful, park-like campus, close to major metropolitan centers, with outlying research facilities and natural areas and a proud land-grant heritage. The campus is located in East Lansing and adjacent to the capital city of Lansing, with a diverse population of approximately 450,000. Local communities have excellent school systems and place a high value on education. The campus has nearly 5,500 faculty and academic staff, more than 6,300 support staff, and more than 50,000 students. MSU is an equal-opportunity employer committed to supporting and actively increasing diversity in all areas of campus. MSU is proactive in exploring opportunities for employment of dual-career couples, both inside and outside the university. Information about MSU’s dual-career support can be found at http://miwin.msu.edu.

MSU is an affirmative action, equal opportunity employer. MSU is committed to achieving excellence through a diverse workforce and inclusive culture that encourages all people to reach their full potential. The university actively encourages applications and/or nominations of women, persons of color, veterans, and persons with disabilities.



Apply Here

\n"

title: Software Engineer - Infrastructure
description:
About the teams:

Yelp's Search & Data Mining, Ads, and Spam Prevention teams run services that respond to hundreds of requests every second. Each and every query must be lightning fast, 24/7/365. This means our infrastructure needs to be both speedy and reliable. It also needs to make efficient use of resources and be easy to use for relevance/machine learning developers to modify and improve.

Your core responsibility will be helping to define and build that long-term vision of a fast, reliable, efficient, and ductile search infrastructure. So get your infra mojo on and join us!

Things we like:

  • Prior experience with production large-scale distributed systems.
  • Demonstrated ability to work with a large amount of independence and responsibility.
  • Ability to work closely with information retrieval/machine learning experts on big-data problems. Some interest and familiarity with IR/ML is a plus, but it will not be your primary focus.
  • Prior experience with Lucene, ElasticSearch, Hadoop/mrjob, or large data stores (MySQL or NoSQL - we just want the right solution for the situation).
  • A hunger for tracking down root causes -- no matter how deep it takes you -- and fixing them in systematic ways.
  • We use Java & Python. You don’t need to be an expert, but experience is a plus and we will expect you to learn them on the job.
  • Minimum BA/BS degree in Computer Science, Math, or related degree
  • A sense of humor and excellent aim with Nerf darts.

title: Big Data Engineer (Java)
description:
Role The mission of Amadeus’ Hotel IT team is to design and deliver high performance systems that can process tens of thousands of requests per second and return the highest level of accuracy in the fastest response time. Our SaaS platforms are designed to serve millions of users who are seeking information and reservations from tens of thousands of hotels offering millions of hotel rooms around the world. Utilizing our proven ability to build and deploy mission critical software for the global travel industry, we are creating the next generation of technology solutions for the hospitality industry including: reservations and distribution, high-volume data acquisition from heterogeneous sources, sophisticated search engines, payment processing, hotel operations, business intelligence, and revenue management.

The aim of the Hotel Reporting and Business Intelligence team is to provide high volume real-time operational reporting on large systems and novel and revolutionary insights to the hotel industry. We help our customers be become better run and more profitable by improving their level of knowledge about their own businesses and providing actionable data.

The Java Engineer for Reporting and Business Intelligence is an expert on building high availability, high transaction JEE web applications.

Responsibilities

  • Build web service oriented web applications to capture, analyze, publish and display data
  • Create ETLs to feed the data warehouse
  • Create reporting services Qualifications and Education Requirements
  • B.S. or M.S. in Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics or equivalent experience.
  • Demonstrated experience working with high availability service oriented applications
  • 5+ years experience in Java/JEE web development (JBoss, Weblogic, etc.)
  • Strong knowledge of SQL (Oracle, MySQL, SQL Server) databases Preferred Skills
  • Experience with frontend web development (HTML, CSS, JavaScript, AngularJS/Ember.js)
  • Knowledge of NoSQL (Couchbase, MongoDB)
  • Experience with Hadoop (Hive, Pig, Spark, HBase, Impala)
  • Experience with Business Intelligence tools (Oracle BI, SSRS) and/or Reporting Tools (JasperReports) a plus
  • Experience with stream processing (Kafka, Storm) a plus

Amadeus strives to achieve outstanding results through a diverse workforce. Our employees represent over 123 nationalities. We welcome and embrace individual differences to bring out the brilliance in ourselves, our customers and each other. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer.

title: Quality Software Tester
description:
Panduit’s software team in Folsom, CA, develops next-generation technologies that view data centers as a system to be optimized to save energy and run robustly. We're looking for a range of test engineers who bring fresh ideas from all areas, including general software testing, test automation and scripting, wired and wireless device communication technologies and protocols, distributed system testing; the list goes on and is always growing.

As a quality software tester, you will be a member of a dynamic development team where you will apply your system testing skills on commercially released products critical to Panduit’s corporate vision. You will have opportunities to switch focus between test planning and execution, test automation infrastructure, UI testing, service and device testing, and other areas of expertise on the team as you and our products grow and evolve. We need our engineers to be versatile, self-motivating, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to tackle new problems across the full-stack as we continue to push technology forward.

Minimum Qualifications

BS degree in Computer Science, Electrical/Computer Engineering, similar technical field of study or equivalent practical experience 2+ years of relevant experience Familiar with testing within Agile methodologies Familiar with software testing and integration concepts (defect reporting/triaging, verification/validation, end-to-end system testing, system test planning) Familiar with Java and Java based applications Knowledgeable with scripting and general programming concepts Ability to create test plans and test cases and understands the importance of good documentation and traceability Self-motivated but self-aware to know when to ask for assistance without delay Preferred Qualifications

Experience with automation frameworks and implementing automation strategy Experience with or interest and ability to learn about DCIM, controls, distributed/embedded systems, or environmental device sensors Understanding of communication protocols: TCP/IP, 802.15.4, SNMP, Modbus, or BACNet

Panduit is a world-class developer and provider of leading-edge solutions that help customers optimize the physical infrastructure through simplification, agility, and operational efficiency. Panduit’s Unified Physical Infrastructure (UPI) based solutions give enterprises the capabilities to connect, manage and automate communications, computing, power, control and security systems for a smarter, unified business foundation. Strong relationships with technology leaders complemented with its global staff and unmatched service and support, make Panduit a valuable and trusted partner.

In addition to going to Panduit.com website and looking at our Solutions site (http://www.panduit.com/Solutions/SolutionsOverview/index.htm), please also note that Panduit was recently named by Information Week as one of the Top 500 Innovators.

"

title: Data DevOps Engineer
description:
Be part of a fast growing company whose primary focus is to improve and advance health and health care using modern data technologies and end-user engagement. Rally Health is a private company of 270 employees with a major financial backing from UnitedHealth Group (with the market cap of $112B and the net income of $10B). We have partnered with several insurance companies including UHG and other large corporations for user acquisition, clinical data feeds, and monetization.

In this role you will be enabling analytics, data science, and business intelligence by deploying and maintaining infrastructure and data services around health risks, clinical and lifestyle recommendations, and population health management and reporting.

Our technologies: AWS, Scala, Play, Hadoop (CDH), Kafka, Spark and Spark Streaming, MongoDB, Vagrant, Jenkins, Chef

Responsibilities:

  • Maintain, enhance, and optimize the data pipeline in a highly available, scalable, and robust manner
  • Provision, configure and deploy new infrastructure and services
  • Design, manage, and maintain tools to automate operational processes
  • Contribute to making our infrastructure simple, reliable, and easy to operate
  • Maintain and enhance monitoring and alerting

Requirements:

  • Experience in operations and Linux systems engineering in a cloud environment
  • Mastery of a configuration management tool, such as Chef, Puppet, Ansible, Salt
  • Programming experience in Python or a similar language
  • Experience with CI, Jenkins and Continuous Deployment
  • Experience with WebApps and Nginx
  • Experience with monitoring (Sensu, Nagios) and metrics (Graphite, Librato, statsd)
  • Knowledge of security best practices
  • Ability to track down root causes and fix them in systematic ways
  • Strong problem solving skills and attention to detail
  • Self-starter and results-oriented

And for bonus points:

  • Experience setting up and maintaining a Hadoop cluster
  • Experience with data pipeline technologies, especially Kafka
  • Experience with containers (Docker, LXC)

title: Software Engineer (Remote work possible)
description:
We believe every patient should receive quality healthcare.

As a software engineer at Advanced Medical Reviews (AMR), you will be contributing to the development and support of a web based application servicing the Independent Medical Review space. The company is well established and experiencing extremely strong growth domestically and internationally.

AMR is currently looking for talented professionals who are passionate about the software they create and strive to keep up-to-date with the latest tools and technologies.

We are a fast growing, tight knit team of professionals with a “can do” attitude and expect the same of any new members. The team is fully virtual with members across the US and overseas. Employees work from their home offices and will require demonstrated self-directed skills.

Basic Responsibilities:

  • Contributing to a collaborative design process within a small team that includes developers and subject matter experts
  • Designing and coding new features
  • Maintaining and refactoring existing modules and periodic direct interaction with customers in support of the product

Position Requirements:

  • 5+ years professional software development experience
  • C#, .NET 4.5, object-oriented programming experience
  • LINQ/Microsoft Entity Framework 6+ experience
  • SQL Server 2012 / T-SQL, experience writing stored procedures & functions
  • Experience using Git/GitHub source control
  • Knowledge of ASP.NET Web Forms development
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and requirements analysis experience
  • Strong analytical abilities and a drive to solve complex problems
  • Ability to consistently deliver results on time while working independently
  • Excellent written, verbal and collaborative skills

Preferred Qualifications:

  • Experience with ASP.NET MVC
  • Experience with Knockout, AngularJS or other client-side Javascript frameworks
  • Active GitHub profile or contributions to open source projects

Education:

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or 5+ years of professional software development experience

Compensation/Benefits:

  • 100% telecommute position
  • Competitive salary
  • Medical, Dental and Vision coverage
  • 401k with employer match
  • Vacation, Sick and Holiday pay

title: Technical Content Creator
description:
As our new technical marketer, you will be creating content to drive awareness for Compose as well as help new and current customers become more proficient running databases. If you have strong writing skills, love working with the latest engineering technology, and can distill complex ideas for broad audiences, this may be a good fit for you.

You should have a basic understanding of how databases are used in modern web app development. You must have strong writing chops, be able to communicate database concepts to novice and experienced developers, and articulate how Compose can help customers with their data strategy. On any day you may manage development of new customer quick-start guides, create tutorials, or write use cases. You'll also develop new website content, videos and interactive tours for different audiences. A background in computer science, technical writing, software development and/or database administration is going to be a big help.

Compose is small enough that you'll be able to make a significant impact on the company's trajectory, yet big enough that there is plenty of support and boundless opportunity for growth. Work from anywhere, enjoy challenging and rewarding responsibilities, and have a meaningful work/life balance at a company that's growing fast. Our team is smart, friendly, fun, and incredibly helpful, and you'll have a ton of resources to help you get started and be successful.

title: Software Engineer, Geospatial Insights
description:
Overview

Azavea uses geospatial data to build software for civic and social impact. We’re excited about what we do, we’re growing, and we hope you will join us.

Azavea is based in Philadelphia, and we are looking to grow our Geospatial Insights team that develops custom web and mobile software for public health, climate change, law enforcement, elections and civic applications as well as our HunchLab, open source DistrictBuilder and Cicero products.

We are looking for

We’re looking for a software engineer that is passionate about building applications that will have a positive impact – someone interested in public service, but not necessarily interested in working for a government or a non-profit organization. We are looking for someone who thrives on working in a variety of technology environments, and wants to build visually slick applications that have well-engineered architectures and provide a responsive user experience.

Skills & Requirements

Who we are and what we’re doing: As a B Corporation, we’re committed to working on projects that have social and civic impact, and advancing the state-of-the-art through research. Most of our customers are local governments, non-profit organizations and academic or federal research projects. We build custom apps; perform geospatial analysis; manage several open source civic software projects (DistrictBuilder, OpenTreeMap and others); and develop an open source, high performance computing framework, GeoTrellis, that enables us to build fast analytical applications by distributing the geospatial data processing. Our developers work across the technology stack from database and application servers in the infrastructure layer to modern, browser-based front-ends.

The Geospatial Insights team develops web mapping software for analysis and visualization of public health, homelessness, and elections, including supporting the open source legislative redistricting software, DistrictBuilder and our Cicero API. They are also developing two cutting edge products, a climate change data processing service and our HunchLab product, a web-based application for visualizing space-time events and geographic forecasting of crime risk. We apply a mix of clever software, math, statistics, machine learning and AWS clusters to create a powerful analysis tool that is being used to improve public safety in communities around the world. In addition, the team is working with academic researchers to implement software for crime geography analysis techniques that push forward the boundaries of what’s possible with contemporary data science.

Our company and team are growing, and we need your help to scale up our development capacity on the Geospatial Insights team.

What You’ll Do:

  • Implement application code, APIs and web or mobile clients based on wireframes and designs developed by our UI/UX Design team.
  • Engage in multidisciplinary work that applies an agile process (scrum board, daily stand-ups and two-week iterations) to database design, architecture, development, testing and deployment.
  • Optimize database, server and client performance to create applications with both functional and responsive user experiences.
  • Build, provision, and deploy servers in a repeatable way to a cloud environment.
  • Contribute to both a growing company and to the open source communities that support our work.

You should:

  • Know how to build and support scalable web applications in Python/Django, or another MVC framework (C#/.Net, Ruby/Rails, JS/AngularJS, Java/JVM/Spring, Scala/Play). We do a lot of work in Python/Django, Javascript, and Scala and dabble in others depending on client and project requirements.
  • Demonstrate fluency in core web technologies (HTML/CSS/JS) and contemporary Javascript libraries like jQuery, React, or AngularJS.
  • Express solid understanding of MVC architecture, RESTful design patterns, and the DRY principle.
  • Be comfortable managing VMs and working in a Linux environment.
  • Be interested in working with a small, collaborative team on meaningful projects.
  • Get excited about a diversity of both projects and technologies.

You get extra points for:

  • Background in math and statistics or experience with R.
  • Experience with open source or commercial geospatial toolkits like OpenLayers, Leaflet, GeoServer, PostGIS, CartoDB, ArcGIS, and GoogleMaps.
  • Experience with mobile apps (Objective C, Android or responsive HTML).
  • Experience scaling apps within AWS.
  • Experience provisioning servers with Ansible.
  • Knowledge of distributed data processing frameworks, like Hadoop, Amazon MR, etc.
  • Demonstrating your open source or other community service contributions.

You’ll notice that we don’t say “X-Y years of experience” or “M.S. in Computer Science.” Formal credentials like these are not irrelevant, but we are primarily looking for people who have had experience successfully building sophisticated web applications. You might have had these kinds of experiences without a college degree. Or you may be just out of school but worked your way through school and had some great co-op experiences. Or you might have a math or humanities background but have a great head for software development. These are all potentially great backgrounds, and we’d be interested in hearing from you.

Office and Benefits

Our Philadelphia office is located in a brightly lit office on the 4th floor of a converted factory building in the Callowhill neighborhood, a short walk from Center City, the Reading Terminal Market and SEPTA subway and regional rail stations. For bicyclists, we have in-house bike parking, a shower and lockers. It’s an open office plan with several smaller rooms for team meetings, private space and concentration time. You get a top-end Linux workstation, Mac or Windows laptop with a pile of memory for VMs and extra monitors. We have flex-time to deal with personal stuff, and most people work a 40 – 45 hour week on a regular schedule. After the first six months, our developers can also spend up to 10% of their time on a geospatial open source, professional development, or R&D project. For example, some of our colleagues are contributors to the PostGIS, OpenLayers, GDAL and GeoTrellis projects. Other research projects have included improving dev ops tool chains; using FFT for fast kernel density estimation; extending Scala for improved numeric handling; and hijacking GPUs for raster data processing. Once a quarter, we all get together to share our research and learning with our colleagues.

We offer a salary commensurate with skills and experience and a benefits package that includes: profit-sharing bonus, health, dental, vision, retirement plan, flexible hours, and more. We welcome qualified candidates from all walks of life and value diversity in our company, and we prohibit discrimination based on race, color, religion, ancestry, national origin, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, veteran status, military service, disability unrelated to job requirements, marital status, or domestic partner status.

title: Head of Data Science - Data Science Centre of Excellence
description: Head of Data Science - Data Science, Data Coding, Open Source, Hadoop (Hive, Impala, Pig), Mahout, PostgreSQL, AWS (EC2, EMR, S3) MongoDB, Neo4J-Cypher, Data Munging, Data Analysis  Up to £80K base + bonus + benefits, location: London with UK travel when needed  Superb opportunity for a Head of Data Science to join my end user client to be responsible for evangelising big data technology/data science and to lead the Data Science Centre of Excellence.  A huge bonus will be that you have exposure to data science and data analytics projects within a HR Solutions company or a HR consulting organisation.  You will be able to demonstrate most of the following skills in:    * Data Systyems: Hadoop (Hive/Impala/Pig),Mahout, PostgreSQL, AWS (EC2/EMR/S3), MongoDB, Neo4J - Cypher.   * Analytical Skills: Data Munging, Statistical Analysis, Experimental design (sampling, confidence), Classifier and predictor development, Time series analysis, Pattern detection, Natural Language Processing, Sentiment Analysis, Computer Vision.   * Supplementary Skills: Data Visualisation, API Exploitation, Source control using Git, Continuous Integration (Jenkins), Unit Testing, Virtual Machines (Vagrant, Virtualbox).   * Languages: Python (+ SciPy/Pandas/SciKitLearn), R, Excel (+VBA), SQL, Bash Scripting, Clojure (+ Cascalog), HMTL5 (+ D3/Bootstrap/Yeoman)  This is an excellent chance to build your career prospects within a company that is thriving with some of the most exciting data science and data analytics projects in the world  Interview in London with hiring manager on Thursday 3rd September

title: Senior Data Architect, Network Big Data Centre of Excellence
description: Req Id: 88130  Bell is a truly Canadian company with over 135 years of success. We are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company's vast potential.  To ensure we continue to be recognized as Canada's leading communications company, we're committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. This means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  If you're passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team.  Our Network team plans, designs, builds and operates Bell's multi-billion dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic network, HSPA+ and LTE - Canada's largest and fastest wireless network.  The service we provide is the foundation of Bell's competitive advantage and a critical step towards achieving Bell's goal to be recognized by customers as Canada's leading communications company.  Bell is a truly Canadian company with over 135 years of success. We are defined by the passion of our team members and their belief in our company's vast potential. To ensure we continue to be recognized as Canada's leading communications company, we're committed to finding and developing the next generation of leaders. This means creating best-in-class career and development opportunities for our employees.  If you're passionate, driven and find yourself seeking interesting work, new challenges and continuous learning opportunities, then we want you to join our team. The Network team plans, designs, builds and operates Bell's multi- billion dollar networks, including the continued expansion of our fibre optic network, HSPA+ and LTE - Canada's largest and fastest Wireline and wireless network.  **Hiring team**  The Network Big Data Centre of Excellence and Business Intelligence team is accountable for leading data technology and data science initiatives across Bell's Network. The team works to create and implement technology strategies and solutions to take advantage of vast amounts of Network data spanning wireless, wireline, TV, and Media to improve Bell's network planning and operation as well as Bell customers' user experience and to provide advance data related services.  This is a unique and exciting opportunity to be part of a newly established and growing Bell Network Data Centre of Excellence team and help execute key Big Data initiatives. You will have opportunities to apply and grow your data architecture skills by working with experts in the field and using state of the art BI and Big data tools, as well as apply and grow your business and leadership.  **Key Responsibilities**    * Lead and participate in the design and implementation of Big data and BI solutions using Hadoop and Apache open source components as well as enterprise grade BI and analytics solutions from leading vendors   * Analyse user requirements and create effective and efficient data related solutions   * Perform data exploration, mining, and forecasting   * Explore and propose solutions to business problems that can be addressed using insights from data   * Develops data architectures strategies, principles, standards and frameworks. Analyzes and evaluates alternative tactical and/or strategic data architecture solutions to meet business requirements  **Critical Competencies**    * University degree in Engineering, Computer Science, or Mathematics. Graduate degree in Analytics or Data Science related discipline is an asset   * Advance and hands on data experience spanning database design, data modelling, analytics, reporting, forecasting, data warehousing, Hadoop, ETL, etc. Experience implementing big data solutions using hadoop, SAS, and Microstrategy is an asset   * Experience in requirements analysis, design, implementation, and testing of software solutions especially data related using C++, Java, .net, Python and other programming languages   * Gifted thinker who is extremely resourceful and can learn new technologies on the fly, driven and proactive   * Strong interpersonal, oral and written communication skills, at the same time fun and possess a good sense of humour   * Team player who always put the interest of the team above all other priorities   * A Bachelor degree in Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, or equivalent   * 8+ years technical experience with at least 3 years as data architect holding similar R&Rs as above, preferably in a Telecom environment.   * Autonomous and energetic individual   * Ability to oversee and work simultaneously on different requirements with a variety of projects and short timelines   * Experience in technology research and evaluation as well as vendor selection   * Strong aptitude to recognize opportunities for improvement in day-to-day work and take appropriate actions   * Excellent analytical, problem solving and decision making skills with a strong attention to detail   * Experience in Networking and Telecommunications is a strong asset  Bilingualism is an asset (English and French)  **_**_**_Additional Information:_**_**_**  **Position Type:** Management    **Job Location:** Canada : Ontario : Mississauga Canada : Ontario : Toronto    **Application Deadline:** 08/28/2015   **_**_**_ Please apply directly online to be considered for this role. Applications through email will not be accepted. _**_**_**  Bell is committed to fostering an inclusive, equitable, and accessible environment where all employees and customers feel valued, respected, and supported. We are dedicated to building a workforce that reflects the diversity of the communities in which we live and serve, and where every team member has the opportunity to reach their full potential.  Created: Canada, ON, Mississauga

title: Werkstudent – Data Science
description: Surrounded by water, mountains, and cherry blossoms, we are proud to push the...  Die Audible GmbH ist ein führender Anbieter von Hörbuch-Downloads in Deutschland. Unter www.audible.de sind momentan mehr als 150.000 Titel in deutscher, englischer, spanischer und französischer Sprache von mehr als 800 Verlagen erhältlich - darunter die größte Auswahl ungekürzter Hörbücher. Audible ist weltweit exklusiver Hörbuch-Partner des Apple iTunes Store. Audible gehört seit einigen Jahren zum E-Commerce-Unternehmen Amazon.      Zur Verstärkung unseres Teams in Berlin suchen wir einen engagierten und begeisterungsfähigen         Werkstudent – Data Science (m/w)   Als Werkstudent im Bereich Data Science unterstützt Du uns vorrangig bei der Verarbeitung und Analyse unserer Datensätze. Dabei arbeitest Du unter der Leitung eines Data Science Director und eng mit unserem Marketing Team zusammen. Du lernst dabei verschiedene statistisch-mathematische Modelle anzuwenden und umfangreiche Analysekonzepte zu verwerten.      Deine Aufgaben:   · Unterstützung des Data Science Teams bei der analytischen Erschließung verschiedener Phasen des Kundenlebenszyklus in einem internationalen (auch nicht europäischen) Kontext.   · Unterstützung unseres Data Science Teams bei statistischen Analysen entlang ihrer gesamten Wertschöpfungskette: Problemformulierung, Anschluss und Erkundung möglichst passender Daten, Modellbildung, Modellimplementierung.   · Als Berater/Mitdenker pflegst Du einen engen Kontakt zu unserem Marketing Team, um neue Strategien zu entwickeln.     Dein Profil:   · Du hast eine Vorliebe für Datensätze sowie Modelle und interessierst Dich für gesamtheitliche analytische Herangehensweisen mit einem Bias für Pragmatismus.   · Codes und Simulationen sind eine Leidenschaft von Dir.   · Du hast Kenntnisse in mindestens einem der folgenden Programme: “Languages”-C, Mathematica, MatLab, Python, R, SAS.   · Deine Sprachkenntnisse in Englisch sind sehr gut.     Deine Aussichten:   · Langfristiges Mitwirken (idealerweise 2 Jahre) als vollwertiges Mitglied in einem tollen Team mit der Möglichkeit, Dich mit Deinen persönlichen Stärken individuell einzubringen und Branchenkompetenz sowie technisches Knowhow aufzubauen.   · Spannende Einblicke beim weltweit führenden Anbieter für Hörbuch-Downloads in einem stark expandierenden, an Amazon angelehnten, internationalen und sich permanent bewegenden Umfeld und einer außergewöhnlich schönen Arbeitsumgebung in Berlin Mitte.   · Wir suchen eine Unterstützung für ca. 20 Stunden in der Woche. Vergütet wird Deine Tätigkeit mit 12,- € pro Stunde. Die Abrechnung erfolgt per Lohnsteuerkarte.      Trifft dieses Profil auf Dich zu und hast Du Lust, mit uns zusammen die Entwicklung eines neuen Marktes aktiv voranzutreiben? Dann freuen wir uns Dich kennenzulernen! Bitte sende uns Deine vollständigen Bewerbungsunterlagen mit Anschreiben, Lebenslauf, sowie ggf. Arbeits- oder Praktikumszeugnissen über unser Bewerbungstool.      Durch Zusendung Deiner Unterlagen stimmst Du der Speicherung Deiner Daten in unserem Bewerbungstool zu. Deine Daten werden ausschließlich für den Bewerbungsprozess genutzt.

title: Senior Product Manager, Data Science
description: **About the position**   Salesforce.com is the enterprise cloud computing leader. Our digital marketing technologies-including our flagship sales and CRM applications-help companies connect with customers, partners, and employees in entirely new ways. With more than 100,000 customers worldwide, we are proud to contribute to the success of companies of all sizes and industries, around the globe. If you're passionate about innovation, come help revolutionize how companies collaborate and communicate with customers.      The Marketing Cloud product team is looking for an experienced product management and technology professional who is passionate and experienced at partnering with data science engineering and has a track record for driving new product capabilities from initial concept to successful delivery and market adoption. The product management role has both inbound and outbound responsibilities. Inbound responsibilities consist of working with the technology team to deliver a world-class cloud computing application driven by customers, prospects, advisory teams and internal product experts. Outbound responsibilities include meeting with customers, prospects and industry analysts to discuss product requirements and the product roadmap. This job is for experienced product managers who thrive in a fast paced collaborative environment and love working with the best technology team in the world.      **Key responsibilities**   • Work with product and engineering leadership to define and deliver the next generation of our data science capabilities. This includes defining market needs, product vision and strategy, roadmap creation and communication, release planning, requirements gathering, functional specification all the way through to customer enablement and success.      • Provide leadership within the data science engineering team, and work very closely with development, QA, user experience, documentation and other product teams to execute the Marketing Cloud data science product strategy.      • Employ an outside-in approach to data science by owning and driving feature delivery end-to-end: writing user stories, working with user experience to create prototypes for usability testing, working with development, technical publications, and quality assurance teams to deliver a marketable product on time.      • Engage with enterprise customers for requirements gathering, feature requests and roadmap updates.      • Represent salesforce.com as a domain and product expert for data science at customer interactions, industry and corporate events.      **Requirements**   • Academic expertise and/or equivalent experience in statistics, data science and big data technology.      • 3+ years of experience in Product Management or Systems/Business Analysis.      • Analytics / BI / Visualization product management experience a very strong plus.      • Excellent organizational skills, analytic capabilities, and attention to detail.      • Proven ability to influence cross-functional teams without formal authority.      • Strong communication skills.      • Cloud computing experience.      • Demonstrated experience in the agile software development process.      • Demonstrated experience in gathering and transforming customer needs into an actionable product vision and requirements definition.      • Strong troubleshooting and analytical thinking skills.      • Bachelors' degree, with technical disciplines preferred      LI-Y
