title: Data Architect
description: Data Architect      Archimiddle delivers consultancy in IT architecture and Middleware to support customers with architectural decisions and implementations. The IT landscape evolves rapidly from data and application silos to agile service oriented solutions, increasing the importance of data as a service.   This opens new opportunities for business, such as Big Data solutions, but at the same time, these solutions must often be fit into existing data infrastructure and architecture, which can be quite a challenge.      Job description   As a data architect, you will be working with multiple data stores and data types in diverse development environments.   You are able to take responsibility over architectural decisions with respect to data, and you can help customers implementing Big Data solutions.      You have a broad knowledge of data techniques and project methodologies and you can be an active and reliable part of a development team.      You will take responsibility for following tasks:   Take architectural decisions, both conceptual and technical   Translate business requirements into architectural requirements   Guide the implementation of Big Data projects   Be part of a team of Big Data developers   Increase your data architecture and data science knowledge   constantly      Your profile   We are not just looking for people matching all skills, but also for experienced people with a high potential in these fields.      Conceptual skills   Big Data Architecture   Data Science   Data-as-a-Service solutions   NoSQL concepts      Technical skills   Relational databases, SQL   Hadoop, HDFS, and related technologies   Graph databases   MapReduce   Big Data cloud technologies   RESTful web services      Soft skills   Communication skills   Creative thinking   Documentation skills   Presentation skills      What we offer   We offer you a competitive salary with extras such as a company car incl. fuel, group and health insurance, laptop, and above all, an inspiring work environment with lots of room for personal improvement and knowledge expansion.      About Archimiddle   Archimiddle is a consultancy firm within the Contribute Group-with over 120 consultants-helping customers take the right IT decisions and deliver end-to- end tailored IT solutions, using modern and future-ready technologies and methodologies.   Archimiddle actively supports creativity and forward thinking and is active in integration, data, and cloud architecture.

title: Accenture Digital & Analytics Analyst
description: ## - Jobbeschreibung  **Skill: Accenture Analytics Analyst**  **Level: Analyst**  **Location: Dubai**  ****  Join Accenture and help transform leading organizations and communities around the world. The sheer scale of our capabilities and client engagements and the way we collaborate, operate and deliver value provides an unparalleled opportunity to grow and advance. Choose Accenture, and make delivering innovative work part of your extraordinary career.  The digital revolution is changing everything. It’s everywhere – transforming how we work and play. Are you leading the way as a digital disrupter? Accenture Digital is driving these exciting changes and bringing them to life across 40 industries in more than 120 countries. At the forefront of digital you’ll create it, own it, and make it a reality for clients looking to better serve their connected customers and operate always-on enterprises.  **Accenture Digital** is powered by three practices –Mobility, Interactive, and Analytics. As part of our Analytics practice, you’ll deliver analytically-informed, issue-based solutions that help clients make faster, smarter decisions. You’ll play a critical role in helping them tackle complex business issues.   **Accenture Digital Analytics **professionals serve our clients by harvesting strategic insights from data and develop predictive modeling capabilities that target and deliver value across a wide array of corporate functions. Strong candidates will have a consulting or agency background with excellent subject matter expertise and hands-on experience in planning, supporting, implementing and deploying leading-edge digital marketing data & analytics solutions.   **_Job Description_**  **The Analytics Executive **is a client-facing role that interprets, translates, and synthesizes client requirements into a solution that can be configured from a standard or highly-customized set of Accenture offerings. The Analytics Executive operates as a single point of leadership contact or as part of a team (on larger engagements with multiple Executives) accountable from Stage 0 (pre-engagement) to deal closure while leading delivery and/or the transition to the service fulfillment organization(s).   **_Key Responsibilities for the Analytics Executive include, but are not limited to:_**    * **General Management**     * Lead and deliver large scale, complex client engagements that identify, design, and implement creative analytical solutions for large companies      * Design, implement and oversee the quality of deliverables produced by our service professionals    * **Financials and Resourcing**     * Understanding and clearly define the correct inputs required to create cost estimates      * Work with national resourcing teams to staff your projects  ## + Basis Qualifikationen  **_Basic Qualifications:_**    * Minimum of Bachelor's Degree required in a related field; strong preference for fields of study in the computer science, engineering, economics, data science and statistics    * 2+ years of increasing leadership experience in management consulting or industry    * 1+ years of Analytics delivery experience    * Experience with Big Data technologies (Hadoop, Cassandra, Hive, Pig, Impala, Parquet, etc.) and large Data Warehouse implementation (Oracle, Teradata, GreenPlum, SAP Hana, Netezza TF)   * Experience in CRM Modeling, Analytics & Campaign Execution (SAS, Unica, Teradata, Oracle)   * Expertise with the Microsoft Office suite (including advanced Excel skills with embedded Pivot Tables & Macros; advanced PowerPoint usage for storyboard design and presentation)   ****  **_Preferred Qualifications:_**    * **Customer Analytics**     * Ability to bring industry leading expertise and point-of-view on customer analytics, CRM, marketing, and customer data platform      * Strong understanding of statistical concepts and predictive modeling. (e.g., AI neural networks, multi-scalar dimensional models, logistic regression techniques, machine-based learning, etc.)     * **Education and Experience**     * Master’s degree preferred in computer science, engineering, economics, data science and statistics  **_   Professional Skill Requirements _**    * Ability to build, manage and foster a team-oriented environment    * Ability to work creatively and analytically in a problem-solving environment    * Desire to work in an strategy, analytics and technology-driven environment    * Excellent communication (written and oral) and interpersonal skills    * Excellent leadership and management skills

title: Vice President - MET Credit Quant
description: # Vice President - MET Credit Quant  **Job ID: **3113380  **Full/Part-Time: **Full-time   ------   **Regular/Temporary: **Regular  **Listed: **2015-06-04   **Location: **Mumbai, India      A Passion to Perform. It’s what drives us. More than a claim, this describes the way we do business. We’re committed to being the best financial services provider in the world, balancing passion with precision to deliver superior solutions for our clients. This is made possible by our people: agile minds, able to see beyond the obvious and act effectively in an ever-changing global business landscape. As you’ll discover, our culture supports this. Diverse, international and shaped by a variety of different perspectives, we’re driven by a shared sense of purpose. At every level agile thinking is nurtured. And at every level agile minds are rewarded with competitive pay, support and opportunities to excel.  In the world’s financial markets, Deutsche Bank CIB: Markets is an acknowledged leader. We regularly win awards and top industry polls for our high-performing investment banking products and services. Our 6,400 employees around the world have a reputation for being highly focused. We provide clients with unique insights, vast experience and an unparalleled level of service.  Our top-ranked business offerings include bonds, equities, FX, money market products, commodities and all forms of derivatives and structured investment, financing and risk management products. We are active throughout Europe, North America, Asia and all the world's emerging markets.  ## Position Overview  **CIB Centre Overview:**  Deutsche CIB Centre, a Deutsche Bank Group company, provides extensive structuring, quantitative analytics, platform development and execution support from its location in Mumbai and regulated offices in the US and the UK. With over 550 professionals performing cutting-edge modeling, quant, analytics, and research, Deutsche CIB Centre assists Deutsche Bank’s Corporate and Investment Banking teams around the globe in delivering innovative financial solutions to international clients in less time and at lower cost. This global reach provides you with huge opportunities to develop your career locally as well as globally.  **Job Summary:**  Global Client Solutions (GCS) sits within the GFX business within FIC. It is responsible for the development and management and revenue growth of GFX’s client facing platforms for the purpose of distributing liquidity and attracting transactional flow. The Maestro is one of the core GCS Platform. This role is for Trading support of the Maestro business.  **Responsibilities:**  The Maestro business requires a follow-the-sun model in terms of trading and monitoring capability. The Trading function, shared between the Hubs and DB Centers, relates to the technical aspects of the services, system functioning, market risk management and final pricing and terms. Customization and integration of the system with client data also fall upon the trading function.  DB Center resource would have primary responsibility for    * Monitoring system orders, proper functioning of the hedging and client trade capture infrastructure   * Initiation of all non-automated tasks (e.g. reporting, procedures within the tactical infrastructure)   * Risk monitoring, and basic client support (trade-related, non-technical)  This role’s responsibilities would ideally expand to VBA coding/modifications in the current infrastructure and the scripting that will drive certain features of the future strategic architecture.  **Candidate Specification:**    * Candidate should be a numeric, very detail oriented and vigilant individual   * An experienced coder / Information Systems oriented individual would be strongly favored   * Experience in FX markets, treasury, or trading support a plus as would be any experience in data science related projects.   * Advanced Level Excel Skills including Macro and Automation   * Experience with Microsoft Access   * SQL preferred but not mandatory   * Excellent communication and inter personal skills  In return, Deutsche Bank offers a challenging and rewarding career where your contribution is valued and rewarded. We have an inclusive and friendly working environment coupled with excellent facilities and benefits.  Deutsche Bank is an equal opportunity employer who seeks to recruit and appoint the best available person for a job regardless of marital / civil partnership status, sex (including pregnancy), age, religion, belief, race, nationality and ethnic or national origin, colour, sexual orientation or disability.  Please let us know if you require any adjustments to enable you to apply or attend an interview. If you would like to discuss your requirements, or have any concerns about the application process, please contact your recruiter.

title: Management Consulting Graduate Programme 2015
description: ### Location  London    ### About Capgemini Consulting  Capgemini Consulting is the management consulting discipline of the Capgemini Group, one of the world’s largest providers of Consulting, Technology and Outsourcing services. We offer transformational excellence through understanding specific customer needs in all business sectors.  Our Business Analytics Team is Capgemini Consulting’s business analytics and modelling capability. The team delivers analytical solutions and advisory services to a wide range of clients across a number of industry sectors. Our Clients look to us to work with them collaboratively and provide the expertise and structured thinking that will help them develop innovative solutions to complex business problems. The team is currently expanding and we are looking for graduates consultants to join the team.       ### Main Purpose of Role  You will be part of a leading Business Analytics practice in the UK within Capgemini Consulting. You will undertake a wide variety of challenging project work and help our clients optimise their business processes, improve operations and drive performance improvement. You will be encouraged and have the licence to develop new ways of delivering value. When allocating work, we always try to match individual development needs with those of the business. We are looking for talented people with relevant qualifications to help us grow. The type of work that you might get involved in will vary from:  • Using modelling and analytically based techniques to solve business problems as part of a major business transformation, or specialised pieces of work such as economic modelling, business case development, risk modelling, optimisation, simulation, systems dynamics and forecasting.   • Developing and using modelling tools to support strategic decision making.   • Delivering analytical advisory services to clients.   • Developing both thought leadership points of view and new service offerings to differentiate us in the marketplace.  Skills Required   To succeed you will need to possess and demonstrate a number of competencies:  • A track record of academic achievement (ABB at A-level or equivalent) and a 2.1 degree in a numerate subject e.g. Maths, Stats, Industrial Engineering, Economics   • MSc. post-graduate qualification in an analytical subject such as Operational Research, Data Science, Management Science, Statistics or Decision Science. Essential or 1-2 years work experience in Analytics or Data Science.   • You will be familiar with Customer Insight, Business Insight, Pricing Strategy, Yield Management / Revenue Management, Data Analytics, Business Modelling, Business Intelligence, Data Mining, Data Modelling, Operational Research, Forecasting or Decision Science.   • Experience of tools such as Splus/SAS/SPSS/R/Excel.   • A proven ability to rigorously analyse complex issues and develop insights and solutions.   • An ability to provide creative thinking and innovative methods.   • Good presentation and influencing skills.   • An ability to work in mixed teams of colleagues and clients.   • Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills with high levels of enthusiasm and a good team player.   • Drive & commitment to own and deliver outstanding work.

title: Data Science Manager, People Analytics Team
description: At Google, data drives all of our decision-making, and our HR organization is no exception. The People Analytics team acts as an internal innovation lab, using analytical approaches to make sure Google continues to be a great place to work. The team provides critical support to the business around issues of organizational health and is responsible for not just taking the pulse of our Googlers, but harnessing Googler feedback to drive change for the better. As an analyst you'll be detail-oriented and conscientious, analytical and curious. You're a strong problem-solver, who uses both quantitative and qualitative methods to get things done. And on top of it all, you're someone who wonders \What if?\" and then seeks out the solution.  As a member of the newly created People Data Science & Technology team, you’ll help a team comprised primarily of social scientists learn to take advantage of their increasing access to big behavioral datasets. You’ll bridge the gaps between our team of researchers and Google’s software engineers and statisticians. You’ll be extremely proficient technically with a strong interest in applying your skills to improving understanding of human behavior. You’ll be excited to learn from and contribute to the great Google statistics community and to share and apply your learning on project with People Analytics teammates.  Responsibilities    * Access and leverage behavioral, network and unstructured data sets by writing and testing data mining, text and sentiment analysis, clustering, and other types of machine learning algorithms.   * Collaborate with a team of analysts and social scientists to conduct in-depth analysis, design and analyze experiments.   * Keep People Analytics connected to Google’s statistics community, act as our statistical subject matter expert and push the team forward on advanced analytical methods.   * Influence senior social scientists, human resources and business leaders through strong communication skills and deep subject matter expertise.  Minimum qualifications    * MA degree in Computational Science, Computational Data Science, Computational Social Science, Applied Statistics, Management Science and Engineering, Operations Research, Biostatistics or Data Sciences or equivalent practical experience.   * 3 years of experience with machine learning, data mining or statistical work.   * Experience with statistical analysis and classification methods like K-Means, KNN, SVMs, Deep Learning/Neural Networks, Decision Trees, Random Forests, Logistic Regression, Multinomial Logit, etc.  Preferred qualifications    * PhD degree in a quantitative field (Math, Statistics, Computer Science, Engineering, Data Science, Operations Research, Biostatistics).   * 5 years of applied experience with machine learning, data mining or statistical work.   * Experience with unstructured data (e.g., text). Ability to use data to tell a story based on the insights from complex analysis.   * Experience with web-based data visualization skills (e.g., D3.js). Front-end web development experience.   * Experience drawing insights from large longitudinal behavioral datasets such as datasets that constantly track movement, from a perspective of enabling individuals vs. enabling companies.   * Strong learning and teaching orientation: constantly seeking to improve your own skills and willing to invest in building the skills of those around you. Interest in social sciences in application of social sciences to People Analytics."

title: Data Science Engineer
description: ### Job Summary  Apple’s Analytic Insight team is responsible for mitigating fraud, waste and abuse company-wide. AI Data Science Engineering is building an environment to enable cutting-edge data analysis over Petabytes of data. We work side-by-side with data scientists and implement scalable, easy-to-use systems and tools. We are seeking a customer-oriented, passionate and driven Data Science Engineer to lead our test automation and release management. Must be able to design and drive large projects from inception to production implementation and beyond. Must be a great communicator, team player, and a technical powerhouse.  ### Key Qualifications    * Mastery of one of C++, Python, Java, Scala or equivalent language   * Experience with Relational databases and NoSQL databases   * Experience with Agile software development process, Test-Driven development and Continuous Integration   * Experience with software test and test automation   * Solid understanding of the full software development lifecycle   * Excellent problem solving, critical thinking, and communication skills   * Strong ability to learn new technologies in a short time   * Experience in building data science or data analysis tools a plus   * Machine learning background a plus   * Experience with Hadoop, Hive, Spark a plus  ### Description  You will design and build systems and tools to support the fraud prevention efforts of Analytic Insight. The job will include: -Design innovative software solutions to open-ended problems -Design test strategy and implement test automation for internal tools and fraud services -Develop processes and tools to enable safe and scalable deployment for fraud services The candidate is expected to be self-motivated, pro-active and solution-oriented individual.  ### Education  BS degree in computer science or equivalent field plus 7-10 years experience, or equivalent.

title: Data Scientist
description: Job description   IBM is searching for a Data Scientist as an intern to join our team. The candidate will join the Emerging Sciences team in IBM’s new ExperienceOne group. The ExperienceOne group uses advanced analytics to help organizations attract, delight, and more effectively engage with their customers. We develop state of the art statistical and optimization models that go directly into ExperienceOne's software products. ExperienceOne provides software solutions and expertise to help marketing, merchandising, sales and customer service leaders achieve their specific business goals.      The candidate will play a key role in helping the team to define, research, and develop new statistical models that will be integrated into our products. These products help many of the largest companies in the world improve their engagement with customers by improving their customer's overall experience with their brand. The candidate will have demonstrated experience with both the quantitative research and software engineering aspects of data science. Also, the candidate will be involved with studying how data from social media, web traffic, marketing campaigns, customer service, and customer sales can be used to improve customer engagement and lifetime value. This is a great opportunity to work on some of the most challenging big data problems around and to directly see the impacts of your work in the business results of several of the largest retail companies in the world.      Required    * Bachelor's Degree    * Basic knowledge in data science    * English: Fluent       IBM is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, genetics, disability, age, or veteran status. IBM is also committed to compliance with all fair employment practices regarding citizenship and immigration status.

title: Technical Expert Big Data im Volkswagen Konzern (m/w)
description: # Technical Expert Big Data im Volkswagen Konzern (m/w) \\- München      Bezeichnung:      Technical Expert Big Data im Volkswagen Konzern (m/w) Ihr Einsatzort:      München  Eintrittsdatum:       sofort Befristung:      unbefristet Referenznummer:      13429  Als 100%ige Tochtergesellschaft der Volkswagen AG unterstützen wir den Volkswagen Konzern und seine Marken. Wir erbringen Personal- und Prozessdienstleistungen entlang der gesamten Wertschöpfungskette für unsere Kunden in der Automobilbranche. Unter anderem übernehmen wir ganzheitliche Prozesse innerhalb von IT- und Ingenieursdienstleistungen sowie in kaufmännischen Bereichen.      ## Ihre Aufgaben    * Sicherstellung einer bedarfsgerechten und sicheren IT-Infrastruktur mit der große Datenmengen bereitgestellt, kombiniert und analysiert werden    * Beschreibung der Struktur und die Skalierbarkeit von Big Data Lösungen und deren Umsetzung    * Definition der Anforderungen und Implementierung der Schnittstellen zu bestehenden Systemen (intern und extern)    * Verantwortung für die Konzeption und Implementierung von IT-Infrastruktur unter Einbeziehung der Anforderungen aus dem Bereich Big Data    * Konzeption von Datenmodellen unter Beachtung der Entwicklung zukünftiger Datenmengen    * Sichtung und Auswahl von Technologien und Kooperationspartnern inkl. title: Senior Data Science Consultant
description: __  ### Company Information  Atos SE (Societas Europaea) is a leader in digital services with 2014 pro forma annual revenue of circa € 11 billion and 93,000 employees in 72 countries. Serving a global client base, the Group provides Consulting & Systems Integration services, Managed Services & BPO, Cloud operations, Big Data & Cyber-security solutions, as well as transactional services through Worldline, the European leader in the payments and transactional services industry. With its deep technology expertise and industry knowledge, the Group works with clients across different business sectors: Defense, Financial Services, Health, Manufacturing, Media, Utilities, Public sector, Retail, Telecommunications, and Transportation.      Atos is focused on business technology that powers progress and helps organizations to create their firm of the future. The Group is the Worldwide Information Technology Partner for the Olympic & Paralympic Games and is listed on the Euronext Paris market. Atos operates under the brands Atos, Atos Consulting, Atos Worldgrid, Bull, Canopy, and Worldline.  Our ability to deliver Operational Excellence means that we are always ready and able to help our clients address whatever challenges they face, wherever they are in the world. We also place great emphasis on understanding and meeting the needs and priorities of our clients, including their sustainability objectives.      Atos values the individual and strives to deliver an appropriate work-life balance because a motivated and happy person can add untold value to our clients and colleagues around the world.  For more information, please see the Atos corporate web site:.  ### Job Description  The Sr Data Science Consultant is responsible for helping Atos clients understand and extract value from their data. Working both independently and as part of a team, the Sr Data Science Consultant will be involved in all phases of (Big Data) analytics projects including: question formulation, design, research and development, implementation, and testing. The ideal candidate is able to explore and understand data and build advanced analytical models independently, then present and discuss the resulting models to any level of audience.  The data scientist role is a self-directive role, requiring very high level of initiative and investigative/detective capabilities in achieving goals/objectives for business clients.   The Data Scientist uses scientific /analytical approaches to explore and visualize available data, identifies gaps and needs for additional data, builds/validates required analytic models (such as classification, clustering or association, to name a few) for potential deployment/ implementation by business clients in operations.   This role will require working on multiple projects simultaneously in collaboration with various cross-functional teams. The Data Scientist will be responsible for periodically providing data-driven insights and conclusions through presentations and prototype demonstrations.  **Responsibilities**:   • Work with clients to gather and refine specific business problems and scenarios and document analytical solution requirements   • Create and maintain documentation of technical requirements including use cases   • Define the data requirements for specific business problems and Identify sources of data in consultation with business clients (e.g., in-house data store/warehouse, external data mart, etc.)   • Identify and resolve data/information gaps for meeting business objectives/goals including data quality issues and sources (data feeds, the master data, etc.), and identify training and validation datasets as appropriate   • Build multiple analytical models to solve specific business problems using commercial or open source toolsets   • Work with stakeholders to establish minimum levels of performance criteria for model selection   • Work with Business clients to Validate/Test subset of model(s) and obtain approval for models that achieve specified business goals   • Report Analytical results in a variety of creative visual formats that appropriately provides insights to business clients   • Define technical requests for Technical Specialists to perform, such as detailed data linking or parallel processing requests.        ### Job Requirements  **Required**:    \\- Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Industrial Engineering, Applied Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science or related fields (equivalent work experience considered).   \\- 5 years + hands-on experience in one or more Statistical Methods, such as machine learning, information retrieval, data mining, Text Mining, Natural Language Processing, Web Analytics or similar.   \\- Experience with Java   \\- Experience with SQL and relational database programming and/or distributed computing platforms and query interfaces such as MapReduce, Pig, Hive.   \\- Excellent verbal and written communication skills; ability to express complex ideas to any level of audience.   \\- Strong team player capable of working in a demanding environment.   \\- Eager to learn and apply new technologies.   • Experience working with very large data sets, grouping together data and visualizing results   • Familiarity with extracting data from Hadoop using frameworks like Hive and from MPP platforms, experience with some Java / python / simple map-reduce jobs development   • Experience with commercial modelling and simulation tools such as SAS Enterprise Miner, SAS Visual Analytics, IBM SPSS Modeller, and open source tools such as R, Weka.   • Analytical Reasoning Skills: Adept at mathematical reasoning, Applies scientific experimentation to business problems   • Possess skills such as Analytical Model Design & Implementation, Visualization/Report Design & Implementation   • Business skills: Some level of industry sector understanding, product understanding and process understanding   • Strategic Thinking and Creativity Skills: See the Big Picture, have high level of curiosity and willingness to experiment   • Communication Skills: Excellent Written and Verbal Skills, Ability to communicate effectively with senior level executives clients  **Desired**:    \\- Ability to write production level code.   \\- Exposure to Big Data technologies (Hadoop, HDFS, Pig, Hive, etc.).   \\- Familiarity with NoSQL databases (e.g., HBase, Cassandra, Mongo DB).   \\- Experience with Tableau or other data visualization tools.   \\- Experience working with customers (consulting experience a plus).   \\- Diverse data set experience.   \\- Experience with PMML.   \\- Experience with Python or Scala

title: Soft­wa­re­ent­wick­ler/in
description: ## Tätigkeitsprofil:  Unsere Mission: Wir erforschen das Leben und die Erde im Dialog mit den Menschen.  Das** Museum für Naturkunde Berlin (MfN)** ist mit seinen über 30 Millionen Sammlungsobjekten eines der größten Naturkundemuseen weltweit. Zusammengetragen als Beleg für die Diversität der Natur, sind seine Sammlungen zugleich Zeugnisse der Wissenschafts- und der Kulturgeschichte. Das Museum für Naturkunde Berlin ist als Forschungseinrichtung und Stiftung des Öffentlichen Rechts seit 1. Januar 2009 Mitglied der Leibniz-Gemeinschaft.  **Bezeichnung: Softwareentwickler/in**  **Arbeitszeit: **100 v.H.d.regelm. wöchentlichen Arbeitszeit  **Befristung:** Zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt und ist befristet bis 31.01.2016   Drittmittelfinanzierung  **Entgeltgruppe:** E11 TV-L Berlin  **Projektbeschreibung:**   Das DFG-geförderte Projekt „German Federation for the Curation of Biological Data (GFBio)” (http://www.gfbio.org/) arbeitet am Aufbau einer grundlegende Forschungsinfrastruktur, die den Austausch von biologischen und umweltbezogenen Forschungsdaten ermöglichen bzw. vereinfachen soll. Das Projekt befindet sich derzeitig in einer 18-monatigen Pilotphase.  Das Ziel des Forschungsbereichs „Digitale Welt und Informationsmanagement“ ist die Implementierung einer zukunftsfähigen Architektur für naturkundliche Daten und Datenrepositorien, welche neue Möglichkeiten zur Beantwortung von Forschungsfragen sowohl im Bereich „Data Science“ als auch „Public Engagement with Science“ eröffnet.  Die erfolgreiche Bewerberin/der erfolgreiche Bewerber wird folgende **Aufgaben** im Rahmen des Projekt GFBio am MfN übernehmen:   • Entwicklung GFBio relevanter Softwaretools (BioCASe Monitor Service, Specify 6 Workbench) und Anfertigen einer lückenlosen Dokumentation   • Technische Betreuung und (konzeptionelle) Weiterentwicklung der Datenpublikation am MfN   o Weiterentwicklung einer Webschnittstelle zur langfristigen Publikation von GFBio Daten des MfN (stabile URIs mit HTML und RDF Landing Pages)   o Durchführung relevanter Anpassungen am MfN Datenmapping und Weiterentwicklung eines Transformationsschemas (ABCD-Schema zum GFBio Zielschema)   o Vernetzung des MfN als internationales Data Center   • Teilnahme an Projekttreffen, Telefonkonferenzen und Mitarbeit an Fortschrittsberichten  ## Anforderungsprofil:  **Anforderungen:**   • Abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Geo- oder Bioinformatik oder eines ingenieur- bzw. naturwissenschaftlichen Studienganges, welcher Aspekte dieser Disziplinen beinhaltet, oder mindestens 3-jährige Berufserfahrung in zuvor genannten Bereichen und Mitwirkung in entsprechenden Referenzprojekten   • Gute Kenntnisse in der Programmierung webbasierter Software   • Kenntnisse mind. einer höheren Programmiersprache (vorzugsweise Java)   • Kenntnisse im Umgang mit Source Code Repositorien   • Sehr gute Kenntnisse in der Skriptsprache PHP   • Gute Kenntnisse in der Verwendung von SQL-Datenbankmanagementsystemen (vorzugsweise MySQL)   • Kenntnisse in der Verarbeitung von XML und Erstellung von XSLT   • Erfahrungen mit Austauschstandards naturkundlicher Sammlungsdaten (z.B. ABCD, ABCD-EFG, DarwinCore)   • Interesse an der Arbeit mit forschungs- und sammlungsbezogenen Daten naturkundlicher Forschungsmuseen   • Erfahrungen im Führen einer Projektdokumentation und im Verfassen von projektbezogenen Fortschrittsberichten   • Gute Kommunikations- und Präsentationsfähigkeiten   • Sehr gute Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift      **Hinweise:**   Zur Sicherung der Gleichstellung sind Bewerbungen qualifizierter Frauen besonders willkommen. Schwerbehinderte Bewerber/innen werden bei gleicher Eignung bevorzugt.  Bewerbungen mit den üblichen Unterlagen (Lebenslauf, Zeugnisse) sowie einem Anschreiben mit Erläuterungen zu Ihrer Erfahrung sind **bis zum 11.05.2015 unter Angabe der Kennziffer 21/2015 **an Museum für Naturkunde, Personalreferat, Invalidenstraße 43, 10115 Berlin zu rich-ten.  Bitte beachten Sie, dass eine Rücksendung von Unterlagen und Bewerbungsmappen nur mit beigefügtem Rückumschlag erfolgt. Zu unserer Entlastung bitten wir Sie von der Zusendung von Bewerbungsmappen abzusehen, und mit der Bewerbung ausschließlich Kopien in einfacher gehefteter Form einzureichen.  **Weitere Informationen: **   Familienpolitik: Das Naturkundemuseum Berlin hat sich die Förderung der Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie zum Ziel gesetzt und wurde hierfür mit dem Zertifikat zum audit berufundfamilie der audit berufundfamilie gGmbH- eine Initivative der Gemeinnützigen Hertie-Stiftung - ausgezeichnet.   Weiterführende Informationen finden Sie unter: http://www.naturkundemuseum- berlin.de/institution/vereinbarkeit-von-beruf-und-familie/

title: (Senior) Software Developer für Data Science (m/w) - xplosion interactive GmbH
description: ## Ihre Aufgabe  Zur Unterstützung unseres Data Science suchen wir **ab sofort **einen **(Senior) Software Developer für Data Science (m/w) **zur Festanstellung.  **Deine Aufgaben**    * Du entwickelst und pflegst unsere JVM-basierten Frameworks für das maschinelle Lernen, die Optimierung und automatisierte Entscheidungsfindung.   * Du entwickelst Software in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Data Scientists: Du bist deren „Enabler“ und überführst z. B. moderne Lernalgorithmen in die Produktion.   * Zum Aufgabenspektrum zählt ebenso die Auswahl von Technologien, Bibliotheken und Frameworks als auch der Entwurf von Architekturen für Data Processing Systeme.   * Du implementierst, testet und evaluierst Lern- und Optimierungsalgorithmen im Kontext von aktuellen Big Data Technologien (Hadoop, Spark, gängige Streaming-Frameworks)  Mehr Aufgaben  ## Ihr Profil  **Dein Profil**    * Abgeschlossenes Universitätsstudium der Informatik (Master/Diplom)   * min. 2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Softwareentwickler   * Gute bis sehr gute Mathematikkenntnisse (lineare Algebra, Statistik, Optimierung, Numerik)   * Nachgewiesene Kenntnis von Machine Learning Methoden und Algorithmen   * Erfahrung im Umgang mit einschlägigen Machine Learning Bibliotheken bzw. Frameworks (z. B. Weka, Mahout, Torch, etc.)   * Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Verwaltung großer Datenmengen mit relationalen und NoSQL-Datenbanken  Mehr Profil Informationen

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: If you are excited about developers and interested in using data science to make Windows a better platform, this is the job for you. We are a team in the Operating System Group using data science principles to more deeply understand our developers and further advance the Windows platform. Our mission is to transform the organization into a data driven culture which makes product decisions based on actionable metrics.      We support a larger organization in its quest to improve quality through the use of data. Working in partnership with other developer-focused teams, we will ensure a great developer experience built from excellent tools, a world- class API surface, and a solid Windows platform. We will utilize the Build- Measure-Learn loop to enhance the lives of developers on a world-class Windows platform.      This Senior Software Engineer position will focus on applying machine learning and data science techniques to our business questions. Work will include conducting data analysis for broad insights, providing insight to our data science projects, and training others on critical tools and processes. Our team is highly iterative and candidates must be willing to try new things, learn from failure, and continually improve.      We are looking for a candidate who is an experienced software engineer who also understands the fundamentals of data science and machine learning. We work closely with other teams making collaborative skills a big plus.      Required Skills:   8+ years of software development and/or test development   A Computer Science degree or equivalent experience   Experience with Machine Learning and Data Science      Optional, useful skills:   R, IPython, PowerBI, or other data analysis tools   Knowledge of the Windows platform (Win32/WinRT)   Experience building Windows Apps   Experience with C++, C#, JavaScript, and SQL      Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, religion, national origin, marital status, age, disability, veteran status, genetic information, or any other protected status.

title: Biomechanics Research Developer - Sticks - Développeur de la recherche biomécanique - Bâtons
description: Country: Canada Job Function: Research & DevelopmentState / Province: Quebec Position Type: Full timeCity / Location: Ville St. Laurent Brand: Reebok CCMRelocation: No SelectionHockey is not just another sport. Hockey is a commitment. Of time. Of body. Of self. A commitment that is measured in bruises and missing teeth. In last second goals and divisional titles.Not everyone has it. But for those of us who do, the opportunity for greatness is immense. Commitment is at the very core of how we practice, how we play, and what we wear. For over 100 years the most committed players have geared up with one brand-CCM.Because no one is as committed to the game as we are. We are designers of true hockey equipment. For true hockey players. From the world’s best fitting skate to the world’s lightest stick.The committed players of tomorrow will be gearing up with us, but will you be?The main responsibility of the Biomechanics Research Developer - Sticks will be to advise the stick engineering development team on player mechanics in order to create and drive higher performing products. This will be achieved through detailed analysis of internal data collection (lab and field testing) and external research partners. Included in this role will be to evaluate all testing protocols from a biomechanical point of view, and conduct regular literature reviews for all product categories. This position will act as a key liaison between the development teams and our academic research partners.Responsabilities:Stick Performance Analysis• Manage the Stick Performance Laboratory including all data collectionStick Fitting Analysis• Design a method of fitting players with the correct stick for the shooting techniqueBiomechanical Research• Conduct and present research on player mechanics with an entrepreneurial spirit• Provide stick developers with insights on player techniques and interactions with products• Keep up-to-date with current research and maintain an archive of relevant scientific publications for referenceOn Ice Testing• Review and create on ice testing protocols• Conduct, analyse and report on testingAcademic Liaison• Monitor and direct projects with Academic partners for all product categoriesQualifications & Skills:• Master Degree in either Kinesiology or Biomechanics, or a relevant field and preferable to have research experience in sport; or a similar combination of educational and work related experience.• Excellent command of both English and French; Oral and written;• Ability to effectively communicate and positively influence both internal and external stakeholders;• Knowledge of Microsoft Powerpoint, Excel and Word;• Strong knowledge of research methods in biomechanics to ensure valid data collection and advanced analytical tools for investigating human movement including relevant software such a MatLab or equivalent• Strength in statistical analysis tools such as Stastictica, R, or PSPP• Ability to work efficiently and meet all internal timelines;• Excellent presentation skills, experience giving presentations• Familiarity with hockey product and marketingPosting Notes: Ville St. Laurent Quebec Canada Reebok CCM Americas No Selection

title: InfoSec Data Scientist
description: **Additional Location(s) or Information: **   ---   **Job Category: **Information Technology   **Level of Experience: **Experienced - Non Manager      **Requisition #: **R984012   **Description:**      The Business Entity   The Team   The Corporate Information Security organization is responsible for protecting the integrity, confidentiality, and availability of information and computing assets, while enabling business productivity. Our global organization strives to exemplify operational excellence, defend and protect Cisco and our customers.   About Cisco   The Internet of Everything is a phenomenon driving new opportunities for Cisco and it's transforming our customers' businesses worldwide.   Cisco’s Information Security Data Governance team is responsible for governing the handling and security of Cisco’s proprietary data, data entrusted to Cisco (e.g. customer, partner, etc.), and personal data. Our mission is to drive the how data is governed and drive the development and adoption of data-level security solutions. We do these through engaging with the business functions to drive ownership and accountability, use data science to derive data security intelligence, innovate new approaches and solutions for classic problems like data classification and inventory, and drive data security architectures.      InfoSec is taking the field of data science and applying it on towards data security. We are building a team to take on this challenge. As part of this team, you will:      • Analyze system/database/application technical specifications to determine types of data created/generated   • Collaborate with InfoSec engineer team to design data collectors from system/database/application   • Collaborate with engineers to develop data collection scripts/interfaces   • Conduct exploratory analysis of data to understand user behavior and identify information security patterns, trending, and anomalies   • Develop statistical data models to provide insights and intelligence in the security of data and automation of data protection controls   • Prepare summary report in easier to digest and graphical presentation of key findings      Qualifications:   • BS or above in Statistics, Mathematics, or Engineering   • 2+ years of experiences in data mining and analysis   • Basic knowledge on Unix/Linux system administration   • Familiar with one or more of the following languages: Perl, Python, JAVA, C++   • Experience with tools and packages: MapR, SAP Hana, Casendra, Tableau, R, MATLAB, SPSS   • Excellent analytical skills   • Good verbal and written English capability   • Ability to work with global team, spanning across multiple time-zones   • Must have a can-do attitude      **Job Type: **Experienced   **Opportunity Category: ***None

title: Senior Data Science Engineer
description: Santa Clara, CA, US  **Listing Info      **Senior Data Science Engineer   ** Data Science Santa Clara, CA, United States      ****Senior Data Science Engineer      **Analytics Santa Clara, CA      **Your goal – to improve the education process and better the lives of students -- through data and analytics.       ****Organization: Data Engineering** The Data Engineering team is central to Chegg – supporting every business line and functional organization at the company. It is a team composed of data modelers, data engineers, data science engineers and architects. The team influences strategy and tactics for Chegg’s data ecosystem.      **Role:   Data Science Engineer      **Your primary focus will be bringing to production a new set of data products and services at Chegg. These will be built upon data science, recommendation systems, and other algorithmic approaches. We have no attachment to legacy processes. You will work very closely with our Analytics team to bring Big Data solutions to our application layer. You’ll select the best technologies and influence which algorithms make sense to use.      This is a highly technical role and not for amateurs. You will need extensive experience in working with various Big Data tools, machine learning models, and engineering platforms. In addition, you must be a leader that can provide guidance and mentorship.      ** Responsibilities   **    * Influence data science algorithms and services that will be used as the backbone of recommendation engines, discovery platforms, custom matching services, and for internal analysis purposes.   * Migrate models and systems from prototype to full production.   * Participate in the architectural design of data science platforms that will unite data science capabilities with data engineering, and product engineering.   * Develop presentations to communicate broadly across the product groups and business units.    **Requirements:   **       * B.S. in Computer Science, Statistics, Math or related quantitative fields.   * 5-7 years of demonstrated success in moving systems from their prototype stage into full production.   * Have an extensive engineering toolset including an advanced understanding of MapReduce, and machine learning algorithms.   * Expert with Hadoop from both the operational and engineering perspectives   * Expert with Java in the MapReduce use case.   * Fluent in writing SQL queries for data manipulation.   * Passionate about producing high-quality engineering deliverables and communicating results to a broad audience.   * Self-motivated; independent, organized and proactive; highly responsive, flexible, and adaptable when working across multiple teams.    **Preferred:    **    * Expert in at least one of the scripting languages such as Python, Perl or Ruby.   * Experience working with Amazon EMR.    **Chegg out our culture and benefits!      ****http://www.chegg.com/jobs/benefits      ****       ****https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YYHnkwiD7Oo      ****   http://techblog.chegg.com/            ****       ****       **Chegg is an equal opportunity employer       About Chegg      Chegg puts students first and is proud to have saved students and their families more than $500 million in 2014 alone. As the leading student-first connected learning platform, Chegg's Student Hub makes higher education more affordable and more accessible, all while improving student outcomes. Chegg is a publicly-held company based in Santa Clara, California and trades on the NYSE under the symbol CHGG. For more information, visit www.chegg.com      Chegg Student Hub: What is it? https://vimeo.com/120377654      Glassdoor - Best Places to Work 2015! - http://bit.ly/GDBPTW      Chegg Saved Students and Their Families More Than $500 Million in 2014 Yahoo Finance - http://yhoo.it/1sw5p34

title: Big Data Software Engineer
description: _Description:_  EMD Millipore and EMD Serono, are affiliates** of Merck KGaA, a **leading company for innovative and top-quality high-tech products in the pharmaceutical and chemical sectors. Around 39,000 employees work in 66 countries to improve the quality of life for patients, to further the success of our customers and to help meet global challenges. We generated total revenues of € 11.1 billion in 2013 with our three businesses: Healthcare, Life Science and Performance Materials**. Currently we have an opening for Big Data Software Engineer.**  **Responsibilities:**  Responsible for architecting and developing advanced analytical solutions within a Hadoop based architecture to drive a pervasive analytical culture and enable breakthrough business objectives.  This technical role requires deep knowledge and experience with Hadoop and other big data platforms. The candidate will work closely with architects, business analyst to design and implement various parts of the new data analytics platforms. Together with key business subject matter experts they’ll work on complex analytics models.      * **Required Experience and Skills:**     * analytical and problem-solving skills, and ability to work with incomplete or imperfect data     * Ability to identify and visualize relationships within large, not obviously related data sets.     * Knowledge of the data management eco-system including: Concepts of data warehousing, ETL, data integration, etc.     * Minimum 3 years hands-on development in Java including familiarity with scripting tools such as bash shell scripts, Python and/or Perl     * 2+ years working with and developing within a Hadoop platform        * Implementing MapReduce Jobs       * Designing data queries against data in the HDFS environment using tools such as Apache Hive     * Ability to understand big data use-cases, and recommend standard design patterns commonly used in Hadoop-based deployments.     * Excellent Communication, collaboration and team skills     *   * **Desired Experience and Skills:**     * Knowledge of other big data platforms     * Experience with various visualization tools (Tableau, R, etc.)     * Experience with various database systems (i.e. Oracle)     * Experience with development tools and tools platforms (i.e. Flume, Sqoop, PIG, HIVE, etc.)     * Experience writing to network-based APIs, preferably REST/JSON or XML/SOAP     * Experience developing application using REST API architecture a plus     * Experience developing using an AGILE Methodology (i.e. SCRUM, LEAN, etc.)  **Education Minimum Requirement:**   • MSc Degree or BSc Degree or equivalent with relevant experience in Computer Science, Computer Science Engineering, Math, Data Science or equivalent experience.

title: Senior Software Development Engineer - EC2 Release Reliability Team
description: Description: Software Development Engineer Amazon EC2 Amazon Development Centre South Africa is looking for passionate, experienced software developers to join us and help to solve a challenging set of problems in space packed full of opportunities. Amazon Web Services (AWS) provides Amazon's developer customers with access to in-the-cloud infrastructure services based on Amazon's own Back End technology platform, which developers can use to enable virtually any type of business. The Cape Town based Development Center plays a key role in building the Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (Amazon EC2). Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud (EC2) is the web service that is pioneering cloud computing by providing resizable compute capacity in the cloud. It gives any developer complete control of their computing resources and lets them run on Amazon's proven computing environment. We are continuing to build the team in order to expand on our feature set and manage our rapidly increasing scale. The Release Reliability team will be responsible for tooling and automation to ensure deployments by the Cape Town teams are safe and low-effort. This team will own the end-to-end integration testing infrastructure for control plane changes, automated CM risk evaluation, and automation/integration to support the control plane deployment calendar. The ideal candidate will be clearly passionate about the large opportunity that Amazon EC2 presents and about web services in general. This person has thrived and succeeded in delivering high quality solutions in a hyper-growth environment where priorities shift fast. If you're looking to solve problems ranging from efficient resource allocation in the face of imperfect information, building touchless automation to manage millions of machines, or sifting through billion row databases looking for patterns then drop us a line. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer. Basic Qualifications:    * Bachelor's or honor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or equivalent   * 8+ years of industry experience in a software development environment   * Strong customer focus   * Some experience with Ruby, Perl, Java or C/C++   * Some experience with Linux development aws-sdesdm-ea Preferred Qualifications:    * 10+ years of industry experience in a Linux environment.   * Masters or PhD in Computer Science or equivalent   * Experience in large scale software systems   * Data Science skills in machine learning or statistical analysis is a plus   * Strong analytical skills with excellent problem solving abilities   * Knowledge of system performance methodologies along with hands on empirical monitoring   * Strong desire to build, sense of ownership, urgency, and drive   * Excellent written communication and verbal agility are strong assets   * Demonstrated ability to achieve stretch goals in a highly innovative and fast paced environment   * Expertise in delivering high-quality, innovative applications

title: Business and Supply Chain Analytics Manager (m/f)
description: Working area: Logistics & Supply Chain Management Location: BASF Business Services Holding GmbH, Ludwigshafen Working hours: Full-time Contract type: Permanent Reference code: EN54782928_ONLE_1 Please apply online at www.basf.com/career or in writing to BASF Services Europe GmbH Recruiting Services Europe PO Box 11 02 48 10832 Berlin, Germany For more information please contact: Tel.: 00800 33 0000 33 E-Mail: jobs@basf.com Business and Supply Chain Analytics Manager (m/f) We are the world's leading chemical company because we offer intelligent solutions for our customers and for a sustainable future. We link and develop people with diverse talents all over the world. For you, this means a variety of ways to advance. Not only your performance but also your personality matter to us. At BASF, careers develop from opportunities. The innovative service portfolio of BASF Business Services Holding GmbH ranges from consultancy, development and operations to shaping and optimising business processes. With many years of experience, we support the BASF Group's global business process to become more effective and efficient. What you can expect For our unit Supply Chain Strategy Development we are looking for a Business and Supply Chain Analytics Manager. In this position you will develop a supply chain analytics team and identify relevant Supply Chain analytics problems and scope them through continuous dialogues with business units and customers supported by community work. Furthermore, you will initiate, conduct and lead analytics, big-data projects as well as feasibility studies within the Supply Chain. In this regard, you will cooperate closely with Data Scientists and partners, develop and recommend actions and prepare the respective roll-outs and roadmaps for a sustainable result utilization. By this, you facilitate matching business requirements with new analytical solutions in the evolving \big-data\" and analytic environment. Moreover, you will evaluate innovative developments in data science provided by market players and external research institutions. What we expect You have successfully completed a degree in business studies or economics focussing on Supply Chain Management and have gained several years' professional experience in this area. You, therefore, have a solid understanding of Supply Chain Operations and dispose of deep expertise in Project Management. You are well versed in the use of IT applications, especially MS PowerPoint and MS Excel, as well as statistics programs and SAP Reporting. You can prove your communication skills in English and German and are used to presenting your results clearly and compe- tently. If you are a real team player, we look forward to receiving your application. We offer Responsibility from day one in a challenging work environment and \"on-the-job\" training as part of a committed team. Competitive compensation including attractive benefits as well as excellent career opportunities in an international company. Expect to be surprised by the exciting range of career opportunities at BASF. Do you want to know more? Meet our employees for an online chat on www.basf.com/en/company/career/connected-minds.html"

title: (Senior) Software Developer für Data Science (m/w) - xplosion interactive GmbH
description: ### Stellenbeschreibung  Stellenbeschreibung  xplosion interactive ist ein junges Unternehmen der Digital Advertising Szene in Hamburg und Spezialist für dynamisches Retargeting und Data-Driven- Products. Unser Team aus Digital Natives, Marketingexperten sowie Daten- und Technologie-Spezialisten hilft Online- und E-Commerce-Kunden, Digitalkampagnen markengerecht und performance-orientiert zu planen und umzusetzen. xplosion interactive gehört zu InteractiveMedia CCSP GmbH und gliedert sich so in die Konzernstruktur der Deutsche Telekom AG ein.  In unserem Hamburger Büro bieten wir Dir neben einem spannenden Aufgabengebiet mit Eigenverantwortung und Entwicklungsmöglichkeiten viel Raum für eigene Ideen. Auf Dich wartet ein moderner und technisch hervorragend ausgestatteter Arbeitsplatz in toller Arbeitsatmosphäre mit einem jungen und erfolgreichen Team.  Weitere Informationen findest Du unter www.xplosion.de.  Zur Unterstützung unseres Data Science suchen wir **ab sofort **einen    **(Senior) Software Developer für Data Science (m/w)**  zur Festanstellung  **Deine Aufgaben**    * Du entwickelst und pflegst unsere JVM-basierten Frameworks für das maschinelle Lernen, die Optimierung und automatisierte Entscheidungsfindung.   * Du entwickelst Software in enger Zusammenarbeit mit Data Scientists: Du bist deren „Enabler“ und überführst z. B. moderne Lernalgorithmen in die Produktion.   * Zum Aufgabenspektrum zählt ebenso die Auswahl von Technologien, Bibliotheken und Frameworks als auch der Entwurf von Architekturen für Data Processing Systeme.   * Du implementierst, testet und evaluierst Lern- und Optimierungsalgorithmen im Kontext von aktuellen Big Data Technologien (Hadoop, Spark, gängige Streaming-Frameworks)    **Dein Profil**    * Abgeschlossenes Universitätsstudium der Informatik (Master/Diplom)   * min. 2-3 Jahre Berufserfahrung als Softwareentwickler   * Gute bis sehr gute Mathematikkenntnisse (lineare Algebra, Statistik, Optimierung, Numerik)   * Nachgewiesene Kenntnis von Machine Learning Methoden und Algorithmen   * Erfahrung im Umgang mit einschlägigen Machine Learning Bibliotheken bzw. Frameworks (z. B. Weka, Mahout, Torch, etc.)    * Fundierte Kenntnisse in der Verwaltung großer Datenmengen mit relationalen und NoSQL-Datenbanken    **Was wir bieten**    * Cutting-Edge Technologien und das Arbeiten auf Daten, die in Bezug auf Qualität und Volumen deutschlandweit einzigartig sind.   * Die Möglichkeit, in einem hochmotivierten und –qualifiziertem Team von Big Data- und Machine Learning Enthusiasten Forschung und Entwicklung zu betreiben.   * Überdurchschnittliche Vergütung: Spitzenleistung wissen wir zu schätzen und sie wird belohnt.   * Flache Hierarchien, eine Kultur der Wertschätzung, hervorragendes Arbeitsklima und exzellente Karrieremöglichkeiten.   * Ausführliche Einarbeitung in das Online-Business durch kompetente Kollegen.   * Ein Büro in zentrumsnaher Lage über den Dächern von Hamburg mit Blick auf die Außenalster, hervorragender Anbindung an die öffentlichen Verkehrsmittel und Zuschuss zur ProfiCard der HVV.  ** **  **Interessiert?**  Deine Bewerbungsunterlagen sendest Du über unsere Jobbörse. Bei Fragen steht Dir Adeline Paasch unter 040/2850 7000 gerne zur Verfügung.

title: INFRASTRUCTURE/OPERATIONS CAPACITY ENGINEER - BANKING SYSTEMS
description: **The Company**  Our client is one of Australia's leading and largest Financial Services Organization that has expanded its operations beyond the Australian shores. The organization has a large range of financial offerings to both public and private clients across the retail, corporate and institutional banking areas. They have a very large technical footprint that combine a dynamic range of technologies in a complex landscape. Due to internal promotion they now require a technical (Infrastructure/Operations) Lead Capacity (demand management) and Performance Engineer with a passion for Data Science/Analytics and Modelling as it relates to the Resiliency and High Availability of business critical banking systems.  **The Group**  This Performance team has a very large remit, to evaluate and improve bank wide systems with a focus on high availability, performance, scalability and reliability. Comprised of Solution Performance Engineers they are accountable for the availability health of key production systems with a particular focus on governing, evaluating, managing and influencing non-functional risks & attributes across the solution delivery life cycle (requirements, design & architecture, testing). This accountability traverses to the production environment with accountability for capacity planning and providing quality assurance over the accuracy of tactical performance, capacity and availability analytics delivered by other teams.  **The Role**  After laying the groundwork and initiating the creation of an advanced Capacity and Performance based algorithmic analytics and modelling system for the banks performance group the current incumbent is moving into a more senior position. To fill these shoes, so to speak, you'll need a thorough understanding of IT Performance, Resilience, High Availability and Capacity (Demand Management) across business critical banking/transactional systems as it relates to the world of Operations (DevOps). To be successful in the performance group you'll need a holistic/enterprise understanding of how all technology layers, Infrastructure (OS, Database, Networks), Middleware/Messaging and Application, interrelate and ultimately affect large, high volume web portals. Essentially you'll be responsible for the analysis of these systems and to work with the business to optimize, eliminate bottlenecks and project future usage. There's a large emphasis on Data Science (Big Data)/Analytics and modelling so proficiency in this area along with related technologies like: R, Hadoop, Haskell or similar are essential.  **Skills required**    * Expertise in IT Capacity and Performance: Data Science/Analytics, Statistics and Modelling.    * An Infrastructure/Operations (DevOps) background with a deep understanding of how all technology layers: Infrastructure (OS, DB, NW), Middleware/Messaging and Application interrelate.    * A strong base in Infrastructure or Operations (Support) ideally DevOps.    * Deep understanding of systems architecture in large complex organisations.    * Experience performance tuning large, complex web portals and/or Back End systems - experience in Telco, Gaming/Betting, Transactional, Trading Systems would be advantageous.    * Technically proficient with Data Science/Big Data Tools: R, Ruby, Hadoop, Haskell or similar.    * Technology related Degree/Diploma and/or industry relevant certifications.   * Full, unrestricted Australian work rights (Citizen/PR).  **Keywords: **Capacity Planning, Capacity Lead, High Availability, Infrastructure, Performance Metrics, Tuning, Optimisation, High Volume Portals, Data Science/Analytics, Statistics, Modelling.  If this position interests you, please submit your resume via the 'Apply Now' button or email. Or for further information please contact **Daniel** quoting reference **CAPSTONE**.  Unfortunately this opportunity does not offer visa sponsorship so please only apply if you already have full working rights for Australia.  **All communications will be treated as confidential and the more we know about you the better we can help you ...**  iKas International Finance Technology Specialists

title: Data Science Engineer (m/w) (Informatiker/in (Hochschule))
description: Job ID: 180858   Location: München   Organisation: Infrastructure & Cities Sector   Mode of Employment: Unbefristet      Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied            In der Division Mobility sind die Zugtechnik und die Bahnautomatisierung von Siemens zusammengefasst. Die beiden Bereiche adressieren das Wachstumsfeld Smart Mobility mit intelligenten und integrierten Lösungen. Dazu gehören unter anderem Schienenfahrzeuge und die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen, Bahnelektrifizierung, Infrastrukturlogistik sowie intelligente Verkehrs- und Transportsysteme.            Werden Sie jetzt Teil unseres Teams von Mobility als Data Science Engineer (m/w) in München.            Was sind meine Aufgaben?            \\- Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen zur Datenanalytik bestehend aus entsprechenden Technologien, Algorithmen und Applikationen – von der Ideenentwicklung über Prototypen bis hin zu skalierbaren industriellen Systemen   \\- Identifizierung und Bewertung unbekannter Beziehungen in den Daten vom Fahrzeugen, Infrastruktur und anderen Daten um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen   \\- Durchführung explorativer Datananalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen   \\- Erstellung wiederverwendbarer analytischer Modelle und Operationalisierung solcher Modelle in der Analytikplattform   \\- Erstellung entsprechender Visualisierungen für die Ergebnisse derartiger analytischer Modelle   \\- Zusammenarbeit mit Businessverantwortlichen zum Verständnis der Geschäftsanforderungen und zur Identifizierung von Geschäftsmöglichkeiten durch Datenanalytik   \\- Implementierung und Management von “Big Data”-Projekten mit dem Fokus auf moderner Datenanalytik, maschinellem Lernen und industriellen Applikationen      Was bringe ich mit?            \\- Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder ähnlicher Fachrichtungen   \\- Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Kontext von “Data science” und moderner Datenanalytik   \\- Starke Erfahrungen in Technologien, Algorithmen und Methoden zur Datenanalytik, insbesondere im Umfeld Data Mining, maschinellem Lernen und Simulation   \\- Kenntnissen relationaler Datenbanken (SQL) und NoSQL-Datenbanken bzw. Hadoop, sowie Programmierkenntnisse insbesondere in Java, C# oder C++   \\- Erfahrung in der Nutzung analytischer Tools und Systeme, insbesondere R und anderer Arbeitswerkzeuge zum Data Mining   \\- Fähigkeit Schlussfolgerungen aus Daten zu ziehen und entsprechende Handlungen vorzuschlagen   \\- Starke Präsentations- und Kommunikationsfähigkeiten, insbesondere die Fähigkeit komplexe Analysen in klarer und umsetzbarer Form den Geschäften zu kommunizieren   \\- Selbstmotivation, Initiative, Durchsetzungsfähigkeit und starke Ergebnisorientierung      So treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt – einfach und direkt            www.siemens.com/mobility   wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über den Geschäftsbereich erfahren möchten   +49 (9131) 7-35335   wenn Sie erste Fragen gern persönlich mit unserem Recruiting Team klären möchten   www.siemens.de/karriere/FAQs   wenn Sie mehr Informationen über den Bewerbungsablauf und unsere Leistungen für Mitarbeiter erfahren möchten

title: Data Science Engineer (m/w)

Dazu gehören unter anderem Schienenfahrzeuge und die   dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen, Bahnelektrifizierung, Infrastrukturlogistik sowie intelligente   Verkehrs- und Transportsysteme.  Werden Sie jetzt Teil unseres Teams von Mobility als   Data Science Engineer (m/w) in München.  **Ihr neues Aufgabenfeld –   herausfordernd und zukunftsorientiert**    * Entwicklung innovativer Lösungen zur Datenanalytik bestehend aus entsprechenden Technologien, Algorithmen und Applikationen – von der Ideenentwicklung über Prototypen bis hin zu skalierbaren industriellen Systemen   * Identifizierung und Bewertung unbekannter Beziehungen in den Daten vom Fahrzeugen, Infrastruktur und anderen Daten um businessrelevante Erkenntnisse zu gewinnen   * Durchführung explorativer Datananalysen in komplexen Datenstrukturen   * Erstellung wiederverwendbarer analytischer Modelle und Operationalisierung solcher Modelle in der Analytikplattform   * Erstellung entsprechender Visualisierungen für die Ergebnisse derartiger analytischer Modelle   * Zusammenarbeit mit Businessverantwortlichen zum Verständnis der Geschäftsanforderungen und zur Identifizierung von Geschäftsmöglichkeiten durch Datenanalytik   * Implementierung und Management von “Big Data”-Projekten mit dem Fokus auf moderner Datenanalytik, maschinellem Lernen und industriellen Applikationen  **Ihre Qualifikationen –   fundiert und adäquat**    * Erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium der Informatik, Mathematik, Physik, Ingenieurswissenschaften oder ähnlicher Fachrichtungen   * Mehrjährige Erfahrung im Kontext von “Data science” und moderner Datenanalytik   * Starke Erfahrungen in Technologien, Algorithmen und Methoden zur Datenanalytik, insbesondere im Umfeld Data Mining, maschinellem Lernen und Simulation   * Kenntnissen relationaler Datenbanken (SQL) und NoSQL-Datenbanken bzw.
